description:
Ristorante Milano... what can I say "mi sono innamorato di te" I fell in love with you! The place is a very small but super cozy restaurant, makes you feel like you are in Italy somewhere. 

Everyone in the kitchen speaks Italian and or Spanish and they are a busy kitchen, hustling to bring out amazing food to the tables. 

I attended a private event and I was glad that the only decision I had to make was to choose a protein or main course and dessert if any! By the way, I ordered both. And this was a true Italian feast. 

For appetizers we had crostini with mushrooms, a delicious and super light arugula salad with fresh burrata, a nice caprese salad and grilled calamari with white beans! By now I could barely move on to the pasta course, which consisted of two choices of home made pasta... by now I was in foodie heaven! But they took it even a step further and had an amazing portion of fish with grilled veggies. 

For dessert we all shared the tiramisu and the pera. Which was by far my favorite. The pear was nicely poached soaked in syrup and served with a side of pear granita or chilled purée. It was be perfect combination of warm and cold elements, as well as sweet and spicy in a very cohesive way.

We closed the night with a nice cappuccino. A super memorable experience of high quality Italian cuisine in San Francisco!
author: Gabriela K.

description:
Cute restaurant. Came on a weekday dinner. Seems like the restaurant attracts the older crowd. This restaurant has been in the neighborhood for years. 

Good:
The olive oil with the complementary bread is SO good. Definitely ask for extra refills of that olive oil.
Loved the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa: Creamy with tons of mushrooms.
Loved the Fettucine alla Ghiotta: Great balance of meat and cream.

Great service. Quality fresh pasta. Yum.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Great Italian restaurant tucked into a quaint corner of Nob Hill. Charming and cozy interior with gracious staff and most importantly delicious food featuring homemade pastas. We started with an instalata Romana and Fragole and bruschetta. Vine ripened tomatoes and fresh burrata, delicious. We moved on to fettuccine al sugo and fettuccine with crean sauce and sausage both were so good we asked for bread to sop up the sauce. I'm Sicilian and no one beats my moms sauce. But they have (don't tell my mom ). Pair your entree with their excellent selection of Italian reds. I recommend the montepulciano d'abruzzo! 

We finished with very good espresso and gelato. Overall our new favorite Italian place for when we're craving authentic italian food.
author: Timoteo K.

description:
3.5 Stars.

Ristorante Milano is one of those restaurants in San Francisco that quietly turns out solid food....for over 35 Years!!!!!!

I haven't been here since Duran Duran was popular ( thank god that's past!!!)

Really nothing has changed save for the prices. Food is still solid. Ambiance is still warm and cozy. Service is friendly and personal ( if they know you omg...its muwah muwah muwah from Aldo!)

Great fresh fish dishes that are prepared simply. All pastas are made in house with sauces that are made from scratch.

If I were to really plead to you to try one dish it would be that amazing Lasagna ( served only on the weekends I believe). It is made of these intricate thin layers of pasta, with a bechamel, cheese, and tomatoes...it could be one of the best out there.

Small dessert offerings but all are very good. The Tiramisu is very good ( thank you Aldo for the birthday surprise!)

Lovely simple salads.

A simple wine list that presents mostly Italian wines and some Californian  as well.

Parking is insane around here but they have an arraignment with parking near by.

Abbondanza !!!!!!
author: David G.

description:
What a lovely evening at Milano. Really friendly service and delicious food. My partner took me here on our Friday date night and I was absolutely swooning.

The restaurant is tucked away in Russian Hill/ Nob Hill right off of Hyde. The quaint restaurant is cozy and warm. Walking in, we were greeted right away with smiles and we chose to sit on the mezzanine (great choice). We ordered wine, ate some yummy bread (their olive oil is out of this world), split the Burrata, and then got to the good stuff: homemade pasta!

The Burrata appetizer was delish. I love Burrata, no restaurant can screw that up! For the main course,  I ordered Fettucine alla Ghiotta ($19) and my man decided on the Amatriciana with Rigatoni ($19?). Damn that pasta is FRESH! If you want some good homemade pasta, you have to try this spot. My partner described the flavor as umami- it really did touch all of our taste buds. My ONLY complaint was that the cream sauce on my pasta was pretty heavy. I felt quite bloated after eating it. I usually don't order cream sauce pastas for that reason. It was still delicious.

The service was also a highlight. Everyone was so sweet! Our favorite was the busboy that evening. I wish I had gotten his name, he was a star (and really funny). They were super on it and made us feel very special.
author: Hannah S.

description: Delicious, simple, classic Italian food. Good service in a super cozy little place off of Van Ness.
author: Kevin S.

description:
This is my favorite Italian Restaurant in San Francisco. It's very intimate, warm like your Italian Grandmas house ( I'm Irish ) Aldo the owner is an amazing guy. The food was spectacular.
I had the ravioli stuffed with sausages with Gorgonzola cheese. I'll give you a money back guarantee. If you don't like it I'll give you $10 if it's the best thing ever send me $5. I'll be retired in a year. For entree I recommend the Veal  Chop 
Or the Scallopine Vi Vitello. Followed by the Torta Caprese aka Chocolate Almond Cake. Make sure you request Natalia!! For wine I head the Montepulciano Abrezzo. Happy Dining !!
author: K C T.

description:
The only place I've ever been to where the waitress managed to spill wine all over me and the sweet busser was left wiping it out of my hair. 

The rest of my meal was meh. It wasn't bad but I didn't think it was particularly fantastic - especially for the price. We ordered the arugula and burrata appetizer along with the gnocchi. I wasn't impressed the way I am with some places. 

The wine was good though.
author: Analisa S.

description: I will give them credit for taking us late in the evening half hour before they were to close.  But the food itself was really nothing to get excited about . The mixed green salad was very basic, and the pasta was only okay.  The pasta was a bit over cooked (I prefer al dente) and the spaghetti meat sauce was a bit bland . There wasn't much flavor.  Maybe we need to go back when they aren't about to close for the night.
author: Vivian W.

description:
We just returned from a family vacation in Italy where the food is wonderful. Ristorante Milano is the closest thing in SF to dining in Italy! Everything is authentic, fresh and delicious! Aldo and the staff treat you like family.
One of our favorites!
author: Howard Z.

description: If I rate the food alone, I'd give it 4 stars. Its not exceptional, but it is pretty good. However, I've been here twice now, and both times the service was particularly slow. For one thing, I noticed our server take a break after I mentioned we were in a bit of a rush and would like the check (waited 5-10 min to get the check). Lastly, everything was overpriced. I hate giving low ratings though, so I gave them a three :).
author: Robert C.

description: This is a fantastic authentic Italian bistro. The food was fantastic the veal, and pasta was amazing. The desert was a mixture of egg yolks, Marsala sugar. Best desert
author: Ian G.

description:
my boyfriend's coworker recommended this place for dinner, so my boyfriend took me here for my birthday. we made reservations ahead of time in case we couldn't get a table. we decided to do family style and ordered: Calamari alla Griglia, Gnocchi con Salsa Aurora, Fettucine alla Ghiotta, and Hazelnut Gelato.

we enjoyed all three dishes a lot. i recommend the calamari dish if you love calamari! the gnocchi sauce was delicious. i ended up dipping the complimentary bread in the sauce for flavoring. the fettuccine was delicious as well. i also recommend ordering the hazelnut gelato, it's pretty damn good. my only complaint is the small portion size, other than that, the food was great! 

notes: the atmosphere is pretty casual. no need to dress up, since most people in the restaurant were wearing casual clothing. the restaurant is kind of small, not really recommended for large groups. you might want to make reservations ahead of time if you do plan to go with a big group. parking is pretty bad in nob hill, so i would recommend public transportation or getting dropped off. the waitresses/waiters were attentive. it's a nice, cozy place to bring a date.
author: Sylvia H.

description: Clean, simple honest Northern cuisine.  Attentive owner and staff.  All at our table cleaned our plates.
author: Steve M.

description: One of the best Italian spots in the city. Great wines and service as well. Parking is hard to find so I recommend a cab or uber. Its worth it!
author: Lanai T.

description:
Ristorante Milano has officially become our favorite neighborhood gem! My husband and I have been wanting to come here for a while since we live so close, but the restaurant is small, and was always at 100% capacity whenever we stopped by. Luckily, we were able to get in last night. I highly recommend making reservations here because if you walk in without one, you'll most likely be waiting an hour or so.

Service was very friendly and accommodating. Our server was from Pisa, Italy which made the experience feel even more authentic. They also allow you to bring your own bottle of wine ($25) which we really liked. The menu is not big, but not small either. They offer the perfect amount of dishes and it was actually hard for us to choose because everything looked so good! They also offer specials as well. 

My husband and I started with the Verdure alla Griglia (grilled vegetables with shallots and balsamic dressing). The portion size was just right for the two of us and we appreciated the different assortment of vegetables on the plate. We loved the grilled/charred flavor and the balsamic dressing was very tasty!

However, our minds were blown over their pastas! We shared the Fettucine al Sugo di Carne alla Milanese (housemade fettucine with Milanese meat sauce) and the Capelli d'Angelo al Filetto di Pomodoro (housemade angel hair pasta, fresh tomatoes, olive oil, garlic). The pastas are all made in house and the dishes tasted AUTHENTIC. What I loved the most about the angel hair pasta was that the tomatoes tasted so fresh and the dish was very saucy which is my favorite.

This is honestly the best Italian food I have ever had after coming back from Italy a few months ago. That's the best way I can describe the food here. 5 stars well deserved!
author: Chisholm T.

description: EXCELLENT meal! The putanesca was the best I've ever had! Our gnocchi and salad were great too. We went for my daughter's birthday and they treated her so sweetly and gave her gelato with a birthday candle. The waiters were super nice - especially Orlando. We will definitely come here every time we visit SF!
author: Gerry B.

description: Our favorite neighborhood restaurant with incredible food and great service! Recommend to anyone looking for an intimate gathering spot with rotating seasonal specials and an impressive wine list.
author: Becca A.

description:
Ristorante Milano. This review is beyond overdue and after coming here on several separate occasions, you were absolutely fabulous down to the last detail, and I absolutely just can't rave about how much I absolutely adore you. 

I had come here on a whim with a date based off of recommendations from many others here on Yelp and had booked reservations with them online before, which I would highly recommend as it is a very popular restaurant. When I had arrived, though it was packed, I had reserved through Opentable, which I'd recommend. However, regardless if you wait or make a reservation online, the food is most certainly worth the wait. The owner, Aldo was extremely sweet and was really helpful when it came to suggestions and did his best to make sure we were comfortable and at ease. The hospitality was very sweet and as receiving as well.

The atmosphere was very intimate. Candlelit and with a flower in the middle of the table, it was certainly dim but romantic. A wonderful recommendation to take someone on a date.

(I will also note that their bathroom is tiny, it's virtually a closet right next to the wines. It's actually verging on too small, but you come to this establishment to dine, not for the bathroom though, right?)

We had started off with an order of the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa based off of the recommendations of many fellow Yelpers, and we absolutely didn't regret it at all. By far, hands down one of the best pastas I've ever had the pleasure to consume. The light, housemade pasta in a light, creamy sauce, infused with their porcini mushrooms and Italian sausage were both creamy and gave a nice earthy flavor to the dish.

We also had ordered the Gnocchi con Salsa Aurora, which was also amazing, though I still preferred the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa over the Gnocchi. Though the gnocchi was delicious, the creamy tomato and cheese melting in my mouth with every bite, I also noted it was a little cold when it was served to us.

We then decided to end the meal on the Tiramisu, which was absolutely perfect. The Tiramisu was fluffy and with a nice coffee flavor infused in the cake itself. The top was dashed in cocoa powder. Although I never thought I was really a fan of Tirimisu, I'd have to recommend the Tirimisu here. It's probably one of the best Tirimisu's I've eaten. 

I also had a glass of their Rose, which paired nicely with the pasta we ordered.

For my personal experiences, I've had a couple of issues personally booking special requests and making reservations,  though I don't want to take away from how wonderful the restaurant is, and to be fair, the errors were quickly amended to. The times where I had booked or had made a reservation in advance, I had made special requests, and these errors were made 
. - The first time I made a special request, it was my male companion's birthday. I had asked to have a special birthday dessert made for them, but to my horror on the day of, it was instead presented to the couple seated next to us instead who also had coincidentally the same name as I did when I made the request. When the couple next to us had denied that it was theirs/ it was not a special occasion for them, the waitress instead of taking back the dessert gave it to them on the house, while I sat in shock watching my surprise for my friend to be ruined. 

To be fair though, I think after having someone watching my horror from behind the kitchen, it was made up with a tiramisu, by the same person who had made the error to the couple next to me, so it was sweet of them to make up for it (even though we were still charged for the error, sadly :(   )

The second time I had a minor issue with the service was when I had booked a table well in advance of a couple of days before dining here, and when I showed up to my dismay, at the time I had reserved it for (late night at around 6-7) there was no seating really available despite I had booked in advanced on Opentable. (It was a full house when me and my other companion had arrived). However, my server graciously let us go next and move past the other people who were waiting in line outside.

Overall I would still rate Milano a very high middle 4 leaning to a 5, the only thing not pushing it to a 5 for me would be my prior experiences booking things in advance, and the higher price tag. I strongly believe that if you come here, you won't be disappointed at all whatsoever and that you'll love this entire place to pieces from the hospitality down to the food. I have and will continue to recommend Ristorante Milano.
author: Allison O.

description:
Delightful, intimate trattoria in an area where you're spoiled for choice as far as Italian cuisine goes. All the dishes we tried, whether an appetizer of grilled calamari, a seasonal spring risotto, or the grigliata mista - quite a meaty dish full grilled sausage, chicken breast, and lamb - were fresh, delicious, and prepared just right. Nothing ostentatious, but by no means amateurish, either. 

Service was friendly and engaging, and the venue has several "tiers" that somehow make it seem larger, yet more private, than it really is. Another good find thanks to Yelp!
author: Vincent L.

description:
Such friendly service and amazing food.  I've lived across the street for almost a year and can't believe I've neglected this place so long.

Finally tried it during a family visit and it blew our expectations.  The tonnarelli and milk fed veal were lovely.  Portions are generous but not over the top.  

New fav Italian spot in the city!
author: Timan G.

description:
Just had a great experience on a recent trip to SF.  Both delicious, quality Italian food and top-notch professional service.  After seeing the other yelp reviews, I gave this restaurant a try and was not disappointed.  I started off with one of the special salads that had strawberries and also tried the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa, which had fresh made pasta with mushrooms and sausage in a cream sauce.  The pasta was cooked perfectly and still had that slightly stretchy and chewy feel, and the sauce had a nice mild taste which was offset by the mushrooms/sausage.   They also had a solid Italian wine selection, I went with the Montepulciano, which was very good.  

As to service, when I arrived, my table wasn't ready yet even though I had a reservation.  It seemed like they were very busy at right around the time I arrived.  The hostess who greeted me was very nice and let me know my table was almost ready.  It ended up taking a while, and there wasn't really a waiting area, so I just stood near the inside of the doorway.  However I have nothing bad to say about the service, they were very apologetic and professional and as soon as a table opened up, I was quickly seated.  They even provided a complimentary wine for the inconvenience, which says a lot about how they value their customers.  And during the meal, my server was very nice and helpful about recommendations and attentive in checking in.

I greatly enjoyed my dinner here, and would definitely come back next time I'm in the SF area!
author: Kristin S.

description: The food would probably feel a little less pricy and mediocre if the service were of higher quality but, alas, it's not. And running out of the main dinner special at 7:30pm on a Sunday seems like poor planning on their part. Seat people at their reservation time, have non-alcoholic beverage options other than coffee and water and hire a third server so we don't have to watch the two guys running around in a sweaty frenzy. People have to walk up a big-ass hill for your restaurant; make it worth their while. Three stars for the desserts.
author: Chris O.

description: Amazing local italian... very sweet staff and owner. They made us feel welcome, great service and Food!
author: Jessica B.

description: Very fresh and all pastas are made in house. The pasta was excellent and served hot as pasta should be. Great neighborhood spot with the local crowd to support them. Servers are very talented and the Owner is always on site making sure the meals are served to perfection!
author: GREG C.

description:
Wonderful food and a wonderful staff.

I started with a Moretti lager that went well with the amazing bruschetta that was brought to the table.  We ordered one bruschetta each for the six of us at the table.  They are large with the tastiest tomatoes and mozzarella cheese that I have had in a while.

I also asked for the mixed grilled vegetables (with shallots and a balsamic dressing).  They brought a small but amazing combo of eggplant, zucchini etc.  

The soup of the day was a minestrone with lentils.  We ordered that too.  It was good but I thought that the broth could have been tastier.

I treated myself to a glass of Amarone, "Lenotti", Veneto.  This delicious red wine is from the area around Venice.  Supple, full bodied, lip smacking and also $25 a glass.

For my main entree, I asked for the house made fettucine noodles served with a Milanese sauce.  (beef and sausage)  Very nice!  Loved and appreciated the house made pasta!

Tiramisu and an espresso finished things up.  The tiramisu was light with a strong, coffee infused flavor.  It was heavy on the cocoa powder but excellent nonetheless.

Our Italian server really made the night.  He was charming. 

The restaurant was completely full--you'll definetly need a reservation.  Parking in that area as you can imagine is horrendous.  There is a parking garage on Polk/Pacific.  We paid a $10 flat rate and walked a few blocks to the restaurant.
Cheaper than Uber!
author: Thomas D.

description: Cozy & quaint neighborhood restaurant! Great authentic food with good variety & personable wait staff & owner, Aldo
author: Elpie K.

description:
This was a delicious find! We were starving and didn't have reservations on a recent Friday night.  Craving authentic Italian food, we snagged a reservation on Open Table and Uber'd our way over to Nob Hill.  We were seated at a small table inside. The place is small and very friendly.

We started, as usual, with Calamari. This calamari was local, grilled Monterey Bay squid and a cannellini bean salad. Delicious. We also got bread and oil to start.

For meals, I had the Gnocchi con Salsa Aurora and he had the Fettucine al Sugo di Carne alla Milanese. Everything was to perfection. I still think about the sauce; it was so flavorful.   The menu isn't big but the choices are very unique and delicious. 

We also had a bottle of wine, a Chianti (around $40), which came highly recommended and complimented the meal. 

The prices were perfect too. I highly recommend this spot; it's almost like being in Italy!
author: Milee S.

description:
We went to the Ristorante Milano at 8:30p on a Tuesday and the restaurant was on the lighter side, which was great. Sitting in the side room at the front of the restaurant felt intimate without being totally secluded and the service (for an area without direct view to kitchen or staff) was still very good!

We had the seafood risotto (rice a bit too al dente for me personally, but still very much within the expected range of risotto) and the tonnarelli alla capricciosa (MUST TRY), both of which were very tasty.

I'd recommend this restaurant for groups of 4 or less, especially if you're looking for a more private/intimate experience.
author: Clayton S.

description:
I've been to Milano many many times throughout the years I have lived here in San Francisco. But tonight, Valentine's Day, was one the most humorous and one of the more slightly disappointing dining experiences I've had. 

I ordered the Gnocchi Aurora- which on the menu states gnocchi, gorgonzola, and tomatoes. The sauce on a regular basis had been very creamy, rich, and packed with flavor. It was the regular choice and my go to order any time that I came here. I guess recently, they started to add a blue cheese topping that is not stated on the menu. Personally, I am not a picky eater whatsoever- but blue cheese is one of those things that bring my mouth to the verge of death and despair. 
So with that being said, they brought the dish out which had a vastly large amount of blue cheese crumbles on it- I tried to pick it off and had a bite just to try, but honestly couldn't take it. I was craving that gnocchi dish I had from the Milano I always knew. So hesitantly, I told them that I was very sorry and couldn't eat this dish due to the blue cheese. They happily brought me another gnocchi- now this is where it gets a little funny. A miscommunication or misunderstanding perhaps. 

Instead of bringing a gnocchi with no blue cheese, they brought a gnocchi with no cheese or cream at all. Just gnocchi with red sauce. I laughed, but at this point was so hungry- I couldn't bother them anymore for a third dish of what I was asking for. 

Moral of the story is- make sure to specify very clearly what you want or else you get a pasta dish made for lactose and tolerant people; noodle and red sauce. 

Outside of the gnocchi- the biratta with fennel was amazing as always. The staff are so friendly and the owner is always there making sure your meal is going swell. Every time I've gone here, I've gotten treated so nicely and always leave with a smile.
author: Camille L.

description: I'd make this a 4.5 if I could. Good, solid Italian food served in a really homey atmosphere that seems personal and friendly. Excellent service. I came out feeling really glad I had gone and that I'd found a place I can go back to many, many times.
author: Dave S.

description:
Authentic Italian food with warm, attentive service in a tucked away spot in Russian hill! We walked in on a weekend night and there were a few tables available. The restaurant is cozy and a perfect place for a date! Each table had a candle and rose which was a nice touch.

The complimentary bread and olive oil was just okay. The bread was pretty dry but the actual meal definitely made up for it. We ordered the burrata ($14) appetizer which is cheese made with mozzarella and cream and was soo soft and creamy.

Ordered the gnocchi with gorgonzola, tomatoes, and basil ($19). The sauce was very creamy and flavorful and the gnocchi very soft. My boyfriend got the thin pasta with mushrooms, cream, and Italian sausage ($19). As good as my gnocchi dish was this was my favorite. It has such a rich flavor and the pasta was a perfect texture. I don't like mushrooms much but I thought this dish had such a unique taste.

Ended the night with pear and strawberry sorbet ($9). It was extremely refreshing and tasted so fresh like the ingredients had just been blended into it. Overall definitely recommend coming here especially for a date night!
author: Linda X.

description: This was a great neighborhood spot. It is small and cozy with tight seating. Great pasta and our Hawaiian swordfish was entree was excellent ! i will return often as it is a charming place.
author: Rashid I.

description: Absolutely speechless how amazing this restaurant was. I'm an atheist but this restaurant makes me believe there is a God and that he's a chef in the kitchen blessing the pasta. 100% would and will come back again.
author: Emily R.

description: If you're looking for authentic Italian food in San Francisco, Ristorante Milano is the place be. This is a hidden gem in the city as it's on overlooked side street but that is also what makes it cozy. The fettucine dishes, the gnocchi, and the tasty fish of the day are just some of the things I've had and recommend. Very friendly staff as well. As a frequent visitor of Italy in the past, it's hard to be satisfied when you miss the food over there. This place does the trick.
author: Gordon Z.

description: Excellent restaurant. Delicious cutlery licking food and nicest owner and the staff. Our favorite dessert wasn't available so they gave another complimentary dessert. Also, met a lovely elderly couple who has been coming to the restaurant on New Year's Eve from the last 30 years. Our new year eve was totally made. We are so going back there again and will bring friends.
author: Nids S.

description:
I went to Ristorante Miano with two of my friends who are new to the City. I had never been here. It is quaint and small on the inside. It does get pretty loud because of the acoustics of the restaurant itself. We made reservations (highly recommended). The food tasted very fresh and had great options for myself and for my friends who keep kosher. 

The owner was very nice and we really enjoyed the pinot noir on the wine list with our meal. Definitely would recommend this restaurant for its good service and food. It is a bit loud and I did feel like I was yelling at some points, but this is the case with many small restaurants in the city.
author: Bori B.

description: Meal didn't have very much flavor, but service was great, restaurant was clean.  I would suggest making a reservation.
author: Emily T.

description: Best secret place in the city for italian!   Wonderful culture, fresh food and great company!  Cute, cosy and authentic!  ;))
author: Mike B.

description:
My wife and we're looking for a solid Italian meal with out pasta and we found it here
Good food, lots of smiles and a fair price
author: John C.

description:
Ristorante Milano is a nice restaurant for a dinner date. The food is very good, the ambiance cozy, although parking is tricky -- we ended up parking a couple blocks away for $10.

We had reservations for a Saturday at 7pm, and were promptly seated shortly after we arrived on time. The restaurant is very busy, at least on the Saturday night that we were there, so reservations are recommended. Other diners who showed up without reservations had to wait awhile.

We started off the meal with the Calamari ala Griglia, which is a tasty grilled squid and white bean salad. It was very pleasant, and was a lighter alternative to the ubiquitous fried calamari that one finds at other Italian restaurants.  We also had a green salad with persimmons and gorgonzola, which paired well with the calamari.

For mains, we had the Linguine ai Frutti di Mare, which was a tomato based seafood pasta, and the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa which was a porcini mushroom, italian sausage, and cream pasta. The fruitti di mare was delicious, and the tonnarelli was amazing -- super mushroomy and rich, although quite heavy with the cream. 

The service was very friendly and attentive, and I look forward to dining here again.
author: Allen T.

description: Makes for the perfect date night or family dining, cozy, amazing service, quality authentic Italian, the foodie in me was doing flips the dishes were delicious!!
author: Carla A.

description:
My son and I had a wonderful evening here. It started with a very warm welcome from the staff.
I arrived first and requested a table in the back which is up a few stairs snd has the feeling of a loft. This restaurant is always full and is on the noisy side so it was nice to be a little bit separated from the main part of the restaurant. There are also a few tables out in front along side the front  window that are probably quieter but feel more apart from the restaurant.

While waiting for my Son to arrive I spoke to the man sitting next to me. I asked him what he was eating and found out that he was an investor in the restaurant. He was very happy to make suggestions on the menu. What intrigued me was the pasta dish he was eating. It was one of the daily specials, a  beet ravioli in brown butter sauce. He sang it's praises.

We did indeed order the beet ravioli and it was divine beyond belief.luscious melt in your mouth pillows of pleasure. Beautiful to look at and even better to eat.

But first we started with the grilled vegetables and a balsamic dressing which were nothing short of magnificent.The zucchini and eggplant were so tender, the dressing perfect.

My son had a glass of the Sangiovese wine and I had the Multipulciano. Italian wines are wonderful here and reasonably priced. Be sure to try them.

Next we had the grilled  calamari with  with cannellini beans. This too was terrific. I have been to this restaurant once before and this is the dish  I came back for. I was not disappointed. It's great to have calamari that's not fried grilling adds so much flavor and this restaurant knows how to grill.

We shared the rosemary grilled veal chop it was perfectly charred and delicious accompanied by very tasty vegetables.

We were full but couldn't pass up the tiramisu, a dish the restaurant is known for. It was superb! Bittersweet cacao  powder is dusted around the outside, moist sweetness on the inside. It is the perfect blending of flavors.

The only downside to this restaurant is the noise level. There were times I had to cup my ear to hear my son and this was on a Thursday night.  there's one more thing that didn't work - the bread. It is mediocre, just skip it. Street parking is impossible pay $10 to park in the Jug Shop parking lot on Polk and Pacific and walk two short blocks up to the restaurant.

Every dish we had was perfect this is a don't miss restaurant. Once you go here you will want to come back again and again. Dinner for two was $150.
author: Mary S.

description:
Just came back. Best food we have had in SF. We are leaving tomorrow and the last two evenings have been great. 

We started with the squid and it was great. The Evans next to it were questionable , but no big deal. I had the sausage, chicken, and lamb loin thing and it was seriously delicious. The favorite out of all three was the chicken with the gravy sauce on top of it. Had two glasses of wine, Sunni had some clams in pasta and finished off with a dessert. $100 bucks later (tip on top of that) and we are home in our hotel. Our waiter from Albania was was really good as will, best service we have had here on SF. 

#ThisCityNeedsMoreConservatives
author: Daniel C.

description: Without a doubt this is the best Italian food I've ever had and one of the best dining experiences I've had as well. The staff couldn't possibly have been friendlier than they were, which was impressive since the place was packed to the gills. There was a little wait but that was totally fine because the food was utterly amazing. The bottle of wine the waitress recommended was also a big hit. By the time the meal was done I felt energized instead of weighed down like I normally do after eating out. Pacific is a bit narrow and you can forget about parking, but if you live in or are in the area, Ristorante Milano is a must.
author: Jake B.

description:
Ristorante Milano is an authentic Italian restaurant in Russian Hill/Nob Hill. There's a plethora of these kinds of little neighborhood Italian spots in San Francisco, but not all of them are delicious and authentic.

The folks here are authentic Italians from Italy - so it was a pleasure to speak with them in Italian!

The space is fairly small but well designed -I like the small tables by the windows out front- lovely ambiance that captures plenty of natural lighting! The interior tables are in the more dimly-lit dining room but can accommodate larger groups (6-8 people).

We ordered Calamari alla Griglia - $15, Insalata Romana - $12, Crostini with Mozzarella, and shared a seafood risotto. The risotto was delicious and better than the one at Venticello's for sure.

We also ordered a bottle of Tuscan wine for $37. Their wines by the bottle are reasonably priced- half their Italian wines are under $70.

Overall - this is a great spot if you want simple but delicious Italian fare without all the frills. Great for date night or a group meal!
author: Veronica S.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in SF.  Small, friendly with exquisite pastas and a wonderful array of appetizers.  
On a quiet stretch of Pacific Street - it's worth goi across town to get here.

Staff are friendly and knowledgeable - wine list is a bit high but great selection.

Classic Roman dishes - fresh linguine with zucchini and mint.
Classic northern Italian dishes - rabbit with polenta.

This place is like the best trattorias in smaller cities of Italy ( like Ascoli Piceno or Urbino) .

You cannot go wrong here .
It is not for groups - which is a big plus.
author: Thomas T.

description: We had an amazing dinner here. The ravioli was so fresh and delicious. The sauce was light but very flavorful !! I would go back anytime.
author: mariellen g.

description: We've been coming here for years and always have a wonderful experience. My husband is Italian and extremely picky, and the food never disappoints. It's a small, quaint, Italian family owned upscale restaurant in Russian Hill with delicious authentic food and reasonable prices. They also have a wonderful wine list and are happy to recommend pairings based on food pairings. The deserts and appetizers are also lovely. On our most recent visit, we ordered the crostini ai funghi, and burrata with arugula and fennel to start; and the tonnarelli alla capricciosa and the lasagna special as main dishes. The tonnarelli alla capricciosa (my entree) was so delicious, rich, creamy and tender that I didn't want to stop eating (even when I started getting full). Supposedly this is one of their most popular entries. For desert, we ordered the Pera Cotta al Marsala and the Tiramisu; both were delightful. The Pera Cotta was fairly light and came with a delightful pear sorbet that paired perfectly. I'm including photos of everything we ordered in this review. Overall, wonderful experience and I'm sure we will be back again within the next several months.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: What a treat!  Bold flavors, which is what we like. We made a reservation for lunch and this was wise.  The place was full.  Started with bruschetta, assembled 4 ways...excellent...I would order this again.  The guy had a shrimp appetizer and loved it.  He then proceeded to pasta  served 3 different ways.  For my main I chose salmon with a puttanesca sauce...heaven.  We will return to Ristorante Milano, for sure!
author: Bleep S.

description: YES! This is everything you ever want in a neighborhood restaurant. You can stop by whenever without a reservation. Lovely, friendly staff who take the time to ask about you. Delicious, simple, authentic food (legit the best gnocchi I ever tasted). And completely, 100% unpretentious. Everyone should be lucky enough to have a "Ristorante Milano" in their neighborhood... I'm just selfishly hoping my review doesn't result in too many people flooding the restaurant!
author: Tazeen C.

description:
Here's a review that I started and never finished.  it's too bad because I loved this place. It's been a few months since we visited Milano, so my memories of the meal have faded a bit.

But I do remember what we ordered:

+CALAMARI W/BEANS (5/5) - This was an unbreaded version which was a really nice change.  Loved it and would order again.

+BURRATA CHEESE APPETIZER (4/5) - Served w/bread and tomato. Very good.

+TUNA CARPACCIO [Memory is fuzzy on this one!]

+GNOCCHI (5/5) - Top notch.  Some of the best I've had.

+TONARELLI (4/5) - Served with mushroom and sausage in a light cream sauce.  

+RAVIOLI [Memory is fuzzy on this one!]

The Italian owner stopped by our table for a bit to chat.  I loved the charming, cozy feel to the place.  Outstanding, home cooked Italian food.  Major kudos to the chef. Felt like I was my Italian grandma's house for dinner.  I'm excited about going back.  Maybe tonight?
author: Darien R.

description: Wonderful experience at Milano!  Small neighborhood spot with personal service and excellent authentic  Italian dishes!
author: Don F.

description:
Charming and cozy little restaurant tucked away deep in Nob Hill.  Wish we had discovered it years ago.

We started with the Crostini ai Funghi (bruschetta with sauteed mushrooms, gorgonzola) and it was sumptuous.  It was dripping with heavenly gorgonzola and mounds of mushrooms.

For my main, I went with the house favorite: the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa (house made thin pasta, porcini mushrooms, cream, Italian sausage).  It was epic, just mouth-wateringly good.  The sausage and mushrooms combined for quite a flavor on that bed of cream.

For dessert, my wife ordered the Tiramisu (ladyfingers dipped in rum and espresso layered with mascarpone and cocoa).  It was good but not great.

Service was warm and friendly.  Wine selection was solid.

Recommended for a nice date night.
author: Saminda W.

description: Fine food, a lively (but not loud or frantic) atmosphere, and a lengthy wine list. The salmon was wild caught and SO flavorful.  The soup, a lentil minestrone, was fresh and bright, not too salty or thick. Friendly staff, too.
author: Kelly R.

description: A hidden little gem :-)  So happy I found this place on Yelp - it's now one of my favorite Italian restaurants in SF - Definitely going back!  The staff was friendly and attentive.  We made reservations, arrived 15 min early, and still got seated right away.  The Linguine ai Frutti di Mare with tomato sauce was delicious - the homemade pasta was cooked perfectly and the flavor was amazing ~ I felt like I was back in Italy! :) The beet salad and burrata was really good too.  Their bread was different than what I had expected but it went really well with the olive oil (the olive oil tasted like it came straight from Italy too)!   Tried a bite of the lasagna - wow.  I'll probably get the linguine again though.  I liked the atmosphere: small, quaint, simple, comfortable, relaxed, good vibes, not stuffy or pretentious.  I've been looking for a place like this for years.  Usually, I'm disappointed in the places people recommend because the food isn't authentic enough.  Finally(!!!!!) found a go-to Italian spot :) *happy dance*
author: Deanna T.

description:
Deliciously Authentic! Great neighborhood restaurant worth your time. Restaurant Milano has a great italian vibe with the service to match it. Everyone is very friendly, accommodating, and have great knowledge of the food. Comes in handy when u cant make the decision between two dishes.   

The menu is not that big which is always a good indicator that the food quality will be good. Ordered the mozzarella di bufala and OMG it was delicious. Simple ingredients made to perfection. For the entree I ordered Linguine ai Frutti di Mare and it was a little peace of heaven. Full of flavor, homemade and made to perfection. Definitely a recommendation.
author: Raul V.

description: Cute homey restaurant. Excellent and very affordable wine selection. Service was ok. Some servers were really friendly whereas one or two others were standoffish. The place is tiny so you don't get much privacy and it's hard to even wait for the restroom without feeling like you're in everyone's way. Food seems like a hit or a miss. Bf got the ravioli which was oily and not very flavorful. My seafood linguine was good but a bit on the salty side. For dessert, tiramisu was good but profiteroles were almost not edible. They contained a very sweet cream that tasted artificial. As mentioned before wine selection is great. We got a nice $40 bottle of barbera.
author: Yin H.

description: We came here on Friday night as a somewhat last minute decision.....my husband has been wanting to try it out for quite some time so hopped on Open Table and made a reservation. We arrived at the restaurant only to find that we had inadvertently made the reservation for the following week. The place was packed with people (with actual reservations) waiting in the front. Rather than send us away, which he had every right to do, he asked us to hang on for a few minutes as he first took care of those with reservations and would see what he could do. It took about 15 minutes but he seated us and the entire experience was fantastic! The food, wine, service - all excellent, we will be back!
author: Aline W.

description: Some of the best food I've had in the city!! Located in a charming neighborhood this little Italian restaurant is exactly the type of food a real Italian family would have in Italy.
author: Katerina P.

description: Great service and food. We have the same waiter every time we go and he is excellent! The lamb meatballs and polenta special was delicious and the hazelnut gelato was also very good. We go at least once a month and plan on continuing to do so. Highly recommend
author: Brian G.

description: Cozy spot with superb service,absolutely delicious handmade pasta, and authentic Italian fare. We started our meal with tender, lightly charred calamari with a hint of lemon over white beans, as well as a bruschetta bursting with fresh, juicy summer tomatoes and creamy mozzarella. While I was tempted by the veal scaloppine and halibut special dishes passing by the table, we all opted for pasta. My dad declared his lasagna the best he's ever had, and my mom and I both swooned over our tonnarelli with cream & sausage and fettuccine with cream and tomatoes. The pasta was perfectly tender and each dish perfectly portioned. We also were pleasantly surprised to snag great bottle of Chianti from the wine list for under $40. The only downside was it was VERY cozy - I couldn't back my chair up as far as I liked because the tables were so close together, and waiters had to take turns passing with plates. Because of the small size, the noise level was a bit more than desired as well, but all in all a wonderful meal. I'll be back!
author: Sara F.

description: This place is super old school. I ordered a mushroom pasta dish that I enjoyed for the most part, but it was a little too heavy. The staff was friendly enough, and their bread was good. I'm not sure if this is my scene, but it's definitely a solid choice.
author: H. L.

description: Went here on Valentines day with my girlfriend and it wasn't too shabby of an experience. The food we ordered was delicious. I had the lamb and she had the chicken. We shared the gnocchi as an appetizer and that was amazing. We finished it all off with the tiramisu. The only issue I had with the place, is that the portions were small and the restaurant was pretty tiny. The food though was yummy, I just still felt hungry like an hour later which was lame for how much we paid for dinner.
author: Heather S.

description: If you were in Rome this would be called a trattoria. It a beautiful small restaurant serving home made pasta, beautiful chicken scallopini, and has Dolcetta d'Alba red wine on the menu. Service was friendly and excellent.
author: Frank C.

description: Fantastic authentic Italian spot on Russian Hill. Service was great and menu was authentic Milanese cuisine.
author: Joe M.

description:
I have been by this place several times and from the outside it looks really charming.  I finally tried it the other night and it did not disappoint.  The restaurant is really quaint, the tables are set up so you don't feel like you are sitting with the person next to you.  The wait staff was knowledgable, friendly and attentive.  The soup of the day was nice and light, great way to start the meal!  We had the lamb meatballs over stewed polenta and it was amazing.  The sauce was perfect, the meatballs delicious and stewed polenta was a great complement.  The pasta with sausage and porcini mushrooms was fantastic.  The sausage and mushrooms were chopped really small so you got all the flavors in every bite, it was perfect.  Great, reasonably priced wine list.  

Why 4 stars and not 5?  The bread was very average.  I expect Italian restaurants to nail the bread and was disappointed at how average, borderline bad, it was.  While the wait staff was great the busser felt like he was rushing us out to turn the table.  I finished my water and instead of asking if I wanted more, which I did, he grabbed the empty glass and walked off before I could ask for more.  I still had a bite of food in my mouth, plus pasta left on my plate, and he asked if he could come back in two minutes to take my plate.  It was weird and rude.

I recommend and will definitely go back, although I may ask for a different busser.
author: Cari N.

description:
Summary: Service is poor and reservations mean nothing. 

We made a date night reservation for 8pm and continued waiting until 8:30pm. It didn't look like the restaurant was going to have any tables freeing up at that point so we decided to leave. There we also three other parties at that time waiting to be seated past their reservation time - one in passing said they were waiting for 1 hour outside in the cold.
author: Leland C.

description:
"Mangia bene, ridi spesso, ama molto."  This place is special to me for so many reasons.  I don't come here often, but when I do I love every second of it.  I recently went here at the end 2015 (Dec.) with a person I had a huge crush on - so I wanted to make sure it was romantic and flawless.  This is the ONLY place I will ever order "Capelli d'Angelo al Filetto di Pomodoro" (in Irish white girl words now - homemade noodles with fresh tomato sauce).  They also serve a vegan asparagus soup that is amazing (I didn't find it this time, but I suppose it is probably seasonal).  Hello - did you say burrata - I will gladly have some of that.  Ohh and fresh bread - pile it on! 

The restaurant is in a somewhat hidden place - but it is a royal gem.  It is a rather small place, but it is unique and  I feel as snug in bug in a rug here.  The staff here are wonderful and they know their wine, and they even told us where to go within walking distance after dinner.  

P.S.  Always make reservations here.

P.S.S.  The next review isn't as good as mine so stop reading and just go here.
author: Denise D.

description:
This place has hands down the best pasta and Tiramisu I have ever had. Even the atmosphere was perfect.

Starting off with the atmosphere, it is a very small place that fills up quickly, so get there early if you dont want to wait. We were seated at the very back, so I was given a look at the whole restaurant, and it is beautiful. A great setting for a romantic date.

Starting out, I ordered the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa, and it was amazing. The mushrooms were cooked perfectly. The sauce gave a nice balance to the earthiness of the dish, and all was in perfect harmony. You could tell the amount of time and effort that was put into the pasta itself. It is all homemade, and the pasta was still al dente when served. It was a great way to start off the meal.

For dessert, we ordered the tiramisu. This is not your regular tiramisu. This is melt in your mouth, creamy goodness. Its not like the tiramisu cakes that you buy in the bakery. This had an amazing chocolate creamy taste highlighted by espresso undertones. I have never been so speechless at food in my life.
author: James S.

description: The food is phenomenal!  I will be back.  I got the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa which was better than what I've had in Italy.  A must try!!
author: L M.

description:
Very big fan and this review is long overdue.

The highlights are the gnocchi, fettucine, and linguini and clams. I also love their buratta. They have a great staff who are very friendly and knowledgeable about the food and wine. Great neighborhood gem.
author: Derek S.

description:
Came here with my boyfriend the day after Valentines Day with our reservation. Got seated quickly and even though we sat at the corner of the room, we still had significant attention. Service was quick and attentive. I loved the Italian authenticity of the atmosphere too.

We ordered two glasses of wine and had complimentary warm bread while waiting for our appetizer and meal. We had the bruschetta with squash and cheese on top for our appetizer. There were only two large pieces with lots of squash on top, but the squash was very flavorful. For our meal, I had the squash ravioli and my boyfriend had the Pollo e Vendure alla Griglia. Their menu changes so it may not be on the menu when you go, FYI. For my plate, there were 7 pieces of ravioli and my boyfriends plate had cheese on his chicken. Both tasted very delicious and flavorful, BUT the portions were a bit small in my opinion. Ended our meal with a dessert since we weren't really full, and had the Pera Cotta al Marsala (poached pear with pear sorbet). Very interesting, but tasteful. 

Didn't expect our total to be so high and not be full when we left, but it was a good experience because of the good service and flavorful dishes.
author: Amanda C.

description: AWESOME!  Great food and great service!  The waitstaff gave wonderful recommendations and we had a great time.  The gnocchi was heavenly and the wine was great too!  Most recommended!
author: Rick B.

description:
Whoa! this place is for real. Just simply some of the best traditional northern Italian food you've had in a very long time. I know it was for me. The staff is informed and attentive. The food, like what we ordered, the linguine Milanese, and the risotto, were just absolutely delicious.
Plus the atmosphere, with it's warm welcoming decor, and intimate setting, you can't help but feel you're being welcomed into someone's home.
author: Mike C.

description:
So deelisheeoso. Romantic yet great to bring family to. Awesome gnocchi. I love how they make it fresh and everything comes piping hot to you. Oh the gnocchi is a must try. It is so fluffy and creamy!! 
Parking in the neighborhood can be tough so allot at least 15 min for parking hunting. The area is pretty safe at night and friendly. 

The staff are nice and the restaurant is very cozy. Almost all the tables, with exception of the tables by the windows are packed close and tight with other tables so you are bound to hear other stories other than your own. 

All in all, the gnocchi is a must try !
author: Anna C.

description: I love this place! Food is so good, service is great! My favorite spot in San Francisco for a date night. It might be small and probably expensive to some budgets but it's worthy. Happy to come here.
author: Nancy P.

description: We stumbled on the neighborhood gem and managed to get a late reservation. The energy of the service, size of the restaurant, proximity of the tables, and most importantly the taste of the pastas (cooked perfectly al dente and seasoned exceptionally well) were like being in Italy. If I had one gripe, it's that they didn't have Cacio e Pepe. :) Definitely make it happen if you're in the neighborhood - we'll be back!
author: Mihir G.

description: Great service the wait staff was attentive and very knowledgeable and the food was great we shared the antipasto platter of cured meats and the bread for the table had great subtle seasoning along with fresh caprese salad and the gnocchi.
author: Jonathan R.

description: They define neighborhood gem. Just moved into the neighborhood and my husband and I decided to give them a try. The moment we walked in, we were greeted by the sweetest Italian owner Aldo. Nice intimate and peaceful environment, we tried several dishes - mushroom crostini, gnocchi and seafood special, everything was fresh and delicious. Easy to make reservations, highly recommended for either casual night out or special occasion.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place was really a big disappointment. I was really looking forward to the homemade pastas, but when the ravioli arrived it was flavorless, dried out and tough. It was not appetizing at all. The saffron seafood risotto was a spin off on Paella, but too strong on the saffron flavor, and was served a mushy mess.

There are too many other great choices for pasta in the city, so I will not be back.
author: Bill K.

description:
Food and service was 4 star - definitely well worth the price.  We ordered the gnocchi and chicken with sage and licked the plates of both. the owner came around to pour our wines. the servers were extremely friendly.  And no they did not seem impatient that we weren't doing full 3-course meals or drinking like alcoholics. A great neighborhood spot.

Reason for 3 star is that this place could really use renovations. Very little decor. Seemed poorly maintained.
author: Alice Z.

description:
This is one of the cutest restaurants I have been to in the city! I absolutely love Italian food and this fancy little restaurant has great food, atmosphere, and service! 

Atmosphere: The restaurant is really cute and cozy on the inside. It has dim lighting, it's warm, and the noise level is great (not too loud). It gives you the feeling that you are in a romantic little restaurant that is made especially for you and your date. 

Service: Service is great here. I made a reservation a week before the date I would be coming in and my table was ready as soon as I arrived. Although I do wish I was seated in the main room that is right in the front, that room seems to be for parties of 4 or greater. I was seated in a room to the side of it that was slightly smaller, but being seated near the window was a nice touch. Our server was very kind and came back multiple times to offer us more bread, ask us about the food, and take care of our every need. He didn't rush us at all, which was nice and we felt relaxed the whole time we were there. 

Food: We got the gnocchi in the tomato sauce and a butter nut squash ravioli plate. The gnocchi was fantastic--it was just heavy enough, the tomato sauces was nice and creamy, and together, they tasted divine. However, the butternut squash ravioli sauce was a little sweet for my taste. Regardless, the ravioli was cooked really well and the vegetables that it came with were fresh and tasty. 

Drinks: We ordered a sparking pink wine, which was refreshing and really good with our dinner!

Warning: The only complaint I had was that there was literally NO parking nearby, so make sure you realize that before making plans. We had to park in a garage and walk almost 20 minutes (some parts uphill) to finally get to the restaurant.

Verdict: I will definitely be returning for another special occasion! Great service, flavorful food, and an adorable restaurant.
author: Anu P.

description: This place is adorable. Great ambiance. The food was perfect. I ordered the house special: beet ravioli. The dish was portioned perfectly and the service was prompt and attentive.
author: Maya B.

description:
Had a 6p reservation on a Saturday. Exceptional food. Impeccable service. An authentic ambience that feels like Italy. The grilled local sardines over arugula were highly recommended as unique and delicious. Amazing, really. A hearts of romaine salad and a beautiful chilled white wine paired beautifully. The gorgeous and attentive waitress selected wonderful wines for each course. By 7p, a line spilled out the door. The owner graciously visited with patrons throughout the night. A bus boy took fallen napkins from the floor and offered fresh linens to patrons before they'd even noticed. The handmade gnocchi with gorgonzola and fresh tomato were tiny pillows from heaven. And the paper thin veal scallopine was dressed with lemon and offered clean and fresh flavors. With no plans for dessert, minds changed with news of the daily special: profiteroles. When you die and go to heaven, this is the meal served ... 

Note: Ask about parking when you make reservations or, better yet, take a taxi.
author: Phoebe W.

description: Excellent and quaint place.  The quality of the food and service was extremely high.  It had a very personal feeling as the kitchen is tiny and I think the owner sat us when we came in.  The chicken liver app was awesome and everyone commented how good their meals were (I was delayed writing this review so I don't remember each dish- sorry).  I had the sampler which had all the Italian classics and it was a large portion.  The sampler was great and traditional so if you want something more "modern" go with another dish but I would have this classic red sauce Italian comfort food again!
author: Keith B.

description:
Wow,! where to start. Absolutely fabulous from caprese to tiramisu The waitress was wonderful, friendly and gave great recommendations. The wine she recommended paired perfectly with the meal and every bite was better than the last.

If you're craving great, authentic Italian, you MUST try this place!!
author: Suzann H.

description: I love Italian cuisine and rarely do not enjoy my meal, but the food I was served here was unbelievable. The special Saffron Risotto was so creamy and delicious as was the starter vegan minestrone!! The hazelnut gelato finished off a completely mind blowing, taste bud melting, heavenly dining experience. Even the adorable waiter with his Italian accent was a fantastic touch!!
author: Amanda A.

description: It was okay. Customer service wasn't the best. You feel a sense of judgment when you walk through based on how you look. The food was okay but it took long to receive our meals. There were customers who came well after we did and still received their food before us. If you like authentic Italian I guess it's okay. I had the dish with ground sausage but didn't know the sausage was going to be ground.
author: Shonda W.

description:
My boyfriend and I live nearby and found this place on Yelp.
Our experience was incredible. We had an excellent server (tall brunette guy) and we absolutely loved that the gentleman, who seemed like the owner, greeted us and came by a couple times to check on us- it's hard to find that these days!
The food was out of this world. The only thing that upset me was that I was too full after dinner to try the dessert!
My boyfriend had the lasagna and I had the pasta with cream sauce, mushrooms and sausage- impeccable! We also both had wine, which was also delicious.
The whole experience was worth every penny. We will definitely be back and I will recommend this restaurant to friends and family.
Thanks for the amazing Valentine's Day experience!
author: Emma D.

description:
What a great, little Italian restaurant...and what a find! Thank you Yelpers for turning us onto Ristorante Milano. I can't wait to go back the next time I am in The City.

While staying at our hotel in the Union Square area, we were fretting over where to have dinner. After much Yelping, we settled on Italian and the reviews led us to Milano. Thankfully, they are on Open Table, so we scored a 6pm reservation and grabbed a cab to Hyde and Pacific.

We were one of the first patrons of the evening and our friendly, authentic Italian server took great care of us. She explained the menu with patience and all our choices were good ones.

I had the Fettucine al Sugo di Carne alla Milanese...basically, pasta with meat sauce. The pasta was fresh and cooked to perfection and the sauce was zesty and a little acidic with a decent amount of meat. My daughter and wife were also happy with their pasta. Our server also recommended a great glass of Barbera (Italian red wine). Prices were reasonable too.

The atmosphere is quiet, semi-formal and quaint. What a hidden gem.
author: Matthew W.

description:
We drove up to San Fransisco from Los Angeles, and had reservations at Ristorante Milano for my Dad's 50th Birthday.

The atmosphere was nice and closed-in, rather intimate. There's little space for waiting around.

We scoped out the menu ahead of time on their website, and knew what we each wanted to get way in advance of arriving at the restaurant. However, nowhere on the site did it say their menu rotated per day, which is what our server told us. Myself being a picky eater, I only had a few things in mind that I wanted, none of which were listed as being offered that day. We asked our waiter to check with the cook if a pasta that wasn't on that day's menu could be made, and they accommodated us without hesitation. Our food was very good, and the waiter was very nice.

The only complaint I have is that they seemed a bit under-staffed for a Monday night, with only two servers going around to ALL of the tables in the restaurant. While it is a little small and cozy, I think there could have been another waiter going around -- the speed of our service suffered because of it.

If I'm ever back in San Fransisco, I wouldn't hesitate to come back here for a nice evening meal again.
author: Samuel T.

description: Made me sick. Wasn't even great going down. Overpriced and underwhelming. Very little meat in the dishes. Service was perfect but couldn't make up for the food.
author: John F.

description:
I ended up at Ristorante Milano as part of a business dinner for a group of 6 weeks ago.  The seating is a little cramped, but the restaurant is bigger than it appears from the outside.  It was a wine maker night, so they had a few wines by the Fossacolle winery featured and had the winemaker there too.  We ordered so much of the Rosso di Montalcino that they gave us all a pour of another wine with dessert.  I'm not a red drinker, but the Rosso was mild enough for me to ask for a little more!

For starters we got the bruschetta, beet salad and grilled calamari.  I'm not a fan of calamari or beets so I just stuck with the bruschetta.  It was different as it looked and kinda tasted like a sweet potato topping with burrata.  It was really good though and a hearty slice.  I also liked the herb soft bread they used for the breadbasket.  For my main I actually ordered a special on the wine night special menu which was a truffle taglitelle.  There was a little bit of shaved truffles ontop, cheese and a truffle butter sauce.  My waiter warned me that it was a smaller appetizer size, but it was still a very good portion, as I took some home to share with him.  I was getting full, but one of my coworkers and I decided to split dessert.  We shared the Torta Caprese: Warm, dark belgian chocolate almond cake, shaved almonds and cream.  Loved the contrast of hot and cold.  It was a nice chocolatey cake, that wasn't overly rich or too heavy.  Everyone else seemed to love their entrees and desserts too.  

I always get pasta at an Italian restaurant because 1. I love noodles & 2. My dad always told me that you can determine whether or not an Italian restaurant is good based on their pasta.  I loved my truffle pasta, but wish it was a permanent item on the menu.  Honestly though, a lot of the pasta dishes on the menu seem pretty ordinary, as a lot of them are sausage or meat sauced based.  This is one reason why I am giving them a 3.5.   Ristorante Milano is not a destination place in SF as there are better Italian restaurants in SF in my opinion (i.e. Allegro Romano, if you can get a reservation & Vicoletto).   I am rounding up because the food and wine were solid and because the service was excellent, though a 3.5 is appropriate.  Yelp please allow us to do half stars one day!
author: Cat C.

description: My best girl friend wanted to treat me to dinner, so we decided to visit Ristorante Milano; we were not disappointed. First we were greeted by the Blasi family who are wonderful people. We tried the wine special, and it was so good we drank an entire bottle. We had the bruschetta & grilled veggies as an appetizer, and they were delicious. I had the veal scaloppine & my bff had the chicken saltimbocca. The veal was cooked perfectly, and it was a very generous portion. My bff said her dinner was the best chicken saltimbocca she's ever had. The atmosphere was great, very cozy place, I will definitely go back!
author: Gelina A.

description: It's an overpacked and under flavored destination. If you don't order off the specials menu expect the very basic in cuisine. They're living off a reputation that ONCE was honestly deserved. Now the food tastes like its read off of yesterday's back page. How you call yourself avant garde serving Chef Boyardi is beyond me. It's an insult to Italians everywhere. Before you ask yes my family IS, and that's the food I grew up on and yes I've been to the old country enough times to tell you they'd be disappointed too.
author: Gregory F.

description:
Best restaurant experience I have had in a while.
Food is excellent, service great as well. 
Dishes came out fast and in a same time we didn't feel rushed at all. 
Wine recommendation was perfect.
Grilled sardines lightly breaded on a bed of salad $13 the best I've ever had. 
Grilled calamari $15 cooked perfectly, had slightly charred taste, delicious. 
Gnocchi $19 asked if they can make it with meat sauce instead of vegetarian version, they made the change without an additional charge and it was delicious, gnocchi light and fluffy.  
That day special was Rigatoni w/mixed wild mushrooms and truffle oil $19 great dish, pasta cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. 
They serve really soft and warm complimentary bread with EVOO. 

Will skip dessert next time, wasn't that great. Minus 1/2 STAR.
author: Natasha S.

description:
I made a reservation a couple months ago. The reservation was for 5 people, but one person in the party ended up being ill, so he couldn't join. We arrived on time and it took 10 minutes to even be greeted. A group came about 10-15 minutes after us and proceeded to talk in Italian with the host. They leap frogged us and my party was left in the cold. I know it wasn't the fact that they were a 5 person group, because we were eventually sat at a table that could accommodate 5, an hour later!! The one dish I wanted, lasagna, was given to 3 people from the group that leap frogged my group. The waiter then kept saying how "I should have reserved the lasgna ahead of time." I wouldn't have had to if the restaurant honored reservations. 

Tl;Dr - food was delicious, service was down right atrocious. Be a human!
author: Patrick L.

description: Run by an Italian family. True authentic Italian food. Our waitress tried to rush us to order, but overall great experience. Will return again!
author: V P.

description:
Duped by the 4 star reviews. 

Overpriced and very mediocre. The food was bland and tasted store-bought (pasta especially. Not sure why so many people say it's fresh). No spices or herbs used in any of our meals. They served dry, Safeway style focaccia. The appetizers came out in about two minutes (pre-made). My chicken was baked with melted swiss cheese on top, cold mashed potatoes and soggy kale on the side. The wine was blah and $40. The server recommended nearly every single item on the menu and explained nothing further. 

The restaurant had a few too many tourists in it. Surprised to find that in this area. 

The worst part: the entire place smelt like cat litter and the decor is 1980's strip mall diner. Very disappointing. Never going back.
author: Michael C.

description:
Great restaurant. The venue is a bit small  but it's worth it. 

As for the window seats (you will have more room).

Service was great, everyone from the waiters to the busboy were very helpful and attentive.

Food:

Appetizers: definitely get the grilled calamari!!! Amazing
And their salads are great too (we had their special)

Main: we went for their specials
Always listen to what they have to offer before heading to the daily menu

Wine: their selections are pretty different than your usual Merlot or Chardonnay . Try something new.

We didn't have dessert!!!
author: Sepi N.

description: I lived in Italy for over a year and ate a lot of good and delicious italian food! Ristorante Milano is by far the tastiest italian cuisine in SF. The pasta is freshly made everyday and they buy their produce fresh from the local farmers market. I had the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa and it's made to perfection everytime. The freshmade bread with the rosemary olive oil blew me away. I recommend this restaurant to everyone. I have sent a few of my friends here from around California and they were blown away by the food as well. It is the BEST quality and the BEST service. Hands down one of the best restaurants in the California.
author: M R.

description:
Atmosphere is wonderful and the food is even more amazing!!! The grilled calamari was the best I have ever had. It was smokey and earthy. My husband had the chicken liver, bacon with balsamic reduction. He said it was absolutely wonderful. Service is friendly and the restaurant is very quaint. It is very small so it is tight getting in and out around the tables.

The server was so polite and helpful. He made us feel right at home. He even brought out a special dessert and paired with a dessert wine in honor of my husband's birthday. 

This restaurant makes we wish we lived here!
author: C S.

description:
This is definitely one of those times I wish there was a ".5" setting because this would definitely be a solid 4.5 stars! 

Came here with my boyfriend for  a quiet dinner last night based on the Yelp reviews (plus availability for a last-minute reservation). 

I/we tried:

--The beet salad: SO delicious - a perfect balance of sweet and tart with savory hints
--Fettuccine alla ghiotta: I'm literally still drooling over how good the cream sauce and noodles were ... and I thought it was a pretty decent / hearty portion for $19
--The lasagna with meat sauce: My boyfriend LOVED it - he hates veggies and likes his meals pretty streamlined, so he thought it was the right exact ratio of meat to sauce to cheese to noodles ... personally I would have liked more cheesiness and a bit more pepper oomph, but I still thought it was really good. 


PROS:
--Cute, quiet location - not in an obnoxiously hipster part of town (that's a pro to me)
--Reasonably priced - it's fantastic to find a CUTE place with YUMMY food in this area that won't gauge you or treat you like they're doing you a favor by letting you eat there. If you're not ordering wine/dessert it's more like a $30/per person meal. 
--Perfect service - not intrusive; the waiter/busboy always knew when to check in on us, refill our water, ask how we were doing, etc.
--The food, DUH

SLIGHT CONS:
--Waiting 15 minutes for our table to be ready (after arriving on time) 
--It was kind of hot/stuffy inside (I think because it's so small and it was packed) ... even another woman who was waiting made a comment that it was too hot and wanted to wait outside. So - just dress in layers if you're eating here!
--I kinda wished there were more pasta with seafood options
author: Elaine O.

description:
Oh so cute. 

This place is a perfect spot for a flavourful romantic dinner.

The calamari appetizer was the best I have ever had. I could just sit there and keep eating that alone. But I did move on. Everything was fresh and authentic. I felt like I was back in Italy. They also had a fantastic selection of wine to complement our dinner. 

It was a perfect little night, at a perfect little restaurant.
author: Magdalena R.

description:
Ristorante Milano is a place that impresses upon you the most intentional Italian experience. The restaurant is located in the middle of an otherwise residential block of Pacific Avenue in Nob Hill. It's right off the Hyde St. Cable Car which makes for an incredible way to start or end your evening.

My wife and I started dating in college and within three months she moved to Italy. We traveled there together while she was abroad and fell in love with the food. We returned to Italy for our honeymoon so that we could relive all of it again. We haven't been back to Italy in 7 years, but Ristorante Milano has been our portal to experience the flavors the way we remember. 

The food alone does not make for a meal. From the moment the owner swings opens the door to welcome you in with a "Buena Cera", you will know how special this place is. The staff compliments the dining experience with their authentic accents and witty charm.

We have had so many experiences here, from our first meal on my 24th Birthday, a few meetings of our families, Valentines dates, every Christmas Eve and so many anniversaries. 

To start the meal, we always opt for one of their bruschettas. We were happily surprised with a squash rendition that we had never imagined would taste so good. We'll often opt to order their pan seared calamari as well. Or, if we want something crisp, we'll choose the arugula and fresh burrata salad or sweet red and golden beet salad, both leave you wanting more.

Once we've started teasing our appetites with the complimentary oil dipped focaccia, my wife usually indulges her taste buds with the creamiest Gorgonzola gnocchi, instantly transporting her back to Florence. I usually insist on dining on Mondays so that I can take advantage of their daily special, the dish I care about most in San Francisco. Their version of a braised lamb shank is completely traditional, slow cooked in stewed tomatoes until it's just about to fall off the bone. It's served over a delicate layer of creamy polenta so that every bite of this dish ends up deserving its own moment of silence. Pairing it with a classic Chianti makes everything complete.

The dessert menu is unfortunately unchanging and so we either go for the classic Tiramisu or the unusual Marsala wine soaked pears with a scoop of their home made vanilla bean ice cream.

The place is small, so I am hesitant to let this secret out, but I feel like being generous and so I want others to know how good dinner really can be. After writing this, I can't wait to go back.
author: Omar M.

description:
My friend wanted to take me to a nice restaurant to celebrate my birthday. He was searching online and asking me what I wanted for dinner and I told him to just surprise me. He did a wonderful job and Ristorante Milano was great! My BF did call and make a reservation for 8:30pm on Wednesday however we arrived a little after 9pm. It wasn't a issue at all because there was no wait and we were sat right away. It's nice that the restaurant closes late. The place is very small with a warm and inviting feel. The decor is simple and elegant with nice heavy sliverware and I like the small festive Christmas tree on every table. One thing that I really loved is they offer you sparking water! Every restaurant offers water, some even give you a lemon but I love sparking water so that fact that Ristorante Milano offers this (with no extra charge) was a plus. The bread and oil wasn't my favorite. I thought that the oil was going to be flavored like the California Pizza Kitchen oil and bread and it wasn't. It lacked flavor however our meals did not! I ordered the linguine with fresh shellfish and it was out of this world! One of the best dishes I ever had! It was just bursting with flavor with every bite and a good mix of each shellfish. My friend ordered the mix of grilled chicken, lamb, and sausage served with green beans and potatoes. I tasted his and it also was flavored well and very good! The portions are just right. We ate it all and opted out for dessert however I was pleasantly surprised when the server brought out a few cookies for us to enjoy. They were hard cookies and I like soft so I wasn't a fan but my friend liked them. 

There were a couple things that really stood out for me that the staff did to wow me. First, after we finished our dinner, I moved because I wanted to sit next to my friend as we ate the cookies. When the server noticed that, he came and turned the table for us. He didn't have to do that it was fine how it was but he just wanted to make us feel comfortable I guess and that was appreciated. Secondly, the  servers always pour the water for you. It's on the table and you can easily grab it and pour it your self but they always were right there to do it. It's so nice knowing they don't want you to lift a finger! 

I loved the linguine and fresh shell fish. It is now one of my favorite meals and I look forward to going back!
author: Lex B.

description:
This place was super cute and we got one a table on the balcony looking down in to the dining area. It's pretty tight up there, but it was a table with 7 of us. We started with a plethora of appetizers including the crostini ai funghi, carpaccio, mozzarella con peperoni, and insalata romana. The insalata romana was a little bitter for me, but everything else was fresh and delicious. The mozzarella with roasted peppers is an awesome way to start an Italian dinner.
