I love angel hair pasta, so I got the capelli dangelo al filetto di pomodoro. Very light and simple. Sauce was flavorful and great with all the pieces of meat everyone else at the table handed to me.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Every time I go here I am Wowed. The service is spot on but it is the food to come for. House made lamb ravioli  & line caught sword fish specials were stellar. The gilled calamari appetizer is worth a trip by itself, so tender.
 I work just a block away and always say to myself after having dinner at Milano " why don't I come here more often". It's just sooo good.
author: Barbi T.

description: Aldo and the staff make this cozy little place tucked in a neighborhood our favorite TRUELY AUTHENTIC Northern Italian food restaurant. Stop in and be treated like family. Also, this is the best gnocchi I have ever had, including when traveling in Italy
author: Chris C.

description:
GO TO THIS RESTAURANT! 

I had to write that in case people were skimming the reviews. This restaurant was so good, I am extremely impressed--and I am a tough critic. The first thing that impressed me was the ease at which I was able to make a reservation (how San Francisco......not!) We were greeted and seated promptly by actual Italians, not some white boy who pronounces Gnocchi, GUH-NO-CHI. We started with the burrata salad which was excellent and generously portioned. My GF, Little Ham, had the risotto w/ truffle and I had the linguine "fruits del mer"--it was incredible. I can honestly say it was the best pasta I ever had in my life. No joke. 

Also, I forgot to mention, the wine was so reasonably priced, bottles start at around $30. The whole bill totaled $110 including Gelato for dessert. We also witnessed two birthdays, they sing happy birthday in Italian and bring a really nice piece of cake. Of course they do!! What would you expect???!

Incredible meal, incredible deal, top 3 restaurant in SF in my humble opinion. 

Just go. Thank me later.
author: Ben K.

description:
Yelp was right on! What a find!!
Food was delicious! From the appetizers to the dessert. The Veal Piccata was excellent!  We had three other pastas at our table. My brother loved the lasagna! All pasta noodles are made fresh!! 
Our waitress was the prettiest Italian gal from Torino, Italy. 
A must try, you won't be disappointed!
author: Maria C.

description:
When I lived in Russian Hill 20+ years ago, we used to go to Ristorante Milano. We were in our first real jobs, in a real apartment with rooms designated for their intended uses; we were big girls. A few blocks away with its suave Italian staff and swoon-worthy food, Ristorante Milano was one of the first "adult" restaurants we frequented. At the time, one of the waiters was the now-owner of Umbria on 2nd. Oh the fun we all used to have flirting and giggling and stuffing our faces at Ristorante Milano.

Now we're middle-aged goddesses. We decided to go there for a nice meal while one of us was in town for the holidays. Ordered and consumed:

Mushroom bruschetta with mascarpone(?)
Squash and mozzarella bruschetta
2 plates of gnocchi with light tomato cream sauce
1 plate of homemade fettuccine with creamy sausage sauce
1 plate of roast veggies
1 poached pair with granita
1 espresso granita with whipped cream
1 tira misu
4 glasses piemonte barretta

Wow. We stuffed our faces at RIstorante Milano again!

We tried to convey our sentiments to the owner, who we recognized from 25 years ago. And he graciously acknowledged remembering us. But of course he did. It was a sweet evening and we all look happy.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
Solid "4 plus"

Stopped in earlier this year for a casual meal, my daughter and her friend ordered the gnocchi and their eyes glazed over while they ate iti! Spent a good amount for the dinner, with wine/dessert and all, but it was worth it. The sauces are fresh and, like many have said, after a few bites you could almost imagine being in an outdoor cafe on the piazza by the Duomo.

I would recommend this for a date night. It's nice to find an authentic-feeling restaurant in this amazing city. I'm going back on my next trip to SF. Mangia.
author: John H.

description:
I have not had food this good in SO long.  I got to try a lot of the food because my friends and I all pick at each others' food.  I would skip straight to the entrees because I think they're the most worth it!

I ordered the Ravioli del Giorno, which is just the house made ravioli.  It was forgettable, actually... but only because there are so many better things on the menu. It would kind of be like ordering a Caesar salad when there are a bunch of other types of unique salads.  In any case, it was still good.

WHEN I come back, I would suggest the Tonnarelli all a Capricciosa.  It has mushrooms + sausage, and it is SUPER creamy.  The flavor is very mushroomy, so be prepared for that!  I love mushrooms, which is why I really enjoyed this.

The reason I like their pasta so much is because
1) the pasta itself is SO GOOD.  it's the perfect consistency, and it retains their sauces very well.
2) the sauce to pasta ratio is perfect.  they complement each other very well, and like i said, the sauce actually sticks onto the pasta, so you're not getting random bites of flavorless or flavorful pasta.

Downside?  The wait is AWFUL.  Our reservations were for 9:00, but we still had to wait a while because the table they had anticipated finishing up was taking a bit.  The place is small, but pretty romantic.  Very SF :)  Anddddddd... it's also kind of hot inside.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Wednesday double date night!!! We met up with my fiancé's good friend from college and they are both from Italian families. The restaurant is located in charming nob hill and has a quaint atmosphere.

For apps, we ordered the grilled calamari with white beans and a squash bruschetta. Both appetizers were delicious. It's great to have calamari on a menu that's not always breaded and deep fried. Very similar to what you would see in Europe. The butternut squash bruschetta was a great twist on the traditional due to season, so the flavors were perfect for the weather. I loved that the portions were large, bread slices were toasted well (crunchy and yet still doughy) and had large slices of buffalo mozzarella on top.

For dinner, I ordered the traditional house-made fettuccine with meat sauce. The pasta was a little too thick for being fresh made but the sauce was good. My fiancé's gnocchi was the dinner choice hit. Go there for he gnocchi!! We then all split the tiramisu and I wished we ordered individuals.

And of course, the olive oil was rich and tangy. Delish!!
author: Theresa N.

description:
It was her birthday and I told her I would take her to any restaurant she wanted for dinner.  For various reasons including proximity she picked Ristorante Milano which is a 2 minute walk from my flat.  Quite the charming decor and authentic Italian.  She writes and speaks college level Italian and misses Italy so how convenient that when we drove by Aldo was outside and I asked if we could get a reservation at 8.  Aldo's a good friend of my sushi chef pal Fujita-san and quite the accommodating proprietor.  
Service is quite good, and we started with the calamari and white beans plus the highly rated chicken livers with bacon, etc. on a skewer.  Those chicken livers are the bomb - must order!  Calamari was quite tender and we ordered the featured white and red wine of the night to accompany.
Food server recommended the swordfish, the featured seafood of the night and she had the sausage and cheese ravioli, also the pasta of the day.  Both were superb.  I gave her almost half of my swordfish and received a single ravioli in return but it was her birthday so whatever but boy was it good!  
Concluded with the tiramisu for her and I had the expresso ice which was quite good.  We brought some of the tiramisu home and I ate it later that night.  Everything was rather good and I would have gone 5 stars but I told them it was her birthday and neglected to get candles for her birthday cake earlier in the day so I was in hopes that they would at least put a candle on something so she would have the official birthday cake candle wish blow (I did light my lighter earlier in the day when we had the coffee crunch cake from Japantown with group but it's not an official candle so ...) but Aldo did give us a table for 4 so we had lots of room to spread out despite the Friday night crowd.
Foods great.  You can't go wrong here.
author: Terry A.

description:
This place is amazing.

We got the Fettucine alla Ghiotta which was some of the best pasta I've ever had. My wife got the 
Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa which was really good (not as good as the ghiottA)
author: Shawn E.

description: wow! what an experience! My birthday was so fun their with my best friend. The food the staff so amazing... We had ravioli that was out of this world and nothing like i have ever had before,, duck pate and a meat tray , was off the charts could not get enough.. and the desert they brought for two to share for my bday and a candle :) can we say explosion of happiness.... Thank u guys for one amazing Birthday
author: Randy M.

description:
Wonderful as usual. The entryway was packed and the restaurant was packed. We were five minutes late for our reservation due to parking and still, the manager asked who we were and we were seating almost immediately. Thankful for that, since it was 8:30 and we were starving! 

I'm a pretty simple gal when it comes to Italian fare, so a wonderful, lightly dressed beet salad, a glass of red and the best lasagna in San Francisco leaves me happy. I don't ask for much, just the same simple recipes I would find amongst similar restaurants in Italy, and Milano excels at doing things correctly and simply.  Very happy with my experience here yet again.
author: E. P.

description: Great atmosphere, friendly staff / ownership and authentic Italian food. If you have beer with your meal you can escape without spending an arm and a leg. Make a reservation if you're going on the weekend.
author: Garrett J.

description:
I discovered this sweet little place in the 80's and it is still a great romantic spot for dinner. 

The hot zabaglione is not on the dessert menu, but if you ask they will make it for you!
author: Bay G.

description:
Ristorante Milano has remained in the neighborhood for many years, since my childhood, which is a testament to the quality of their food.  While many restaurants in the area have come and gone, Milano has undergone changes to the menu, facelifts, and other adjustments, but still there always seems to be at least a semi-full dining room when I dine there, and the food has always been excellent throughout the years.

The restaurant has a relatively small capacity, and reservations are recommended but not always needed.  The place is cute and a bit unique in it's configuration, featuring a ground level dining room, a small 'street-side' dining space, and a slightly elevated dining space above the main floor.  Total capacity may be around 50 patrons...

The menu seems to have undergone a bit of a transformation- or a reduction in selection to be more accurate.  This seems like a tactical move- although my most recent previous visit was months ago- there seemed to be a lot more selection at that time.  However- I like a more restricted menu where a restaurant really focuses on their 'best items' rather than slews of mediocre items to please the masses.  There are probably 7-8 appetizers, 7-8 pastas, and 7-8 entrees (meat/poultry/seafood), and a couple of nightly specials.  Really a fair number of items to choose from without being overwhelmed. 

On our latest meal several nights ago, we dined on their bruschetta- very tasty but overpriced at two slices for $10, their Tuna carpaccio- FABULOUS and generous in its portion size- a MUST order for me when I return.  My wife enjoyed their gnocchi w/ pancetta and mushrooms, and I consumed their house-made ravioli of the day which was a delicious gorgonzola and sausage mixture.  All of this + a glass of wine and tip combined for $93.  I left feeling that the meal was a tad on the expensive side- but it was really excellent top to bottom, and in reality- I'd probably pay about the same for a lesser meal at most other Italian restaurants that I visit.

In summary, Ristorante Milano is a consistent, intimate, and special little restaurant which I am lucky to live very near to.  I will be back again and again, and highly recommend this neighborhood gem for a great dining experience.
author: Andy S.

description:
Came here for a quick dinner with a fellow bro and it was so romantic, I almost felt obligated to give him a handy afterwards.  The restaurant feels like it's in someone's converted studio apartment, and tables are so close together, you could reach over and fork the last bite from the kid sitting next to you.  What's he going to do about it anyways?  He's a kid and you're a grown-ass man.

We had the anchovies as an appetizer, the seafood linguine and the fish special for entrees, and a chocolate cake for dessert.  The anchovies were light and subtly flavored.  The seafood linguine was a monstrously sized dish that was beautifully seasoned and overflowing with clams, mussels, and shrimp.  The portions here are tremendous given how bougie this place is.  The dessert was a little disappointing, but only because everything else was so good.  

Come here if you want to have sex with whoever you're eating with afterwards.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Hidden little spot - with about 15 tables and a staff of real Italians serving, you can't NOT love this place.

Our waitress was cute and funny and knew just the suggestions to make. We each had a pasta dish and shared a salad. The noodle are made ON SITE (perfecto!)

After my first glass of wine, upon returning to check on us, the wiatress asked "do you trust me?" in very Italian-accented English, and brought me an even better galss of wine from her home region on Italy. Talk about reading your customers tastes.

Tiramisu for dessert - but of course. Delicate, sweet, and irresistible. 

The quaint and intimate spot is somewhere I wish there were more like.
author: Andrea T.

description:
Ristorante Milano was, aliteration aside, absolutely amazing. I love the fact that its location is relatively hidden in comparison to the surrounding Polk St. area. It has a great date atmosphere, nice lighting, few tables, and amazing service.

Upon arriving they offered to take our coats... who does that anymore?! It was a great touch. After looking over the menu I was curious if they would make me lemon chicken with angel hair pasta, which was not on the list... they did, and it was decadent.

I cannot believe that this place offers half off bottles of wine on Wednesdays, they have a rich selection. Definitely going back.
author: Jason M.

description:
It's been awhile since Yelp steered me wrong- but, in this instance, Yelp did not pull through as it normally does. (You let me down fellow Yelpers.) 

I made a 7:00 reservation for a friend and I on Friday night. First of all, this restaurants location is a little strange. Only 2 blocks off Polk, in a residential district, it feels a little out of place- but I can dig it. Anywho, an older gentleman (owner?) Told us we'd be seated as soon as he had a table available. (I'm sorry- but doesn't this void the whole point of a reservation?) Anywho- we didn't wait too long- but I was a little surprised a table wasn't available.

The restaurant is quaint and cozy- and the layout is a little strange. We were seated in the upstairs portion (4 tables total) and enjoyed people watching from our little corner.

Our server, although friendly, was SLOW. We waited quite awhile for our meals (but very much enjoyed the wine!) My girlfriend ordered the Tornatelli with Sausage and Mushrooms- I ordered the Saltimbocca. Let's review, shall we?

PASTA: Her dish, although described as "lightly creamed" was anything but light. She described it as being "covered in Campbell's cream of Mushroom soup." I tried a bite, and felt it severely lacked flavor. The crumbled sausage was kinda a joke- and didn't add a whole lot to the dish. 

CHICKEN: The greens with this dish were delicious- as were the mashed potatoes. But the dish, in it's entirety, was a salty, oily mess. Although flavorful, I couldn't get over the oil that floated on my plate.

The bread was delicious and soft- and the rosemary olive oil was  a great accompaniment (but I couldn't taste the rosemary!)

At the end of the night it was apparent something was burning in the kitchen- and a smoky haze hung over the place the rest of the time we were there.

It did the job- but the experience, as a whole, was a little lack-luster.
author: Annalise F.

description:
I came to Milano with my sister and her friend to celebrate. We had a bottle of Pinot Noir from the Russian River because red's from this area never disappoint. We had appetizers, entrees, and deserts. We basically gave Milano every chance to screw something up. But they didn't.

We ordered sauteed mushrooms on bread - it was delish and went perfect with the dark and nosey pinot noir. For an appetizer I had the King Salmon. I've never had such a perfectly cooked salmon. 95% cooked on one side only, then the other 5% on the other. The char on the cooked side was deep and had a wonderful crunch. When I sliced into it, it was beautifully raw and the whole fish sang with juices. Spectacular. I had an espresso as we finished up with Tiramisu and cheesecake - both delicate, light, and sweet. Bravo.

I wouldn't recommend going with a bigger group than 4 and I would recommend making reservations ahead of time. Ask for the table on the higher floor in the back corner - it's the best.
author: Grayson K.

description:
It's a beautiful space.

The service is on-the-ball. 

The pasta is freshly made. But ... it's just not 5-star food. It's solid, but for its price-point, I think it is just above average. The marinara is not very complex, the riosotto is creamy, but not tricking you into thiking that the starches were replaced with a hafl-stick of butter.

Still, it's a thoroughly enjoyable experience that I recommend at least once.
author: Jackson B.

description: This restaurant was average.  It wasn't bad, it wasn't great.  Probably in any other city this would be great but because there are so many AMAZING italian restaurants in SF this restaurant becomes average.
author: Leslie S.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE --- found it after doing a search via Yelp and OpenTable to find a late Friday night reservation for four.  It's really a great find.  I loved the homey feel to it, the service was wholesome and very good, and literally a half mile from our hotel in Nob Hill.

I got to try the:
-- Mushroom bruschetta:  Mmmm delicious!  Why do I not see this at more places?
-- Angel hair pasta: Absolutely awesome.  I DEVOURED the entire plate.
-- Pera cotta: Awesome.  Something special and different than other desserts
-- Tiramisu: Good.  Good solid tiramisu.
-- Lasagna: Good.  I'd choose the angel hair pasta over this.
-- Wine was delicious.  I don't remember which one it was because I was not drinking that night.

Would love to return again some day.  4.5 stars rounded up to a 5 star.
author: Arry Y.

description: My husband and I dined here on our last night in San Francisco. The food was delicious and service was excellent. When we first arrived the place was empty, but filled up fast so be sure to make a reservation. We had the grilled squid and cannellini bean appetizer. I had the chicken saltimboca and he had the veal of the day. Both were great! Would definitely go back if in San Fran again!! Tip- go early parking takes a while!
author: Caitlin H.

description:
I've been to a number of Italian places in SF, and I often find myself underwhelmed.  The food at most "authentic Italian" places isn't bad, but for vegetarians, it's largely just swimming in cheese (and who can fuck that up, I mean really).  

Enter Ristorante Milano.  Subtle, incredibly, deeply-satisfying, moan-worthy food.  And I can't even speak to the meat/seafood, which people rave about.  I've been here a handfull of times, and not only do they also have at least 2 DEEPLY delectable vegetarian dishes, but they are MIND-blowing.

The service is excellent, the atmosphere is charming and intimate, and the wine is top-freaking-notch (and I'm a French-wine fan and not usually an Italian wine fan.  This makes me sound much snobbier than I am... but the point is, for someone who is not gaga over Italian wine, I've never had a less-than-excellent wine here).

The portions are exactly as they should be- a generous, but not gorging-sized meal.  And between spilling an anti-pasta between two people and my own entree, I was STILL stuffed.
author: Tarah D.

description:
Well prepared and presented food in a cozy atmosphere.  Waiter was attentive and water glass never got below half.  
I had swordfish entre and tuna appetizer.  Portions were nicely sized.  Both were very tasty, but swordfish just a bit over cooked.  That and the slightly cramped feel kept me from giving stars.
author: Ivan J.

description:
I came here on a Sunday evening. Good thing we had a reservation. Every table was filled by the end of the night...granted they only have 8 tables or so.

Nice ambiance that was very cozy.

I got the polenta with meatballs. It was very, very simple...so simple that I think if I attempted to make it, I would actually be successful. It was good though, but I would recommend something more interesting.

I did enjoy the grilled calamari. It was very fresh.

The tiramisu was also heavenly.

Waiter was very friendly. 

Parking is impossible in the neighborhood. However, you can park in the parking lot in front of the Jug Shop for $10. I think the cross streets are Pacific and Polk.
author: Margaret R.

description:
Truly amazing Italian food in a cute spot on Russian Hill. You actually feel more like you're in a secluded cafe somewhere in Rome.  The ambiance is refined yet relaxed, as only Europeans know how to do. The owner and staff are all Italian, which adds to the whisked-away-to-Italy-for-dinner feeling I always have while dining here. The service is impeccable - very attentive and helpful, but not overly so.  The wait staff are kind and lovely people.

While the ambiance and service are wonderful, the star of the show is the food.  The pastas are all house made, and the gnocchi is melt in your mouth divine.  The lasagna is light and creamy, the way lasagna should be (but very rarely is at most restaurants).  Another must try is the mushroom crostini. It's so yummy you'll want two servings.  And the tiramisu really does live up to all the hype - moist and light!

Ristorante Milano is a little piece of Rome on Russian Hill.  Mangia bene!
author: Kim W.

description:
The beautiful thing about visiting SF is that although many things never change (the terrible parking in North Beach, the amazing views, the Golden Gate bridge, the fog), it seems like every time I go there I learn about a great new restaurant that I didn't know about before. 

In this case, it's a cozy neighborhood Italian bistro just off of Polk in the Russian/Nob Hill area. My friends and i had dealt with some major traffic/parking/reservation stress and were starving and desperate for a place to eat. We swerved into the first parking spot we saw and called the nearest restaurant to see if they could accomodate us. They were totally friendly and told us to come on over!

We were seated almost as soon as we got there, though the place was nearly full and very bustling. We had the most adorable waitress who may or may not have been Italian, but greeted us with a cheerful 'buona sera!' 

A quick scan on our Yelp apps showed someone raving that the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa was the best pasta they'd ever had in her life. Due to our rule that we weren't allowed to order the same thing, that dish got poached by my friend, so I had the lasagna, highly recommended by the server. My other friends ordered the Linguine ai Frutti di mare (thus breaking the no double ordering rule). 

The first thing that you notice is the very high quality of the handmade pasta. It really brings any pasta dish to a whole other level. I'd say the best dish was in fact the tonnarelli was the best dish of the bunch, though they were all super tasty. It comes with what they describe as a light cream sauce, though after a while it does start to feel pretty heavy. It was ok with me as I was allowed to slurp up my friend's leftovers! As for my selection, I usually like a more hearty lasagna, with big crusty cheesey corners, and this one was a bit more refined. But don't take my word for it - some lady who wrote a Yelp review said it was the best lasagna she'd ever had, and she lived in Italy!

We also shared a lovely bottle of wine, also recommended by the server, and at the end of the meal we ended up paying only $35 a person and we were completely stuffed. 

I loved little local  gems like this and I hope they stay there forever, so I can pay them a visit whenever I return to my hometown!
author: Christina P.

description: Seriously one of the best Italian joints in SF.  Classic.  Approachable.  And absolutely delicious.  Just sad it took me 7 years to learn about it.  Best kept secret!
author: Megan W.

description: Lovely restaurant for date night or just to enjoy great food. Loved the lasagna,bruschetta, and ravioli. Will be back!
author: Mypinions N.

description:
I would say this place is more of a 3.5 star restaurant. My boyfriend and I saw a lot of potential for the food that didn't quite deliver. We will definitely give it another try.

We ordered the calamari special for appetizer, the rigatoni carbonara and the rabbit entree. The first thing that we noticed is that all the waiters at the place are Italian, not trying to speak with a fake Italian accent at the Olive Garden Italian, but from Italy Italian. They have a seasonal menu that were just updated that day.

The calamari was, without a doubt, the highlight of the meal. It was so fresh and light, with a simple dressing of olive oil, lemon, parsley, tomatoes and shallots. The cannelloni beans have a nice bite to them and lends a bit of creaminess to the squid. 

The rigatoni was very simply dressed. With the cheese, it was a bit heavy and salty. The pancetta was very crispy and flavorful but the dish needed some acidity or arugula to lighten it a bit. The dish was almost great, but not quite there.

I've had rabbit a few times before and the meat is suppose to be a bit sweet. This time around, it literally tasted like chicken. The sauce was flavorful, but we needed more of it. The breast meat was pretty dry and the sauce would go a long way to remedy that. The polenta was gooey and went very well with the meat.

Even though we didn't have the best food at Milano, the place had enough going for it that we'll give it another chance. It has all the hallmarks of a great neighborhood Italian place and I look forward to eating there again.
author: Alice W.

description:
I have been meaning to try the restaurants on Hyde Street. These tender to be more of a fancier and $$$-$$$$ venues. My boyfriend surprised me with choosing this venue for our date. Though the establishment seemed a bit small, it was very cozy and offered italian, yet chic feel. The front of the store definitely made the restaurant stand out with a silver sign that has a blue light hue.  
 
I ordered the special of the night which consist of a seared cod fish with steamed greens on the side with potatoes. Although the fish was good, it was a bit too healthy tasting for me. It was lightly seasoned. I am more of a bold taste type of girl.  
 
My boyfriend ordered the Tonnarelli alla Capriccioso: Housemade pasta in light cream sauce with porcini mushrooms and Italian sausage. Delicious! Full of flavor and savory.  
 
Overall, the ambiance is romantic and cozy. Service was good. I would come back.
author: Becky Q.

description: We were looking forward to dining here, especially with all the great reviews on Yelp.  Unfortunately, we were disappointed.  The service was fine, except for a long wait between appetizers and the entrees.  Also, I was served a wrong entree, which they quickly corrected.  The special bruschetta of the night wasn't even lukewarm and tasted odd.  My entree (saltimbocca) was very good, but the other two entrees had temperature issues similar to the special bruschetta.  This place is pricey, and I expect better service and food than what we received.  We will not return to Ristorante Milano.
author: R F.

description:
The service here is AMAZING. Super nice people. I didn't notice it being slow at all.

The burrata chese appetizer I had was out of this world amazing. Wow. Wow. Wow.

The pasta was homemade, and while I love mushrooms, the porcini pasta just didn't deliver. Neither did the gnocchi.

Overall there were highlights and lowlights; however, the most important part of the meal to me is the entrees. I would come back for sure just for the burrata cheese though!
author: Jess C.

description: Excellent food and service. Best meal I had in SF. Recommend the gnocchi, rabit, and of course the wine!
author: Jon M.

description: The food is absolutely amazing!! The seating on the other hand was very tight! Super small restaurant with literally ONE aisle! Bathroom is ridiculously small but very up-scale menu! 5 stars is for the excellent service and superb food!!
author: Lita M.

description: Line out the door, no table available for our reservation, no table appears like it will be available anytime soon... Yet I can make a reservation for 10 min from now on open table.
author: Richard P.

description: Great food, ambiance and service. Great place for a date. Make a reservation!, it is worth it. Chocolate torte for dessert is literally an orgasm on a fork.
author: chris r.

description:
Used to enjoy this place.  Had an 8:30 reservation.  Showed up on time.  Told by the over-served owner that as soon as the table paid their tab, we'd be seated next.  

This happened not once, but twice.  Other folks outside had similar problems.  Won't be going back.
author: Andrew I.

description:
Wonderful neighborhood Italian restaurant cooking food just like mamma used to make if your mother was...

A. Italian; and
B. An excellent cook.

Nothing overly fancy, but lots of simple fresh flavors that really let the ingredients shine through. And with 50% off wine on Wednesdays it's hard to go wrong. Especially if like us it's about 5 doors from your house.

Last time we went we had calamari, buffina salad, ravioli of the day and veal scallopine. Everything was light and delicious except the veal scallopini which was a bit oversauced for my taste. Not that I didn't eat it all...

Even if it was a mile away this would still be a great restaurant with its combination of great food and friendly helpful service. Do your tastebuds a favor and stop by sometime...
author: Diarmuid R.

description:
It's a well-deserved 4 stars if you're looking for a restaurant with great food where you can gather with your friends and be loud at before a night of dancing.  It's great for  couples if you don't mind the noise.  The restaurant, food, and staff were all authentic.  The area upstairs is a bit too cozy and rather inconvenient to get in and out of your seat if your table is only about a foot away from yours.  (Mind you, I'm an active petite female).  But that won't keep me from coming back for more of their outstanding service, great wine selection, and awesome/authentic Italian food.  

Appetizer:  Bruschetta with Sautéed Mushrooms & Gorgonzola Cheese
Entree:       Veal Scaloppine
Pasta:         Homemade Angel Hair Pasta
Wine:          Red & White
Dessert:     an Excellent Tiramisu!
author: Caitlyn C.

description:
Great place for a date! The service was also impeccable. 

The reason why Im holding a star is that the food was not as good as I expected! I was a little disappointed with our appetizer, which was fresh mozzarella, polenta and peppers. It really lacked flavor.

Also, I ordered the zucchini pasta for my main dish. It tased great but was extremely oily. There was a pool of oil at the bottom of the plate and every bite I took was dripping with oil!

This place is 1 minute walk from my house, and I liked the atmosphere, so I will definitely come back to try again. Still have hope!
author: Ariadne R.

description:
I would probably give this place a solid 4 stars as a neighborhood joint, but on the larger scale of eateries, this is decent, but only a 3.

We ordered the dishes that everyone mentions: Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa and the gnocchi.

I am a HUGE gnocchi fan. While the flavors for this gnocchi were very tasty. the gnocchi itself was only mediocre. The Tonnarelli was good. 

The bread was not very good. It looked and tasted like something I could buy from Cala. 

I would probably go back and try something with a simple meat sauce or more traditional, but if I had the same experience again, I would not go out of my way to eat here with all the other things to try in the city.
author: Jess C.

description:
I'm roused from review-writing hibernation because I enjoyed Ristorante Milano so much. It's so easy to make mediocre pizza and pasta, and many Italian restaurants can dand do, so it takes quite a bit to get me excited--especially because I've been spoiled by Boston's amazing Italian food.

The server was friendly and gracious. He ran us through a number of specials that weren't on the menu.

I started with a beet, green bean and orange salad. The produce was impeccable and nicely dressed. On to another special, the butternut squash risotto with sage. I have never had risotto this good! Without any dairy it managed to have a very creamy mouth-feel, thanks to the silky squash texture. The risotto grains hit "al dente" right on the...tooth.

For dessert I had a simple and nice roasted pear cotta with sorbet.

My friend had a beautifully prepared roasted veggie salad--they do nice things with vegetables here--and a seafood linguine that she enjoyed a lot.

I'm surprised there weren't lines out the door here. I'll be back.
author: Elinor A.

description:
Pasta - 5 stars
Service - 4 stars
Ambiance - 3.5 stars

Despite the fact that parking is a b*tch, the food is so worth it especially if you're looking for an authentic Italian pasta place. 

Even with reservations, we had to wait at least 25 min for a table for 2. After our hostess seated 2 couples before us, she apologized for the longer than usual wait (we assumed that these folks ahead of us also had reservations). I jokingly responded "no problem since I'm sure you will comp us some dessert, right??!!" She immediately responded "OF COURSE!" I really didn't expect that so she gets kudos for being so sweet and generous! 

Both the Fettucine alla Ghiotta (think homemade fettucine in a white cream sauce with fresh cherry tomatoes) and the Capelli d'Angelo al Filetto di Pomodoro (angel hair pasta with fresh tomatoes and garlic) were delicious! Our on-the-house tiramisu was also splendid! I'll be coming back...soon!
author: Helen Y.

description: Went here for my birthday weekend! All I can say is wow!! The customer service is amazing. The moment we walked in the door we were warmly greeted. Our appetizer was brilliant! We had the mozzarella and peppers. It was very tasty! We then had our main course... I had the gnocchi and my partner had the lasagna! Both were delicious... We finished off the evening with the chocolate cake that was delivered with a happy birthday song, sung in Italian!! All around great place to eat! Good food, good drinks & great service! Who could ask for more!:)
author: Charles B.

description:
Overall very good, a little expensive but worth it.

Small place with very good thin pizza, salads and pastas.

Take a taxi, difficult to park
author: Jeanne C.

description: Impressive food for the delicate palate. The chef layers flavors with intention and restraint. This was the marquee dinner of our tenth anniversary trip. The service was extremely attentive and they comped us a dessert in celebration of our longevity. Quaint and surprising little bistro.
author: Cory W.

description:
I am so surprised that I haven't written a review for Ristorante Milano considering that it is without a doubt my FAVORITE restaurant. Every time I find myself in San Francisco, you can be sure we have reservations for dinner here.  

By now, my boyfriend and I have probably ordered every pasta that they offer and have yet to be disappointed. Our favorites are the Gnocchi con Salsa Aurora, Fettucine al Sugo di Carne alla Milanese, and Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa.  I also remember ordering some type of seafood pasta in the past but haven't seen it on the menu in a while. Regardless of what they put on their house made pasta, you can be sure that the ingredients are fresh and delicious.  

The staff is always friendly and welcoming while the environment feels very warm and homey.   Ristorante Milano always delivers amazing food and provides the perfect atmosphere for great memories too.
author: Michelle H.

description: Amazing!  Loved all of our apps, entrees and desserts. Service was fantastic. Wine was great. Locals hang out. Can't wait to come back.
author: Loretta D.

description:
I lived in close proximity to the NorthEnd in Boston, which has one of THE best Italian dining neighborhoods in all of America.  And so since then I've been searching high and low for an Italian restaurant that served some solid pastas and traditional Italian dishes. 

I think I've finally found something that can be comparable to that in Milano.  It's a nice little romantic spot, great ambiance, its small but quaint and comfortable.  At about 9pm on a sunday night, there was no wait at all.  Our waiter was friendly and helpful in explaining things and providing recommendations (like their linguini is house-made, but not their spaghetti).  He also recommended our appetizer which was the Burratta cheese over a bed of arugula salad.  We loved it, so smooth and soft, it melts in your mouth, MMmMm yum.

I had the Clams and shrimp in linguini with basil tomato sauce which was excellent.  My friends ordered the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa which was fantastic.  The dish was sweet and a little heavy but damn good, I never had anything like it before.

We ended our meal with the a poached pear, with pear sorbet in a wine reduction sauce which was refreshing.  The sorbet was like eating a cold pear puree, so good.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I've eaten here 4 times and I'll continue going back!  They do a good job satisfying my pasta cravings.  

Atmosphere:
Warm, welcoming and cozy.  Sometimes a little too cozy because I can hear everything being discussed at the tables next to me. 

Service:
Friendly ... but not very fast.  The place is small so they can't overstaff ... there are usually only 2 servers handling the whole restaurant.    

Food:
The pastas are homemade, covered in rich delicious sauces and served in decent sized portions.   My favorite pasta dish was a special that hasn't reappeared in sometime: the orecchiette special.  It was simply delicious.  Mike's favorite is the tonnarelli covered in a slight cream sauce with mushrooms and sausage.  The angel hair with tomato and basil has a lot more sauce and cheese than I'm used to ... but that doesn't mean I gobble it all up!  The only things that weren't to my liking were the skimpy glasses of wine, the linguini frutti di mare (really small pieces of shrimp and maybe a bit too salty), and the mushroom risotto.  

The next time I go, I'm ordering the gnocchi!  I've heard good things about it ... and I always regret not ordering it when I see them bringing out the dish for another table. 

Who knows ... maybe the gnocchi will bump this up a star ... but until next time, this place remains a 3-4 start joint in my book!
author: Dina H.

description:
This is a lovely neighborhood restaurant with delicious food, friendly service, and an elegant yet casual atmosphere, all for reasonable prices.

We shared two appetizers, the bruschetta and chicken liver, both of which I would order again. For mains, we had the seafood linguine and daily special ravioli, all freshly made there. The lamb was simply prepared but perfectly cooked and tasty.

We were entertaining an out-of-town friend on a Wednesday night, and it was very busy. The service was a little slow, so I'm glad we ordered appetizers to hold us over until the main courses.
author: Amanda M. C.

description: Very quaint restaurant with great wine and tiramisu! We had a 7 pm reservation and the place was empty...I thought it was odd for the reviews... But just realized we were a wee bit early for the local crowd, as it was jammed by the time we left! Go try the capellini!
author: Jill G.

description:
The linguine ai Frutti de Mari was outstanding. The pasta was freshly made earlier in the day. Every single clam and muscle was perfectly steamed. The shrimp and scallops were soft yet tasteful from the sauce. 
I enjoyed the linguine so much that I ate most of it before getting through the seafood. So asked for more and they obliged happily. Now that's wonderful customer attention!
author: John M.

description:
I went to restaurante Milano las friday and I got in love with this restaurant!
The food is amazing... 
- Calamari: they are grilled, so so yummy.
- The taglierini con i frutti di mere, one of the best pastas I've ever eaten. 

And the waiters were so friendly and helpful... 
I think it is a real restaurant, where they still look more the food they give than than the colors of the tables!
author: Gori V.

description: Fabulous restaurant - a real neighborhood gem!  Was in town with my husband and two teens. We were greeted by the most friendly hostess/owner. Waiter was wonderful and offered suggestions. We ordered a great red, apps, four different homemade pastas - all unique and absolutely incredible!  I would go back every time I am in town!
author: Susie D.

description:
I am so glad I trusted Yelp on my visit to San Fran.  If it wasn't for all the reviewers and foodies, I would not have found this jewel of a place.

Walking by, my family and I were a little intimidated because of the size, but we went in anyways.  Seeing as how we went around the time the restaurant opened, there were very few people there, and we were seated without a problem.

The restaurant is so cozy and romantic, yet simple.  It made me want to find a date just to match the atmosphere. Everything made the atmosphere perfect, from the server to the other diners.

My family and I ordered an appetizer of prosciutto, melon, fig and mint; seared albacore tuna served with a fava bean sauce, vegetables, and potatoes; pasta with porcini mushrooms in a cream sauce; and seafood linguine.

The foods were cooked very well.  I was concerned about the tuna because many places overcook the fish, but it was seared well on the outside while the inside was a rare.  The flavors of the dishes were very simple, bordering on plain; however, something about each dish tied everything together.  Most notable is the perfect texture of the pasta.  I have never had pasta this good.  We ended everything with a light tiramisu.

Great last meal for San Francisco trip!
author: Shannon T.

description: What a wonderful experience! The host was friendly, the server was knowledgeable and made great suggestions. Had the bruschetta and the homemade gnocchi - so flavorful and the portion size was filling. Would recommend for a date night or small family dinner to enjoy this intimate atmosphere.
author: Crystal H.

description:
I love this place. Their grilled squid is the best that I've had anywhere! Also, they make their gnocchi and ravioli fresh, which just melts in your mouth.  As I tell my friends the gnocchi is just "pillows of awesomeness!"  Oh, and don't forget to have the tiramisu! You will not be disappointed.

I would give this 5 stars, but when I put my reservation in, stating it was our anniversary, they stuck us in the middle of the room next to a loud lady and it was not intimate (or should I say, "too intimate") for the occasion.  I guess I will have to specify I want either a table on the loft, or in the front room by the window.
author: Julie L.

description:
Lucky to get a res last Friday night for 4 in this tiny gem.  After a month long cleanse, it was finally time to reintroduce glutinous grains into my diet... and being the product of a proud upstate NY town with primarily Italian heritage, I was jonesin' for some pasta.  Linguine, to be more precise, and linguine vongole with white sauce to be exact.  I haven't been impressed with Bay Area Italian since I moved here in 2010 (WTH?) but Ristorante Milano was my best Italian dining experience so far and for that, 4 stars.  

We waited 30 minutes past our 8:30 reservation because, as our waiter told us, the earlier tables were taking their sweet time finishing their meals.  I don't know if there was romance in the unusually warm San Francisco evening air or what, but the host, Aldo was great with us and we didn't mind waiting on the bench outside until he came out to seat us.  

The atmosphere is clean, modern mediterranean.  The menu was simple and contemporary. The service was excellent. 

 We ordered:
- the burrata appetizer with arugula and fennel (because I just can't help myself), a very nice local burrata
- carpaccio di tonno, a generous portion of excellent sushi grade tuna
- gnocchi with creamy tomato sauce (my least favorite of our order, small gnocchi.. meh)
- spaghetti with sausage meat sauce, rich and savory (do not remember what it was called, we ordered it for the protein)

and the shining star:
-LINGUINE AL FRUTTI DE MARE - delightful homemade linguine, fresh shellfish, white wine sauce that made my heart go pitter-patter.  

I am so grateful to find this place in a city where GOOD Italian food is such a challenge.  I will be back.
author: Jemma L.

description:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday dinner and it was perfect! A cozy, well decorated restaurant in a cute neighborhood. The atmosphere was romantic and our service was very friendly. The food was delicious- everything we ordered was so flavorful and well rounded!! We will definitely be returning. 
Highly recommend for a dat/ anniversary/ special occasion
author: Erin A.

description: Had a nice dinner here and was fortunate to squeeze in a reservation with only an hours notice. Very professional, genuine and pleasant service start to finish. My fiancé and I both started with the Burata salad with arugula and the persimmon salad which were excellent. We followed with the homemade linguine with fresh shaved Italian truffles added table side. We also had the swordfish which was good but not great. - tasted burned. The sides of sautéed vegetables and potatoes was excellent. Ambiance was ok but nothing special. Overall, excellent service and food worth coming back for.
author: Philip D.

description:
Our waitress was great; very friendly and helpful. I loved the mushroom bruschetta with the tangy gorgonzola.  My date ordered the Linguine Ai Frutti Di Mare, which he is still raving about and I ordered the lamb chops, which were quite tasty. The tiramisu was delish, as well. 
Great restaurant, nice ambiance.
author: Annie C.

description:
Visiting SF for 2 days and this was high on the to-do list. My BF loves Italian and I wanted to make his tummy happy.

Had 7:30pm reservations on a Saturday night. Arrived at 7:15 and there were atleast 6 people ahead of us. Sat down around 8ish. The owner came over and apologized for the wait and offered us a drink on the house.

I ordered:Pollo e Verdure alla Griglia. I was not completely happy with my food but I have never sent a plate back in my life. I didn't like the bitter shallots. The Chicken was delicious. Next time I will pick something else.

He ordered:Grigliata Mista: He LOVED it, and I loved his plate as well. 

Our waiter helped us with a Wine selection and thankfully it was an awesome bottle selection! Our waiter also let us borrow his phone to map the Bart to get us back to our hotel because our phones died.

Good place for a date. Very intimate setting!! Have patience for the wait. Remember that all the good stuff is worth waiting for.
author: Camille I.

description:
Went here with some friends in early January. What we ordered was pretty good.

Pros: 
Gnocchi: pillowy, soft. I had no idea what gnocchi was until I came here!
appetizer: some bread with tomato, cheese, & spinach. 

I ordered some kind of sausage patty. Really heavy on the oil, but it was alright. Presentation of all dishes was top-notch. Waiters were on-target. 

Cons:
- it's PACKED. I think that's probably just something characteristic of the city. But it isn't very pleasant to not even have 12 inches of clearance between you and other patrons, and the other patron is whining and cursing about some drama-related issue. SHUT UP, I wanted to say to her. Not my idea of good ambiance! 
- Like everything else in the city, pricey. 

Verdict: If I was in the area, why not?
author: Justin F.

description:
My boyfriend took me here on Saturday night for my birthday dinner and everything was AMAZING.  From the romantic setting, impeccable service to the delicious food and drink, everything was perfect.  The restaurant itself is quite small, but the seating is well laid out so it doesn't feel cramped.  Both the host and our server were great.  Our server was friendly, attentive and helpful.  He was knowledgeable about the menu and able to suggest dishes and recommend his favorites.  

DELICIOUS dishes we ate:
- Bruschetta (from the specials menu)
- Lasagna (from the specials menu)
- Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa (Housemade pasta in light cream sauce with porcini mushrooms and Italian sausage)

We washed down our dinner with a bottle of their featured Italian white wine which complimented the dinner nicely.

I find that I rarely eat Italian food now that I live in San Francisco (as opposed to growing up in NJ) but RIstorante Milano will certainly change that!
author: Liz H.

description:
My husband and I love Italian food, and really wanted to like this place.  However, it didn't wow us.  

Here's what we've tried, per yelp suggestions: 
- mozzarella con peperoni (roasted peppers & mozz over grilled palenta)
- tonnarelli alla capricciosa (pasta with cream, mushrooms, and sausage)
- fettucine alla ghiotta (pasta with cream, sausage, and tomatoes)

We've also tried a couple of their specials:
- ricotta cheesecake
- grilled calamari appetizer (good, but unexpectedly expensive -- like $30!) 

The quality of each plate was high, but for some reason the flavors didn't come together for us.  The two pasta dishes were extremely heavy -- you couldn't eat much of either.  And again, the pricing is through the roof.  I'm not cheap, but there are other high quality Italian restaurants in SF that have more reasonable prices.  

Bottom line:  I wouldn't return, but I see how some people would enjoy this place.
author: Jade F.

description: I recently took a trip to Italy and it's pretty hard to find a restaurant here in the states that comes anywhere close to an authentic Italian experience. Well, this is it! I was in SF for just a weekend and we really wanted to find a good Italian restaurant. There are not enough superlatives to describe this place. Made an easy reservation through Open Table. After finally discovering where to park, we were taken right to our little 2-person table by the window, I ordered the Lasagna. Get it!!! So good. The wine bottle special was amazing, our server was wonderful and the owner stopped by to chat as well. Can I give this more than 5 stars?
author: Mark G.

description: Ristorante Milano is one of those places that reminds me why I am so fortunate to be living in SF -- and Nob Hill specifically, for that matter. Tucked in a mostly residential area, with the exception of the businesses on Hyde Street, it's a quaint restaurant (maybe 30-35 seats tops) and serves up authentic, delicious Italian food. I ordered the gnocchi in a gorgonzola/tomato based sauce, and it was absolutely delicious. May be one of my favorite new spots in the city!
author: Mel G.

description: Great little neighborhood gem: fantastic salads and the best puttanesca, ever. I'll be back, for sure.
author: Jesse J.

description:
I went here for a friend's birthday dinner a few weeks ago. We had a long, private table at the front of the restaurant with windows overlooking the street. They did a great job accommodating our ~10 person group.

For an appetizer, the group ordered Fegatini alla Griglia (chicken liver with bacon). It wasn't my thing but others really enjoyed it.

For my main, I ordered the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa (so did 4 other people in my group, following the organizer's recommendation). It struck the right balance between lightness and richness. Very mushroomy in flavor, but without that sometimes-off-putting mushroom texture. The meat is ground up and subtle, both in flavor and texture. The portion size was a little small, but overall very solid dish. Fair warning: it was pretty salty (I like my food salty).

Service was great. The brought out a piece of bday cake at the end.
author: Max H.

description:
Exceptionally pure ingredients used according to italian traditions. Prepared with care and attention to balance all flavors.
I will definately come back (and bring friends!)
author: Yuri B.

description:
This restaurant is like a quaint NYC Italian restaurant on the unassuming winding, tree lined blocks of the West Village. Posh, but unpretentious. Fancy, but not over priced. Old world, but modern. 

And then you have the food. Excellent wine list. Italian beers. Starters like roasted red peppers over polenta with fresh buffalo mozzarella. Home made pasta with scallops and an intensely flavored, yet light cream sauce. 

Basically, this place is perfection.
author: Shira O.

description:
This place was amazing. All the reviews attest to the fresh pasta and taste that is on par with excellence. Tried the Gnocchi and it was great! Someone wrote that they were pillows of Heaven- I must concur. The Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa was also great and favored by many yelpers so I had to try it!

if you don't make reservations you my be left outside waiting in the cold, since the restaurant is small, but rest assured they will try their best to accommodate you as soon as possible. Service was great; atmosphere was quaint and cozy; and the food delic and off the beaten path and tourist trap of North Beach
author: Mia S.

description:
Can't believe I've lived here for so long and recently discovered Ristorante Milano! Tucked in Russian Hill, I was excited to try Northern Italian food. It felt like home to me and my dads cooking. Came here with my brother and greeted with a warm welcome by the owner Aldo who spoke to us in Italian. Once he heard our last name, he just knew we were Italian.

The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and a cozy feel to it. We had no trouble with the reservation, which we did about 15min before 8pm on a Saturday night. You can't go wrong with the food, it's genuine and they use traditional Northern Italian ingredients. The great thing is you will see barely any tourists and you can avoid the not so authentic North Beach Italian restaurants. The prices are reasonable, and any Italian restaurant in this city will be a little pricey. 

Here is what you must order to eat:
Carpaccio Di Tonno -Hawaian Bigeye tuna carpaccio, with olive oil, capers & parsley
Linguine ai Frutti di mare- Homemade linguine with fresh shellfish
Tiramisu-Ladyfingers dipped in rum and espresso layered with mascarpone & cocoa

You should definitely make a stop, this place is fantastico!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
It's well over 4 stars, so it gets a Five star review. 

Very nice staff, and very good food. 
The house Cianti was very good also!
author: Frank J.

description:
3 1/2 stars-Tasty, but not a fan.

I first discovered RM when searching for a place to take an out of town friend. She loves it so much we go there at least once during her visits.

RM has an intimate romantic space perfect for small groups (4 people max). The service is impeccable and the food is consistently good. Dishes are simple and lasagna is only served on weekends. 

Overall: you won't be disappointed and the price point is reasonable for the quality.
author: Sophie C.

description:
Phenomenal experience, want to go here again soon. 

My partner's parents were visiting SF for the weekend and we needed a good place for dinner. My partner had just moved to SF and did not realize that you can only get into a popular restaurant on a Friday evening with a reservation, and I haven't lived in the City in years, though I visit a lot. Luckily I found Milano on Yelp, called them, and got a very friendly Italian accent on the phone. The manager told me that he'd just had a cancellation and could squeeze us in at 7:30. We hopped a cab, arrived a few minutes early. and were seated exactly at 7:30. 

My future mother-in-law is 2nd generation Italian-American, so I was hoping this place would live up to its reputation. It did. Everything that we had was excellent, with the possible exception of the crostini that were slightly overtoasted. I'd wanted the fegatini (chicken liver skewers), but when the waitress warned that they'd take an extra 15 minutes, I had the bresaola instead, which was richly umami and salty and served with a pile of fresh arugula and aged parmesano. 

Several in our party had pasta, all apparently done to perfection and highly flavorful. The wine list included a good selection of California, Italian, and German vintages at reasonable prices. We had two bottles of Primitivo, which was spicy and went well with our main courses. 

The most memorable, however, was the pera cotta en marsala, a Bosc pear poached in a syrup of caramelized sugar and marsala wine, served with a pear granita. Amazing. 

Service was prompt and friendly. The establishment itself is cozy without being cramped, and the decor is a blend of Italian modern and some more traditional touches. Can't wait to go back.
author: Cage H.

description: SO Good. I live close to this restaurant, but finally tried it today. Can't believe it took me this long to find this authentic Italian gem. Unbelievably good food, house made pastas and a ridiculous tiramisu. Give this place a chance, you will thank me.
author: Joel D.

description: An often overlooked San Francisco gem. It's hard to go wrong here.
author: Troy H.

description: Following so many positive recommendations from patrons, we gave this a try. Everything went well beyond our hopes. Immediate call back on our phone message (we called for reservations before opening on the day of), great service, and an outstanding meal. Veal so tender and tasty, accompanied by vegetables that were perfectly flavored and sautéed. Risotto was the best, ever!  Warning: parking is scarce, so plan ahead. We took a cab to this perfectly hidden neighborhood hot spot!
author: Jake W.

description:
My favorite Italian restaurant in SF.

Finally the real deal. Traditional, fresh, homemade Italian food served in a cozy restaurant with a warm smile by owner Aldo, family and staff. 

- Great for romantic dinners
- Best for groups of 6 or under
- The lasagna special.... always!

Let them help you with wine recommendations. My personal favorite: The Nobile di Montepulciano.
author: Janett R.

description: AMAZING!!!! This place had the best Italian food I have ever had, even better then when I was in Venice. The service and food was so good I definitely would recommend them and will be coming back here.
author: Adrian A.

description: The atmosphere here was so quaint and cozy. There's a little loft at the back of the restaurant and many of the tables are placed in front of the big inviting front windows. I wanted to LOVE this place, I wanted it to fulfill my every need for a corner Italian joint with a romantic flair, but I have to admit that the food just left me unfulfilled and my wallet sad. The food isn't bad, I'm not saying that, but it's not as great as I thought it would be. The gnocchi was okay, but nothing out of this world and our fresh mozzarella appetizer was definitely not as good as in other Italian restaurants in the city. Our bill for 1 app and 3 entrees (no drinks) was over $90 with tip. Overall, I'll probably give it another shot but with so much delicious food so near by, it doesn't make it to the top of the list.
author: Emily S.

description: Amazing food!  Some of the best Italian food I've ever had.  Service was very good.  I only give it a four due to the high price.  However, the meal was great and my family really enjoyed it.  I'd go back here again.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I was really hoping that the food would be better, but summarily, it was fair at best. We ordered two appetizers (carpaggio and grilled calamari) and four entrees (gnocchi, grilled chicken with radicchio, clams linguini with white wine sauce, and a veal entree). Only the gnocchi was deemed really, really wonderful. The other selections weren't memorable. Dessert was expectantly very good (tiramisu, sorbetto, chocolate ganache cake).

The ambiance was noisy, but I expected that for a small neighborhood Nob Hill restaurant. I just thought the well-reviewed food would compensate for that. Service was really topnotch, though, as we were well-tended. Unfortunately, the cuisine fell rather flat.  One goes to a restaurant for the food, right?

We tried it. We're probably not going back.
author: Frankie D.

description:
We just moved to SF from Boston and have been craving a good italian meal ( like those found in our North End) A yelp review told us to try it out so we came in for valentines day. 

From the moment we walked in the door, we were greeted with the most courteous and friendly service. Our waitress was very helpful throughout the evening with wine & food choices. 

We were thrilled with the level of service, authentic food quality, superb wine selection, and overall "good old fashioned" italian feeling. 

We will definitely be coming again!
author: Jen M.

description:
All the 4+ star reviews on Yelp for this restaurant affirms my belief that too many people in San Francisco lack an appreciation for fine Italian foods. 

I started with the Prosciutto e Melone, which was warmed (?!) proscuitto draped over huge slices of overripe melon arranged around a center of vinegared cucumber and strawberry salad that seemed to have nothing to do with the main dish. the Prosciutto did not have enough bite or flavor to balance out the super sweet, mushy melon, so the beauty of this dish was completely lost. 

then, we had the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa, which could have been decent if the chef had toned down the cream and starch to allow more mushroom flavor. too heavy, very unbalanced. 

finally, the Saltimbocca di Pollo, which was just laughable. I'm not even going to bother reviewing it except to say it was nothing a Saltimbocca dish should look or taste like. 

We passed on the "famous" Tiramisu because we figured it would be just as disappointing as the other dishes. So really, what is up with the four to five star reviews? 

Oh and a note on decor, our table was next to the street windows, which had, I kid you not, a row of very very 90's inspired indoor wax flowers.
author: Clarissa D.

description:
The evening started off a little rough when we entered the restaurant. We were greeted immediately and told them we had reservations. They acknowledged and walked off, which is fine, but they did not say anything, whether we had to wait or that its going to be a few more minutes. 10-15 minutes pass by and we can clearly see tables opening up, but still no acknowledgement on when we would be seated. 

Finally, we were seated and later did we realize they had like a 20 top coming in. Still, communication needs to be made to make a customer feel welcome. We ordered a bottle of wine and received a complimentary bread basket and olive oil for dipping. The bread was yummy and we were starving, so we ate it all. The selection of wine was great, mostly California wines, which we were fine with

We ordered a mushroom crustini that had Gorgonzola cheese. It came with five servings, good enough for two, possibly three. We enjoyed the flavors of the mushrooms and the cheese pairing. The bread was crispy and soft. For dinner, we ordered the fettuccine alla ghiotta and sausage gnocchi. Everything was fresh and you can tell they hand make the pasta there. The gnocchi was soft and flavorful along with the fettuccine. We normally aren't fettuccine eaters, but felt like eating it that night and were not disappointed. The serving sizes were just right. They may look small at first, but its the plating and looks that deceived us.

For dessert, which we had the chocolate torta which was topped with whip cream. We felt it was missing the ice cream element, but still very good.

I would highly recommend making reservations at this place, as it seems to be packed all the time, from other users reviews.
author: Mini P.

description:
A friend of mine moved into the Russian Hill area and we decided to find a local restaurant. After Yelping a few options, we picked Ristorante Milano as the location for their "Congratulations On Moving to SF" dinner.

We had a reservation for two at 6 o'clock, but that early in the evening, it wasn't really needed, but in my opinion, it's always better to have a reservation just in case. 

Ambiance: The restaurant is a nice quaint, hole in the wall that has a real cozy feel to it on the inside. We were seated on their "upstairs" section, which is literally a flight of 4-5 steps which opens to another section that has a few more tables. Because it wasn't that busy yet, it was nice to be able to have a quiet meal as we talked and caught up with each other.

Service: I come from a family that once owned a few restaurants, so I know how hard it is to run a restaurant and how hard it is to give the best quality service one possibly can. Ristorante Milano has no problems with service. Our server(I forgot his name) was some young italian stud and I'm positive that if given the chance, my friend would have preferred to have dinner with him than catch up with me(it's probably the italian accent haha). He was very attentive and checked up on us regularly. Water was always filled and our cups were never close to empty. 

Food: NOW comes the good part. We ordered the following four items: Antipasto plate, gnocchi, veal scallopine, and tiramisu

Antipasto Plate: This was a smorgasbord of vegetarian items: eggplant, roasted peppers, mushrooms, vegetable omelette, and grilled polenta topped with fresh mozzarella and basil. This was the perfect starter. It wasn't too heavy to start and everything was delicious. My friend thought that the mushrooms were a little too tart/vinegary for her taste, but I enjoyed them. I have always enjoyed polenta, but I have never grilled it before. I found that by grilling it, it added a smoky/bbq/grilled flavor to it that helped contrast the rich creaminess of the mozzarella, which complimented the fresh basil on top really well. The roasted peppers and eggplant were delicious and we finished it all!!

Gnocchi: We picked this after reading all of the reviews on yelp and hearing the recommendation on this. I have had store bought gnocchi made at home, gnocchi at other restaurants and homemade gnocchi, made by my italian friend's grandmother, and let me tell you, Ristorante Milano's gnocchi and my friend's grandmother's gnocchi taste very similar, which can attest to the fact that they know exactly what they are doing!! The gnocchi was firm, but wasn't mushy, yet it was soft when you chewed it and not chewy. I've had chewy and mushy gnocchi, Ristorante Milano was neither!! The sauce was nice and creamy, yet not too heavy and rich. My friend ended up taking my dish and I finished her veal scallopine.

Veal Scallopine: The veal scallopine was served with a mushroom marsala sauce with sauteed cauliflower and zucchini and some risotto on the side. The veggies were cooked and seasoned very well, in fact I think I could have finished a whole plate of their cauliflower and zucchini as  a main course. The risotto was well cooked, it may be a little toothy for some, but I prefer a toothy risotto. It also was well seasoned and not too rich. The veal scallopine was delicious and it was covered in a MOUND of mushrooms. I LOVE mushrooms and I LOVE sauces. The marsala sauce was DEEELIISSHHH. I could taste the slight nutty,brandy taste from the marsala wine or madeira wine they used. Again, perfectly seasoned so it wasn't too bland or too salty(a common issue I've had with italian food). 

Tiramisu: Before I get into this, a little background information: I used to be quite the big boy, but after years and years of self-control and changes to my lifestyle, I've lost a good amount of weight, but no matter how healthy I try to eat, or how much exercise I try to get in a week, the fat boy inside of me still wants to come out and play, and play he did when it came time for dessert. My friend and I were super full, but I've heard great things about their Tiramisu so we had to try it. I am a fan of Tiramisu and I must say that I think Ristorante Milano has one of the best tiramisu's I've ever tasted.  There was just the right amount of espresso soaked ladyfingers to contrast the rich mascarpone. mmmmmm fat boy wants to come out and play just thinking about it again.

Conclusion: Overall, it was a very nice dinner. I would highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to meet a friend for dinner or for those that want to take their significant other out for date night.  But there is one downside to this place, and that is that when I go back, it's going to be hard for me to want to try something else besides their gnocchi and if that's the only downside of this restaurant, it definitely deserves its 5 stars.
author: Mikey H.

description:
Gosh I love this place. It's tucked away in the quiet Nob Hill neighborhood, but it's definitely one of the best finds in this area for amazing Italian food without burning a hole in your wallet. 

Really, you can't go wrong with any of the pastas they have on their regular menu, but what I love about this place are their daily specials. Had the fresh grilled calamari for the appetizer and it was delightful. The calamari wasn't overly rubbery, but had just the right texture to it. The fresh seafood pasta special was amazing as well-- just the right amount of spiciness to the sauce, and the pasta was fresh and perfectly cooked.

Oh and most importantly... 50% off a bottle of wine on Wednesdays. Perfect combination to a hearty meal at this neighborhood gem. 

Can't wait to go back..
author: Lynn C.

description:
We went for dinner on New Year's Eve.  What a wonderful experience.  The prices were not increased because of it being NYE.  (We usually avoid places that do this and just return when the prices are back to normal).  

The food was delicious, the service was excellent, the ambiance was warm and friendly.  I started with a lentil soup full of vegetables and absolutely full of FLAVOR.  I took some home (it was so delicious that I wanted to finish it all plus lick the bowl, but I wanted to save my appetite for my pasta and, of course, dessert).  I had the homemade pasta with mussels, clams, shrimps and scallops.  Delicious.   For desserts, I had the Torta Caprese, warm, dark Belgian chocolate almond cake, shaved almonds and cream.  Not only was this delicious, but the texture was amazing.  

I have to go back to Ristorante Milano to try other dishes.
author: Rachel M.

description:
This place is warm and you will definitely score points if you're going here on a date. The people at this restaurant are very friendly and take their food and wine pretty seriously. They've already earned my 4 stars and the food makes it 5! 

You should try their Tiramisu.
author: Nagendra P.

description:
This place is okay, nothing really special.

It's busy, I love the location, but it just didn't do it for me and my girl.

Minus one star: We waited for 20 minutes. Nothing too big however we made a reservation and got there before the party of two got selected before we did for a table. The owner has good intentions although he wasn't paying close enough attention to who arrived when and specifically how long people were waiting.

Entrees: Gnocchi was excellent and the Saltimboca was excellent.

Dessert: Cream Puffs were not very good. Minus one Star

Overall, it's okay. $160 for an okay dinner doesn't resonate well with me. Let's just say I would rather spend that money down Hyde street on Frascati or down Union Street at Trattoria Contadina.
author: Jeff R.

description:
We wanted to eat Italian, but some place small, quaint, and more neighborhood than the usual choices in North Beach. We found Ristorante Milano on Open Table, the reviews were consistently good, so we made our plans - the first time to this establishment for any of us.
4 of us came to dinner last Monday nite, earlier than we would normally eat, but being a work night and experiencing horrible weather, we arrived for a 6pm reservation and were immediately seated at a nice table by the window, in a small room to the right of the entrance. There were perhaps two other tables occupied when we arrived. Our server, Rafael, could not have been more accommodating, being very patient as we kept getting sidetracked in conversation before really focusing on the menu and nightly specials. The menu that night was overflowing with delicious sounding appetizers and entrees. Rafael was again extremely helpful in describing each dish, even helpfully suggesting a couple. One of us has a lactose intolerance and Rafael went over the entire menu describing what they could do modifying a dish to accommodate her restrictions. Being the Christmas season we started with a bottle of champagne before even looking at the menu. After making our dinner selections (including bruschetta, grilled calamari, and green salad appetizers / gnocchi, seafood risotto, veal, and swordfish entrees), Rafael again was very helping guiding me thru an extensive wine list. Though most of our entrees would otherwise suggest a pairing with a white wine, we all wanted an Italian red that would compliment our meal. Rafael made a couple of suggestions, opining that a red with softer tannins would be a good choice. The man not only knew the entire menu inside and out, but he was dead on with the wine.
We had a truly wonderful, memorable evening - great food and wine, wonderful company. The entire staff at the restaurant was extremely attentive without being intrusive. Though patrons were practically lined up out side the door waiting for their tables, we never felt at all rushed to move along. Had the crowd not been so large, we could have lingered much longer, but we happily departed so the table could turn over, completely satiated. It's a winner! We will definitely come back. Thank you Rafael for making the evening such a good experience.
author: Mike C.

description:
Delicious! Perfect atmosphere for intimate gathering. The staff is very welcoming. Service was excellent. 
Prices are reasonable.
author: Aimee G.

description:
Typical Italian place. I didn't think there was anything special about the menu, the location, or the food. But that being said it was good food for dinner.

i didn't like the two seafood dishes we had (sardines and Hawaiian fish).

The pasta dish was good, perfectly cooked fettucine with the right amount of sauce and toppings.
author: Sonia S.

description: Solid Italian, handmade pastas -  very tasty, and the service is spectacular!
author: Lyly N.

description:
This restaurant, in Russian Hill, had a nice, warm atmosphere with a touch of hustle and bustle.  I liked the interior design, it is also warm but modern.  The food was very tasty too!  We had the lasagne (which was on special) and the gnocchi with gorgonzola, tomatoes and basil.  This dish was a treat!  

The only issues we had were with the service.  They weren't unfriendly, they were just clearly understaffed or not good at managing their time.  I worked in the service industry for years, so I'm pretty understanding and granted, it was a Saturday night.  However, while we were seated immediately for our reservation, it took 15 minutes to get menus and another 10 until our waiter greeted us.  I wanted to try the Tiramisu, but by the time we got to dessert, the rest of our group of 6 just wanted to get out of there.  It took over 2 and a half hours to get through our meal.  I do not see a reason to blame any one part of the restaurant (server, kitchen, etc...). They really did just seemed under staffed or perhaps not prepared for it to be busy.  Still, shouldn't you know that it's going to be busy on a Saturday night?  

It is quite likely that this place gives better service on less busy nights.  Just in case, don't come here if you're in a hurry.
author: Chrissy M.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here for a romantic dinner on New Years Eve. It was okay. The place was in a good location for us in terms of where we were headed after to celebrate and we wanted something intimate and small with good food. The ambiance and service was very good. It's a pretty small place and for New Years Eve it was not very busy. 

The main this I had an issue with was the food. Both me and my boyfriend are Italian and we were not impressed with the food at all. After having read the reviews and seeing the price of each dish I expected A LOT more. Oh well.
author: Natalie M.

description:
I went to Ristorante Milano this past Sunday (Dec. 30th) after going to the S.F. Auto Show at the Mascone Center. We showed up at Milano around 4:30ish with out a reservation and was not sure if we would be able to sneak in. Well... We were denied.... Only because they do not open until 5pm lol :o) 

We strolled around the neighborhood for a bit and then came back shortly after 5pm and was able to be seat right away. Although Aldo the owner was not there we were great by his beautiful daughter who does a great job herself hosting. 

We enjoyed our early dinner and I got my usual (Fettuccine Ala Ghiotta) and also had a good bottle of Italian red wine. We then finished up our dinner with dessert and shared some vanilla gelato. 

I felt like I should update my review to show that this place is consistently great. I love the food and the staff. I am very happy to know my journey from Hayward will always be greatly rewarded. My hat goes off to Aldo for having a business with great consistency. I look forward to my reservation on the 18th of December.
author: Aaron J.

description:
Cozy little bistro prime for eavesdropping and casually dropping a hand on a stranger's knee.

Seated immediately in an area with enough daylight to see all the imperfections of the surrounding couples. Our server was warm, ethnically ambiguous, and a low-talker -- we loved her.  She served us an insalata with the freshest of fruit, an enjoyable gnocchi con salsa aurora, a better fettucine alla ghiotta, and a tiramisu I'll be dreaming about.  What a night, huh?
author: Sean S.
