(house-made fresh pasta with mushroom sauce and sausage), the chicken was just about the best chicken dish I've had at a restaurant and very different and ever so delicious, and the tiramisu was amazing and I dont even usually like tiramisu. There was a good selection of wine with decent prices, and we enjoyed our bottle as well as the recommended dessert wine with the tiramisu. 

The service was impeccable. Our waiter was upbeat, thoughtful, knowledgeable and stirred us in the right direction for food and wine suggestions. Our food came in good time, we were seated in a nice private-ish area, since they knew a large party was coming that evening. Water was refilled regularly. We were checked on regularly by the waiter but not too much, we didn't feel like we were being supervised, bugged, or rushed. And at the end, the owner came out to give us the bill, greet us and thank us for the compliments to the food etc and for coming, it was a lovely touch. 

I love the neighborhood too.

We shall definitely be returning, and recommending this ristorante!
author: Arielle G.

description: Wonderful little restaurant on Russian Hill.  Classic Italian dishes, especially anything with polenta or their housemade pasta.  Also very good with fish.  And if it's a weeknight or late on Sunday, maybe they will make you their incredible zabaglione for dessert (it takes too much time for them to do it when they are really busy, so it won't be on the menu).  It doesn't get a 5 star rating only because the place is a little cramped, so the seating can be uncomfortable.
author: Stephen G.

description: These people are REALLY Italian...!  We were able to get into the restaurant at a pretty popular hour - 8:30 on a Thursday night - which is great for a neighborhood spot.  My friend and I shared the grilled ono special and mushroom risotto - yum!  And then we finished it off with profiteroles; I'm not a sweets person, but the profiteroles really hit the spot...  Overall, the menu was pretty extensive with a ton of specials (pastas and meats) and lots of desserts to choose from.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Welcome home!  Wow, nothing like a week in small town New Hamphire to make one realize what a kick ass king supreme city this place called San Francisco is.  After a looong day of travel I decided to pop into Ristorante Milano for an early dinner.  We didn't have reservations, but they accomodated us.  It was a perfect end to the day.  Small room.  Very cozy and mellow.  I wasn't completely mortified being seen in my post holiday fat jeans with no make up and messy hair.  The staff was friendly and made us feel quite welcomed.

After a solid wine rec my stress began to melt away.  The grilled polenta app was good.  But the pasta - yum - the pasta is quite good.  I had the puttanesca.  I do not eat pasta that often, but after being in airports all day surrounded by my bitchy fellow Americans it was exactly what I needed.  This is what I call self medication.  After a few bites I could feel the seritonin boost in my system.  My former bad mood was replaced by a sleepy far away gaze and a half smile.  Enjoy.
author: sarah k.

description:
5 stars for my favorite Italian restaurant in the city! This wonderful neighborhood spot always turns out delightful food and excellent service at a reasonable price. The decor is cozy and inviting. This is a great place to go with a date or a small group, order a bottle of wine, and chat and enjoy every delicious plate the charming waitstaff puts in front of you. The gnocchi is light as a feather and the homemade pastas scrumptious. I love the espresso granita and the tiramisu is unbelievably good.

Parking is difficult so it's best to park at the lots on Polk down the street from the restaurant.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Milano has a real neighborhood feel, with much better fare than you'll find in tourist-trappy North Beach settings. Don't let the circa-1980's exterior put you off; inside you'll have real personal (read: not rushed) service that is attentive but not intrusive.

We had the specials the night we went:

* thick slices of Italian sausage served over a bed of lentils
* arugula salad with sliced fontina and a lemon/olive oil dressing
* ravioli with butternut squash, fried sage, brown butter and grana
* ziti with buttnernut squash, pancetta and sage (totally different palate from the other special, despite the similar ingredients)

The waiter steered us toward a moderately priced, well balanced california (at our request) chardonnay. For dessert, I can't recommend the Tiramisu enough. It is not standard, goverment-issue tiramisu; rather, a rum-soaked orgasm that will leave you very happy.
author: Jason D.

description:
Great neighborhood Italian place.  As other yelpers mention, don't be put off by the cheesy 80s decor.  I actually think it adds to the place.
The staff is attentive and the food delicious.  Good recommendations on wine.  Skip dessert and walk down to Swensen's for ice cream.
author: Pamela D.

description:
Maybe more like 3.25 stars.

The restaurant itself is very romantic -- warm, dark (but not too dark), cozy.  But it's a little loud and the tables way to close together to be intimate as many others have described.

We went on a Friday night, and the service was nice, but a little stretched.  

OK.  The food.  We started with Speck e Formaggi.  The prosciutto was perfect.  The "imported Italian cheeses" were a black truffle percorino and a soft cheese whose name I couldn't hear (again, the restaurant is very loud).  Both were fantastic.  This was by far the best part of our meal.

Next I had one of their specials -- halibut cheeks and mussels over polenta.  This was pretty delish.  The mussels seemed unnecessary, and I think something else would've been more interesting in their place.  But the halibut cheeks were perfect and the polenta was sooo yummy.

My boyfriend had their Saltimbocca di Pollo.  He wasn't very impressed ("a little bland"), but I thought it was nice, but I was happy I hadn't ordered it!

Oh, and we shared a bottle of white wine.  Their recommended wine of the day.  It was OK.  They have a nice wine list, though and their corkage is $18.

By the end of the meal, we considered dessert, but nothing really called to us.  And when you're not really craving dessert, trying a restaurant's tiramisu isn't so appealing.  How is it that tiramisu can taste so different at various restaurants?  You'd think it was a completely different dessert.  Anyway...

Overall, I imagine some dishes are fantastic while others are just good -- as demonstrated by our meal.  Given parking in that area, I'm not sure if we'll be back all that soon.
author: S J.

description:
A hidden gem. Every pasta dish is outstanding. My favorites: the polenta and risotto. Our waitress was incredibly kind and patient with us. If you are not in the neighborhood, take a taxi. Parking is impossible.

A second visit knocked a star off for inconsistency but still a good neighborhood find.
author: Gina L.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place forever, I finally got my chance and wasn't as impressed as expected. 

Don't get me wrong I would definitely try this spot once as the food is yummy and it does have that "cozy" lil Italian restaurant feel but for the price and plethora of really amazing Italian restaurants in the city it didn't stand up.
author: Summer C.

description:
A friend of mine used to live across the street and raved about this place--never had a chance to go cause of the parking situation. Well, finally went and was really looking forward to it.  It was not that impressive...
I had carpacio starter and then a veal scallopini entre.  The starter was ok, but the entre was tough and mediocore.  

The interior, to me, seemed very dated and a throw back to the seventies.  There are a lot better neighborhood restaurants in the area like Frescia.
author: Nancy H.

description:
This is a great, low-key neighborhood restaurant.  Just the type of place you want to go to after a long day when all you want is a bowl of pasta and a glass of wine.
We had the insalata caprese, fettuccine with milanese sauce, and gnocchi in a tomato gorgonzola sauce.  It was all very tasty.  The wine list is brief, but both wines we tried were good.  Generally solid.
author: Michelle A.

description: Delicious pastas and other Italian fare. It can be a little heavy, so this isn't the place if you're in the mood for a light meal, but I strongly recommend it.
author: Geoff R.

description:
I went with 3 other people tonight around 6pm and good god, it took 20 mins of circling around the block to just finally give up and pay for 7 dollar flat rate garage parking. If you are driving here... DON'T.
I found this place through yelp actually. I normally don't go out of my way for food, but it was for a celebration dinner so I thought somewhere special. 
I think the 2$ price range is misleading because if you add up appetizer course, drinks and dessert, the bill EASILY comes out to around 40 dollars per person. The main courses were around $20. I thought dessert was a little overpriced at $7.50. 
Besides all that, taste was really good. Everything tasted really fresh and the portions were just right. Not too much, not too little. I cannot remember all the dishes we had because I wasn't there when they ordered since I was driving around the block to find parking. 
The space is just like everyone said, cramped. All I have to say is, if you need to buy 2 plane tickets to fly... you will not like this set up.
author: Steven L.

description:
We thought the dinner was reasonably priced.  We went before the Franky Valli concert last week.  They have an eclectic wine list, the couple we tried (quivara zinfandel and the Italian chardonnay were both excellent and inexpensive.)  The appetizers were very good (brushcetta, winter squash (heavenly) and mozzarella.  The entrees were varied, most excellent, but the special veal was over sauced and over spiced (but I still liked it.)  The chicken was excellent, the shrimp was great, the pastas were all very tasty.  
The decor is interesting, but sparse.  The service was attentive.  It's a very nice little intimate restaurant, perfect for a second date.  The desserts were very tasty, especially the tiramisu..
author: mike r.

description:
Authentic Italian with some great updates. Started with mixed greens, prosciutto, and fig salad. Followed up with a fantastic butternut squash ravioli. Filled glasses with a Chianti Classico (de castillo).   

Space is limited but works well for two or three people. Service was good, but the food showed up a little slow for a relatively uncrowded Monday evening. Waiter was trying to pull off an Italian accent which was slightly annoying when he spoke so fast you couldn't hear the specials he was describing. "Scusarme. Lei potrebbe ripetere?"
author: Mike V.

description:
I've probably been to this restaurant 20 times and I can't get enough. I absolutely love this place.  It serves fantastic Italian food that is fresh, in season and delicious. Their specials are always delicious and the staff recommendations can always be trusted.

The restaurant is small and can be cramped and loud on busy nights, but I think that adds to its charm.  It has, what might be, the world's smallest bathroom.  But it is always clean and smells nice so I'm happy with it. 

The restaurant is owner operated and it shows.  The service is friendly and approachable without being overbearing, the prices are more than fair and the location is central.  There is parking right down the street at Walgreens or two blocks down at Pacific Garage @ Broadway.  Both are $10 a night. 

If you haven't been here, I suggest you try it. And if you're not bothered by late-night caffeine boosts, try the shaved espresso for dessert.  It's to-die for.
author: Justice Cat ..

description:
Great restaurant, a bit pricey, but you pay for the ambiance and attentiveness. It's also really tight. The guy at the table next to us was just this ignorant loud SOB who was talking sh*t about the gays. We could hear everything! I'm not gay but I love them and I really took offense to what he was saying. Anywayyyy sorry I'm ranting..

I found this one on Yelp, so the BF and I decided to have Sunday dinner here. We got the Antipasto Platter ($13) and the house white ($30) to start. 
The platter was soooo good, it came with fire roasted Red Bell Peppers, I adored it. It was sweet and pungent with all that garlic. Perfect with their bottomless bread basket. I prefer bread with butter, but they serve it with fruity olive oil, which I found to be a bit bland, so I asked for some Balsamic Vinegar to pump up flavor. I ended up eating MORE bread. Diet=FAIL.
Main Courses were: Pasta Puttanesca ($18) and Shrimp Risotto ($25). I loved both dishes, especially the pasta, because it was tangy and fresh, briny from the capers, just the way I like it.
We were so full we didn't even want dessert!
The staff was amazing! They were so attentive and their Italian accents just made the night!! Very romantic, and I hope the guy sitting next to us hated it because I never want to see him again!!
Note to everybody: I don't care how passionate you are about the convo, PLEASE keep your voice and words in check. A little respect goes a long way!!
author: Lydia R.

description:
This place is great.  It's definitely one of Nob Hill's best restaurants and is a fantastic place to bring a date.  It's the type of place where you take a bite and savor the food in your mouth as long as possible before shaking your head and saying "amazing".   The service is more than friendly and they provide a wonderful dinning experience.

I HIGHLY recommend the sauted mushrooms.  I had these served on the pork loin.  My date and I could not stop talking about them the entire night.

One thing to note... reservations are essential on a weekend evening.    I've tried both calling last minute for a table and walking in, and have been unable to get seating.
author: Brady L.

description:
I was very pleased with the Insalata di Radicchio (dressed in a phenomenal orange vinaigrette); the homemade pasta / organic vegetable entree; local and Italian wines; and divine red wine braised pair, tiramisu, and warm torte desserts.  Ristorante Milano is vegetarian friendly ...and just describing it makes me want to return.  

Savory authentic Roman-Italian food in a warm and homey environment.  Aldo is a wonderful host!
author: Elle T.

description:
Friday night I tried out Ristorante Milano based on Yelp reviews for the first time.  Overall I thought the place was good but my experience was in part undermined by the large party beside my table.

Food: very good.

Service: good; but funny story about that, mid-way through the meal, my appetizer plate was being cleared and I asked for another glass of wine from the busser.  Shortly thereafter, the waitress came up and asked if I would like another glass of wine.  The waitress and the busser looked very much alike, and for a while I was confused, thinking that the same person was asking me if I wanted a glass of wine twice.  Took me a while to figure out that it was two different people.  I am going to try to take the positive perspective on this and claim that my full attention was on my date for the evening and that is why I was distracted....

Noise level: extremely high!!!!!!!!!  We were seated next to a large party, perhaps 12 people.  The kind of people who like to yell from one end of the party to the other.... dear Lord.  Things got so bad that I asked my food to be wrapped up to go and skipped desert, my date and I just couldn't stand it.

I think I will try this place again and see if the noise level issue was just an aberration.
author: Chris W.

description: My BF and I just love this place. It is one of our few "go-to" restaurants for a nice quiet, romantic dinner.  The owner is adorable and always there to greet you at the door or at your table.  The food is superb and very authentic.  It really feels like you are sitting in an adorable cafe in Italy. I have had several entrees on this menu and all were great.  I would suggest the nightly specials when they have them becuase they are always dee-lish.
author: nicole s.

description:
While the SF tourists and many locals seek their pasta fix in North Beach, I chose Ristorante Milano, located just off the Hyde Street Cable Car line.  It's a nice intimate restaurant where you can sit back, relax, and enjoy your meal. Enjoy your pasta that is, "the way a whore would make it".   : )  

I ordered their Fettuccine alla puttanesca. Apparently, pasta alla puttansca originated in Naples and was named after local prostitutes, meaning "Pasta the way a whore would make it".  It is supposed to be quick and easy.  The sauce that is. To make. The puttanesca sauce  is a lite tomato-based sauce, and in my opinion, lacks the spice that is befitting it's name.

Now that my mind is out of the gutter, let's talk about rest of the dish, which included their homemade Fettuccine with capers, olives, anchovies, and fresh tomatoes.  The pasta was fresh and perfectly prepared.  The blend of the other ingredients added a nice taste and texture to the dish, which made up for the sauce's lack of flavor.

Overall, enjoyable, but not fantastic.  Three and a half stars.
author: Gregory C.

description:
I come from a long line of food mavens. Drop my mother in a random place and she can find the best restaurant within 30 miles within the hour, whether it be a 5 star establishment, or a hole-in-the-wall taqueria. 
We first ate at Ristorante Milano within the first month it opened upon my mother's sixth food sense recommendation. It was heavenly and I've never found a place I liked better. It is smallish, but has great, lively, a touch romantic atmosphere. 
The food is fantastic, and most of my friends whom I have dragged with me have found themselves duly converted. You cannot miss what I consider to be the best Italian food in the city hands down.

Kat's Best Italian 2007
author: Kat C.

description: So delicious! I had the seafood pasta (home made pasta) and my boyfriend got the lamb, chicken, and sausage dish. We really enjoyed our Friday date night!
author: Jenny K.

description:
I needed some Italian food stat.   I have always talked about trying this place as it is so close to my house but I always thought it looked overpriced and let's be honest the 80s sign does not help.  So Finally we gave in and went. 

It was delicious my chicken saltimbocca was perfect, the waiter was super nice.  They even gave me a free half glass of wine, love it.  The antipasto was super fresh and the zucchini frittata in it was awesome. My bf got so creamy sausage pasta which was also really good.  I would def go back, can't believe it took me three years to try this place.
author: Katie M.

description: Neighborhood gem. I love their menu and everything on it. The wait staff are friendly and knowledgeable.
author: L. L.

description: I went with a small group of friends.... Marco was a waiter... He was extremely friendly, charming and cute (always a plus). As he told us the specials in his italian accent, I felt like I was at a restaurant in Italy.... On top of that, his service was perfect... attentive but not overbearing. He recommended the watermelon salad (not sure what the appropriate name is), frutti de mare linguni, grilled calamari, ravioli, and tiramisu... Yum yum, yum.... The other woman servers were busy yet they still made it a point to come chat with us, get to know us a bit, and make us feel at home... I thought that was awesome....  If you want a 5 star dinner in an intimate setting with genuine servers/hosts, look no further than Milano...
author: Aundrea j.

description: Small but charming place with excellent family run atmosphere.  Great specials good prices, make a reservation.
author: Alan R.

description: Imagine enjoying a dish from the look, the aroma, & the "feel" even before u take ur first bite...get the tonnarelli alla cappriciosa (i think there's browned butter & truffle, but a follow up trip is in order to confirm) and "experience" a magnificent gastronomic experience! WOW!
author: Jameson C.

description: We had Leilani's Bday dinner here last night and it was amazing!  The service was 5 star with them giving us a bigger table and setting up a surprise dessert over the phone!  Our waiter was great to do all that for us!  The food was amazing and it's true their gnocchi is world class.  Perfect little tucked away romantic italian restaurant in SF.  I love that our city has places like this!
author: Sean M.

description: Used yelp to find this restaurant, ugh .veal chop tasted like it was just placed on grill with no seasoning. My brother had special ravioli and tasted like ravioli,nothing grand. My husband had some trio of meat with balsamic reduction....he is easy to please and wasn't impressed. I ordered the ,mushroom and Gorgonzola cheese crostini.....canned mushrooms!!!!! Wtf! What a waste. And they served on side of entrees beets! Who the hell eats beets? Upsetting ! Staff nice and prompt, no corkage fee, that was about it,
author: Eric C.

description:
this place made me happy! 

its a kind of small place with good honest food, good service, and a great atmosphere.

As someone who eats totally dairy free it is always so exciting to go to an italian place where i can find foods not covered in butter and cheese and still have amazing tasting food, so bonus points for that.

oh and for all my fellow lactards out there:  they even have a poached pear dessert with no dairy in it. eat it.
author: Dico B.

description: Service was great - extra friendly staff who are apparently trained to 'read' people haha!  Lasagna = YUM!
author: Emi N.

description: Pasta was ok.  However, there was scant evidence of porcini mushroom or sausage  in my dish.  I think for $16.95 they could have put in a little more ingredients.  IMHO
author: Jim J.

description: Service was friendly, we dined pretty late (9:30) the wine selection and entrees (beet/ricotta ravioli with rosemary and poppy seeds, Alfredo with sweet Italian crumbled sausage) were very good. The appetizer salad could have been passed over--ours were on the limp, borderline soggy side, but they may have been scraping the bottom of the barrel given the time of day. The environment was a little toney for the casual dining we were doing, but I bet it would be a great date restaurant. Be prepared to search for parking. Overall, definitely worth it!
author: Aurora H.

description: A wonderful little Italian place with excellent food and service!
author: Theresa D.

description: Great out of the way place when you visit san Francisco.  Small and romantic, but also somewhat casual.  Definitely not a tourist trap.   Meals are reasonable, and wine list is good.  Knowledgable waiter picked a great local wine which went perfectly with our meal.   I'd recommend this place to anyone.
author: Rick K.

description:
Yelpers recommended me to check out this cozy neighborhood restaurant and I thank them for it. This place had nice, cozy ambiance for my bf and I, we wanted italian and we got great food, a nice table next to the storefront window, and a comfy neighborhood spot atmosphere. The gnocchi was tasty in its pink sauce, my bf really enjoyed his pasta dish. The tiramisu was drool worthy. 
The place was a little off the beaten path so I'd make sure to ask the waiter to call you a taxi.
author: cindy w.

description:
I will return! I found this place on opentable and yelp and was excited to try it. We went here before seeing a concert at Yoshi's. Parking is hard, but what else do you expect in SF on a weekend? 
The food was great!!!! The prosecco was fantastic. Both entrees were great and the salads were tasty too. 
This is an intimate restaurant, the tables are close together, but its actually a "romantic" restaurant. 
Its one of the more "aurthentic" restaurants I have been to lately!
author: C H.

description:
Who knew this place even existed? It's tucked away off Hyde but delivers a superior Italian experience. Our group splurged on a bunch of appetizers pre-dinner - bruschetta, beet salad with oranges, grilled veggies - all simply and classically done. 

The mains brought the house down. I had the saltimbocca pollo, an absolutely sumptuous serving of chicken blanketed in prosciutto and mozzarella, busting with sagey goodness. My boyfriend was babbling in ecstacy at his tonnarelli alla Capricciosa, a flavorful pasta with sausage and porcini mushrooms. Our buddies raved about their lasagne, lamp and squash ravioli dishes. We splurged on a couple of bottles of wine, a crisp sauv blanc and a tasty Barbaresco. After all that, dessert wasn't needed, but we couldn't help ourselves and split the pan di Mandorle, a semolina-almond concoction topped with strawberries and just the right, slightly-but-not-too-sweet end to a delicious dinner. The service was strong and we'll be back.
author: Leela S.

description:
Salad was great and so was that mushroom crostini...

But I would have swapped the gnocchi for the risotta instead, I wasn't all that impressed. 

But really cute, quaint and REALLY nice service.
author: Bhumika K.

description: Loved the location, service, and atmosphere.  Halibut was a little too wet for our taste, ravioli was delicioso!  Price is fair for atmosphere and food, I think.  I'd go back.
author: Stewart E.

description: As Nish said, "a truly hidden gem" in the city! Wonderful and superb Italian food! Very cosy setting and out-of-this-world Italian fare! Love, love love the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa - Housemade pasta in light cream sauce with porcini mushrooms and Italian sausage and lasagna!!!!!
author: Yan M.

description:
Count me in as one of those people who almost doesn't want to review this restaurant for fear people will want to start coming to it.

The food is just wonderful. So often, Italian restaurants rely on quantity over quality, and serve overflowing bowls of starchy heavy crap. Ristorante Milano instead serves rationally sized plates of fresh, delicate food. Their gnocchi is exactly as good as everyone else has said it is, and their other pasta dishes are just as luscious.

I also really like the fact that if you ask the waiter for a wine recommendation, they don't try and be snooty about it. A friend of mine prefers sweeter wines, and they were happy to suggest a demisec wine that would go nicely with the meal. They are happy to suggest a red wine for the fish if that is your preference.

I've been with friends, and based on my experiences, it was my first choice for a place to take my parents when they were visiting.  They loved it. Although the tables are small, and the layout is kind of cramped, it's a wonderful place to talk and have a really charming night out.
author: Natalia M.

description:
This place is very good.  It's solid Italian and consistently enjoyable.  I love the grilled veggies and the gorgonzola gnocci.  
The service is good and they're friendly, although last time we went there was quite a wait. 
But, given the prices and the quality, I would (and will) keep going back.
author: Jessica L.

description:
This is place is tiny.  Wait, did I mention this place is small?  Now this is not a bad thing, as I think a smaller-sized restaurant makes it more romantic and cozy.  But, when they try to cram too many people into this small space, I end up with a full glass of ice water in my lap.  Mind your large purses and your big behinds as you try to squeeze between the tables.  I wouldn't recommend this place for large parties, unless you are really good friends and don't mind sharing your personal space.

Other than that, the food was great and the wine was delicious!
author: San D.

description: Delicious! We came here on a whim the other night and it was delicious! We had the homemade gnochhi with gorgonzola and tomatoes, the fruit de mare pasta with homemade pasta, a beet salad and grilled calamari. Service was good, bread was good, wine was good, I recommened!!!
author: Jenny I.

description:
This is my new favorite Italian Restaurant in the city and it's obviously not in North Beach.  I live somewhat close and have always seen a crowd outside so when I read the Yelp reviews I knew I must try it.

The service was great.  From the hostess, to the waiter, to the busser.  Everyone was friendly, smiling and ready to help us.  

It's funny because the waiter asks if you want  an appetizer or dessert.  Let me tell you that both are unnecessary.  They start with bringing this bread that is out of this world.  It's some type of Focaccia and it was fresh and all around delicious.  I ordered one of the specials which was ravioli with butternut squash inside.  IT was sooooo amazing.  Both of my friends loved it as well.  They also coat it in fresh ground pepper and Parmesan.  My friends dishes I personally didn't enjoy as much.  My one friend go the risotto.  It was full of fresh veggies.  It was good but I would say go for something else.  

Also, we ordered a bottle of Syrah that was delicious and only $28!!  We didn't get any dessert and they brought us our a homemade cookie for each of us.  That was also yummy.  We all paid only 30 bucks from so amazing bread, a few glasses of wine each, a great entree and a cookie.  You shouldn't miss this place is you love Italian Food!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Nice place for italian. Gnocchi is really good. Homemade pasta is good. Prices are reasonable.

Service is good, waiters are pleasant

Note I did not give higher review because I am not the hugest fan of italian, so I can't say if it was superior to other good italian places.

3.5 stars
author: Eddy N.

description: I love this little neighborhood gem! The staff is lovely. Food is fantastic and authentic. I love the burrata starter and have never had a bad pasta dish. It is such a cozy place with nice little nooks.
author: Maureen M.

description:
I have some mixed feelings about this place.  We had dinner a couple of months ago on Saturday night.  Since parking was a lot of pain (actually almost impossible), we just kept driving looking for a spot and were late for our reservation like 20 minutes or so.  We eventually parked at a valet that someone in the restaurant told us when we called to let them know we were running late.  When we got there, we were left alone at the entrance for a while.  We waited like 5-7 minutes until someone came.  They told us they didn't have a table for us because we were late although we saw 4-5 empty tables, which were not filled for an hour or so. They eventually gave us one of the empty tables after a little unpleasant conversation, and we had to start our first dinner there with some bad feelings... 

Since the food was good, we could try again.  Hopefully I can update my review to give them more stars...
author: M Y.

description: Nice restaurant, seems to be run by an Italian family (or at least it gives that feeling). The food was very good, although a bit low on taste. Not very romantic because it's cramped full of tables, but perfect for a night out with friends or family
author: Rolf M.

description:
The best risotto in town! Great service and wonderful food. Truly a worthwhile dining experience for a delicious Italian meal.  Also try the tonno carpacio (italian "sushi")... it is awesome! The pasta is made there, fresh, everyday. And the zabaglione (sp?) for dessert is over the top - marsala wine whipped into egg yolks over strawberries.... yum!  It is our favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. Everyone we have taken there has been impressed.

BY THE WAY, they also have a private dining area where parties of 8-10 can enjoy a view of Pacific Street.
author: Victoria Z.

description:
My parents were visiting, their first time in San Francisco, and I took them here. We had a great time, everything went perfect. The food was wonderful the service was good, everything went well. 

I would only advise to have good knowledge of wines and Italian food. The menu was clearly for advanced diners and it was a little confusing because none of us knew much about Italian dinning but our server was helpful and made good recommendations.
author: Joshua G.

description:
Great, great food.  I can't remember what it is called, but get the appetizer that gives you an assortment of items.  The gnocchi with a combination of the two sauces was excellent.  The staff is attentive and helpful in pairing wine with your entree.  The last time I was there I went with the tiramisu for dessert.  They gave me a giant square of it and I think I told our waittress I wanted to make out with her. I don't really remember because I blacked out about half-way through dessert out of sheer taste bud ecstasy.

Ristorante Milano is awesome.  What a great neighborhood find.
author: Adam B.

description:
So Damn Good!
The family I think is from Italy and the old man reads off the list of what seems to be like 1,000 specials and you want to eat each one.  I had a think spaghetti with pancetta tomatoes and pecerino cheese. It was to die for
author: Rod S.

description:
This place was busy at 8:30pm on a Sunday night - always a good sign. The sweet staff helped out half hour wait go by bringing us wine and cups of tea, depending on our preference. 

Our waiter, Jon Carlos was so charming and affable! He was unfazed by my friend's crazy come ons. The sparsely decorated restaurant was still warm, inviting and cozy. The tables have each had a single, perfect pink rose in a vase. What wasn't sparsely decorated were our table tops! Plates, glasses, teapots, silverware and napkins covered every inch our our table top, and that was just for the appetizers! The bread and oil olive were delish, and the caprese salad looked fantastic to boot. The gnocchi I ordered was pillowy light and scrumptious with a delicious creamy tomato sauce. 

Minus one star for the insane cramping, and for being a scootch over priced. I would probably come back for a big date, but I can't make this one a habit!
author: Kelly C.

description:
The first time I came here, I had a blast and loved the food...granted , I was a little tipsy at the time so I think that skewed my impression in a positive way for the restaurant.

After several return visits I was never impressed with the dishes especially considering the associated price tag.  They do have a couple good dishes like the mixed seafood pasta but nothing that knocks your socks off.

Not a bad choice overall, but there are definitely better options.

Although if you want to check out the smallest bathroom in the city...this is the place to go!
author: Kristy S.

description: Their carbonara was to die for! It was the perfect balance of creamy and salty. I seriously dream about it. I also loved their tiramisu. It is huge and so good. The waitress was very knowledgeable about Italian flavors and flavor combinations. I can't wait to take my mom to dinner there next time she is in town.
author: Jamie E.

description:
We were a bit disappointed with this restaurant. We went in with great expectations. I chose this restaurant because Yelp gave it four stars and only two dollar signs ($$). It was definitely more expensive than I expected. We had the bruschetta, which was very good (but over-priced). Our entrees: I ordered the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa because it was a very popular item and I thought I couldn't go wrong, but it was not good. The first couple of bites were good, but it was too rich and I soon tired of it. My husband ordered the Fruti de Mare, expecting the usual mix of seafood, shrimp, crab, scallop, mussels, etc. It only came with clams. The clams dish (Fruti de Mare) was okay, but we were still disappointed because we expected another type of dish. We even asked the owner: "Is this the way the Fruti de Mare usually comes?" He said, "sometimes it has only clams, sometimes it has clams and mussels." I've been ordering Fruti de Mare for a long time and it has never come with just clams. I feel that the waitress could have told us "it only comes with clams." So we would've known what to expect. 
We will definitely never be back here. The only thing we enjoyed was the bruscetta appetizers, but as I said, it was quite expensive $12.
The service was pretty good though.
author: Jade C.

description: Had a GREAT dinner here last night. Absolutely loved the carpaccio di tonno. Tried the featured wine (forgot the name), but it was disappointing. I had the ono with pesto for the main course and the pera cota for desert. They were outstanding. The pear sorbet with the poached pear was inspired. We arrived early for our reservation and that was good. We were seated right away, but by the time we left, there were several groups crammed in the tiny entryway waiting for tables.
author: Dan D.

description:
It's always a Christmas eve tradition to spend it with Lorenzo at Allegro Romano in Russian Hill (see review).  However, this year due to unforeseen circumstances we had to call an audible.

Luckily, we were able to get a table at Ristorante Milano.  The service was solid and the food was amazing.  The fare tends to skew towards thick cream sauces (trust me I could only eat here a couple of times a yr...not b/c of the food which is so damn good, but b/c I would gain 30 lbs).  The sauces and pasta (homemade) are very rich.

Decent wine selection to boot. 
The verdict is that I will be back at Allegro next yr on the eve.  But Milano takes the silver and rose to the occasion.
author: Solbiato S.

description: I love this place. When I went the food was awesome. The reason I love this place is because I sent my parent's there for their anniversary and paid for it (without me going with them). I had to change the reservation the day of to add another couple to the reservation. They weren't open yet, so i left a voice message. Aldo called me back to inform me he got my message and would call me again to confirm the change in reservation when he did get to work. Service like this is definitely need around the City for sure
author: Josh M.

description:
Great little spot for a home-style Italian experience. 
Fresh pastas, nice anti-pasti, and a pleasant (though packed) atmosphere- all make for a very nice time.
Reservations are often a necessity, and the service can sometimes creep at a snail's pace, but they're popular for a reason!
author: Justin M.

description:
This place is awesome - very romantic/ambient,  authentic food.... So far, my favorite Italian restaurant in the city (and I believe Zagat ranks it #3).  Great homemade pasta and desserts.

Don't drive. :)
author: Heather H.

description:
Milano's menu utilizes fresh, seasonal and local ingredients, always an encouraging note to begin a meal on, no?

The Carpaccio di Tonno was a salad of peppery baby arugula topped with a rose of luscious scarlet colored slices of raw Hawaiian big eye tuna, dressed with a vibrant Meyer lemon vinaigrette that made your lips pucker.

The Monterey Bay calamari, grilled and kissed with just the right amount of mineral to mimic a fresh burst of ocean salt water, was served over a cannelini bean salad that included plump, perfectly simmered beans. The dish was finished with a hearty drizzle of fine emerald colored olive oil which I happily sopped up using my last bits of herbed foccacia bread.

My mother's simple house made ravioli relied on a filling of creamy ricotta cheese, a light tomato sauce and a subtle accent of fresh herbs to shine through the dish's simplicity. The Insalata Misto's salad greens were reminiscent of  Rapunzel's fated obsession with her neighbor's lettuces...I wouldn't be surprised if they were picked just hours before...

This sweet, small neighborhood establishment tucked away on Nob Hill is well worth the wait, as well as the fight to park...lucky for me, I can just stroll over there. 

* tip- wear something cool...it can really heat up in there! -EFK
author: Eliza K.

description: Very good service, good food, great dessert and very reasonably priced for this area.  Tiny, only about 450 sq.ft and a small number of tables so would recommend reservations.
author: Alice M M.

description: Homemade food with warm service.  No pretense.  Aldo and the others make you feel like you're part of the family.
author: Karthi X.

description: I have been here about four times, and I've been consistently impressed.  It's very comfy and cozy inside, whether it's a crowded Saturday night or early on a less busy weeknight.  The gnocchi comes in lots of varieties and is quite good.  I grew up eating my Sicilian great great uncle's gnocchi so it's high praise for me to write that a restaurant serves "good" gnocchi.  Anyway, it's one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the City.  The only semi-complaint that I have is that when I once took my underage cousin for dinner during her busy finals period, the server was pretty intense about politely suggesting - via her recommendations and incredulity that we didn't want more - that we order an appetizer or drinks or dessert.  It wasn't totally out of line, but it was a little cloying and surprising (and brings them down a star).
author: Steven W.

description: Nice ambiance, good service, noise level acceptable and the food was very solid- gnocchi was pillow light and sauce was perfect- my date really liked his chicken and greens- our 2007 Emeritas Pinot from Russian River Valley fell flat, but the food was wonderful. The Tiramasu was taken home and was still pillow light and just yummy. We had the best seat in the house, top level left hand side back corner table, with a view across the place- one star deducted because we waited 45 minutes after our reservation -- which was frustrating at the time, but in retrospect well worth it. Reservations are a must at this neighborhood gem, and it took 15 minutes to find a parking spot.
author: Adrienne W.

description:
Best Italian in SF.  It has been waaaay too long since I've been here.  So long, I don't remember what I've ordered.  I do know that every time I leave, I think, "Wow, that was great, we need to eat here more often".  

So just go here, order some food, eat it, and be happy.
author: Val U.

description:
This place is radical...

If you're looking for a neighborhood Italian spot it's perfect... Super friendly  staff, great food, and a great local vibe.

It's definitely not a dive spot or anything...it's nice, but it's not pretentious... it's warm and friendly...white table cloth, great bread, olive oil and balsamic, etc...

Plus, for dinner for two, you can get out of there for under $100 with appetizers, entres, and a bottle of wine.

They make their own fresh pasta... and I had some dish, I can't remember the name, but it's a cream sauce with italian sausage and tomates...AWESOMETOWN
author: Ethan E.

description:
An unexpectedly cute find in Russian Hill.  Excellent mozzarella di bufala, gnocchi, and tiramisu --rustic, refined food without any trendy pretentiousness.  The wait can be long even if you have a reservation though.  They don't rush diners out to make room for waiting ones, even long after the meal is done...which is nice when you're seated, but annoying when you're not.  

I like this place much better than Ristorante Bacco or Trattoria Contadina.
author: chewy c.

description:
Would have given it one star, but the service was excellent. The food, however, was GOD AWFUL.  I dont know if people who rate this with four and five stars just don't know what good Italian food is or what, but if you like good food, LOOK ELSEWHERE.
If you like overcooked, under seasoned entrees, TONS OF  GREASE to compensate for poor quality and no taste  and limited options, this is your place.  yuck, yuck, yuck
author: Yael I.

description:
Went on a Friday night for a romantic dinner and was very impressed.  The special seafood stew over soft polenta was the best polenta I've ever had.  We brought a bottle of wine which I'd recommend.  The service was a little overeager but that's nothing to complain about.  My date ordered the gnocchi and we split a chocolate and almond dessert that I'm sure I ate more than half of!

Overall great.  I'll definitely be back.
author: ellen v.

description: A solid Italian place in the 'hood. I tried the gnocchi since it gets rave reviews on Yelp, and it was delicious. The tables are a bit close together so it can feel a bit cramped, but tolerable. Good service - attentive but not overbearing. Overall, an enjoyable experience and worth checking out!
author: Priya N.

description: Cozy, friendly, yummy...and reasonably priced.  What's not to like?
author: Dee M.

description:
I live right by this restaurant and it is phenomenal.  Instantly fell in love with the atmosphere and pasta dishes.  

Lucky to have struck up a friendship with one of the waitresses.  I cannot tell you how much nicer this makes your experience at your neighborhood restaurant.

The ravioli specials consistently rock my world.  I cannot say a bad word about this place, they deserve all the business they get.

May want to look into reservations during weekends, weekdays usually not needed.
author: Cole W.

description:
This is the Uva's of San Francisco minus the live music.  If you don't know Uva in downtown Napa you simply must make an effort.  
Restorante Milano is filled to the brim of friendly and efficient servers and back waiters.  The food is mouthwatering and the kind of cuisine that makes you have a hankering for it a few days after you've finished your meal.  The wine list is super cool - buy the whole bottle and get the fourth glass free!  The sign reminds me of robocop, but you can't find anything else poor to say.  The joint is so small it helps to make a reservation.  
Hot date tip: act like a goof and ride the cable car from the warf up to it.  the touristos aren't the only ones to should ride those rattle traps, and you'll find yourselves giggling at the timelessness of the moment.  you already have a muni pass anyway so its free.
author: Dan A.

description: I LOVE this place.  It is consistently amazing and the service is outstanding!  The price point is good as well.  Always a hit!
author: Carrie C.

description: This place was excellent.  I am very picky when it comes to lasagna, but it was served very well here.  Everything was extremely fresh and tasted great.  No reason for not giving 5 stars, other than Italian food is my favorite.  I've only been here once, but will definitely return.  It was fun to hit up some of the dive bars nearby and then enjoy a nice dinner.
author: Gregg K.

description: Italian is my favorite food and this is by far the best and most consistent Italian in the city.  The food and wine are expensive but I've never had one dish there that I wouldn't call outstanding.  Their special dishes are very fresh and a true reflection of what is in season and local. It's great for vegetarians or meat-eaters alike.  Great place for a date. The whole place feels very quality and authentic like you are truly dining in Europe. The owner and his wait staff are great and attentive also.  If you come in frequently, you start to feel like family...
author: Sasha B.

description: Owner is a jerk.  I have never written a review but felt the need to after my most recent dinner.  I live in the neighborhood and have frequented this restaurant; the food is delicious and the waitresses are the best in the city.  Tonight, however, the owner just rubbed me the wrong way.  We showed up at 6:15 for dinner.  Ordered the appetizer and two entrees and two bottles of wine and were there until 8:15.  To say the owner was trying to rush us out is putting it mildly.  He kept bothering us and checking out the status of our plates and wine glasses.  I can appreciate that he wants tables to turn over but dear Mr. Owner, I have supported your restaurant when there was no one in it, so a word of advice....know your patrons and if someone stays a little longer than you expected, back up and give them room. Your waitresses understand this; you should too.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: I make a reservation here for a Saturday night and went with my sister and her boyfriend who were visiting from out of town. Boy was it a hit, all of our picks were delicious! We started with the calamari and caprese salad, sooo good! We loved that the calamari wasn't fried so it didn't feel heavy. The tomatoes in the salad were very sweet and perfectly dressed. We each ordered different entrees and they were amazing! Everything tasted fresh and homemade. My only complaint would be that our waitress was a tad slow; we were looking for her when trying to place the order and pay for the bill (I noticed others in our area were doing the same). Other than that, it was a great dining experience!
author: Serena S.

description: Home made pasta was great. Sausage/mushroom pasta was tasty and not over flavored like many places. Everything was fresh and would have liked to have dessert (other tables looked great), however too full. Wednesday used 50% off bottle of wine from yelp....always helps!! Waiter was attentive and would recommend for a great Italian meal.
author: Steve b.

description: For just an evening, I actually  felt like I was back in Italy.  The pasta was the freshest I've ever had in a restaurant, and the owners were about the nicest Italians I have managed to meet in America.  This brought me right back to visits at our family friends' house in Sicily, with fresh home-made pasta and the nicest Italian mom ever serving you food at every possible moment. There was one key difference. There was a hefty bill at end of this dinner, and my meal in Sicily was free. Oh well:)
author: B K.

description:
I ate here last night  with L.C. and I thought it was amazing. Great food, Great desert, and great service. 

All was amazing until 3 large LOUD women came in and sat behind us. Good thing we were about to leave. But that's not something I hold against Milano.
author: Johny D.

description: A great hole in the wall Italian restaurant.  I had the salmon special and it was wonderful!  Made with quite a bit of butter and served with simply yet exquisitely prepared zucchini, eggplant and potatoes.  I'll definitely be going back for more.
author: David B.

description:
A great place to take out of town guests for a neighborhood dining experience. Although the space is small, it adds to the cozy yet bustling ambiance. Also, the service staff works constructively with the smaller space to make the experience fun and memorable. Our host and waiter was not only very attractive but also incredibly charming and very conscientious of how we were enjoying the meal. 

The wine list is excellent - good selection of Italian and Californian wines. Everyone at the table greatly enjoyed their meal - I got the minestrone, which was well seasoned and delicious.

Also, the poached pear dessert was tasty but not too heavy. 

I am definitely going back here!
author: Ingrid L.

description: delicious homemade pastas, great wine selection, friendly service!
author: Kelsey K.

description: Went here for dinner last night with some of my favorite peeps and I must say we had a great time. The service was really good (I love it when the waiters are actually Italian!!!) and the food was quite tasty. They had a substantial wine list and pretty good options on their menu. The portions were just right, not too big, not too small, which is awesome because there's room for desert. We ordered the creme puffs covered in chocolate, which was their special and the tiramisu which was out of this world. It tasted so fresh and fluffy, it just melted in your mouth. I advise you to make reservations or you'll most likely be waiting for over an hour, like the couple last night. It's a pretty small restaurant but very cozy and charming. I would definitely go back!
author: Niki F.

description: Excellent, excellent experience.  Small, intimate neighborhood restaurant.  Party of two max. for best experience.  Pesto is outstanding.  Good wine list fairly priced.  Recommended by the staff at the Hilton Fisherman's Wharf.  Locals favorite.
author: Forrest W.

description:
What a great place for dinner! We had a table for 5 in the front corner by the windows. It was very cozy and felt sufficiently private. The hostess was very friendly as were both servers that waited on our table. Our primary server was very friendly, knowledgeable, and provided great descriptions and recommendations. 

We started w/ the anti-pasta misto which was a sizable portion of really tasty appetizers. It had mushroom, eggplant, red peppers, and a great carrot zucchini fritatta. I definitely recommend this app for a small group. 

For an entree, I had the Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa is really fantastic! The wine list was also very good. 

Great meal, nice place for a small group. Only con would be that the smaller 2 and 4 top tables looked very close together so not a lot of privacy. But the food and service were both outstanding so we'll go back for a dinner for 2 and check it out!
author: Scott C.

description: Tucked away on a residential block, Ristorante Milano is easy to miss but definitely worth seeking out.  The homemade ravioli (pumpkin in a butter/sage sauce) were fantastic-crispy, melt in your mouth goodness.  The restaurant itself was HOT and service, albeit friendly, was a bit scattered.  Those are a few minor details that keep Milano from a five star rating but if you are in the 'hood and are looking for a new spot (it seemed like a lot of the patrons were regulars) for some tasty Italian, give Milano a shot.
author: phil h.

description: Overpriced for what you get. Mediocre wine list. Ok service but the food tastes good.
author: Andrew D.

description: Our Italian friends took us to their favorite spot - Restaurant Milano, last night. It is a cozy, warm (I recommend dressing light as it can get warm and I had a bit too much on w/long sleeves) spot with excellent wine and food. We had the Scottata Milano (thin slices beef w/marinated onions and arugala) to start w/a sparkling white. The, moved onto the puttanesca (tangy awesome fresh sauce) followed by an amazing sardine plate and then ono. Desert was a poached pear with pear sorbet. The owner is very proud of his place and treats everyone with warmth. I never would have stumbled upon this place w/out the recommendation of our friends. I will plan to take friends here when a real authentic Italian experience is in order. There is a front room that seats up to 8 that has a very large window looking out to the street that would be a fantastic spot for a small dinner celebration/gathering.
author: Amy E.

description: Sooo good that I left kicking and screaming. Okay, the baby was kicking and screaming, which is why I left before desert. Okay, okay, so I was able to have a bite of the dessert before actually leaving.  The point is that I never wanted to leave and move into there front room for big parties and stuff myself on homemade raviolis and walk around with a long fork with which to taste everyone else's delicious dinners, too. yuuuuuuuuuummmmmmmmmmmmmm
author: Razel F.

description: This is the third time I've had a sub-par meal at Milano.  I used to love this place so much!  But it's like with that guy I'm dating: the sex was great at first, but now he just flops down on the bed spread eagle and mumbles "blow job." So this time I got the risotto (we're back to the restaurant review here) and really, it was NOT risotto.  It was regular white rice, I swear to god, with some runny cream sauce and a few baby shrimp.  Not even big mama prawns to make up for the "risotto." My 'friend' got the veal and found it so overly draped in sauce that it was hard to find, much less taste, the veal.  Where was that draping of cheesy creaminess in my dish???  Isn't cheesy creaminess what risotto's all about? I'm bummed.
author: Laura W.

description: This is best Italian food in the city!  I really don't know why I am writing this review because it is so great that I don't want anyone to know about it.  I've only had a few dishes, but they were all great and the staff was very helpful!
author: Jennifer P.

description: A hidden gem.  I used to live near this place and always loved going there.  Perfect restaurant to take a date or bring your parents to.  The food is not as good as the italian food in Italy, of course, but it's one of the closest to it that San Francisco has to offer.   Parking is near impossible but you can always valet or take the cable car lazy ass.  And afterwards you can go to the polk bars or to Swensens.
author: Tim X.

description: Hands down the best Gnocchi Pomodoro in the city.  This little gem of restaurant has consistently great food, their specials are always tempting and delicious (especially the grilled sardines), and the waitstaff is friendly and fun.  It's our favorite neighborhood spot.
author: Kristen N.

description: Please don't go to this wonderful, tucked-away Italian restaurant in Polk Gulch, it's truly a hidden gem, and is one of those places where you daydream about your meal the next day.
author: Nish N.

description: Good food. But tiny portions. Pricey. Romantic setting. Too bad I went with my homey instead of the GF. It's all good. Waitress was hot. Holla.
author: Jay W.

description: One of the best Italian restaurants Around, Great food, Interesting restaurant composition, Scary bathroom , but cool!  a 5/5 I got the Carpaccio , Awesome, Also got the pesto dishes, phenominal! Also our waiter was probably one of the best looking guys ive seen in a forever, Just because of the waiter id give Milano a 4/5 Just based on him , but hey thats just me! Hes soooo Dreammyyyyy!
author: Jimmy K.

description: Splendid northern Italian food in a small, romantic space with a charming staff. Not too expensive either. Try the pastas, and the skewered chicken livers, and don't forget the good selection of Italian wines.
author: Hao L.

description: A very intimate and declicious little place! We walked in around 8:30 on a Sunday night and were received warmly. The staff was very friendly, and the butternut squash ravioli was to DIE for!
author: Sarah W.

description: It is very simple: stay away from this place. Why? I am Italian, a real Italian, born and raised in Italy. I love to cook and I love real authentic Italian food. The food at Ristorante Milano is fake Italian food and simply disgusting. I went back in April with my girlfriend and it was a horrible experience. She ordered gnocchi that were dressed with a creamy sauce made with gorgonzola (sort of blue cheese) and tomato sauce. First, this is not an Italian recipe and second that combination of ingredients was revolting. I ordered risotto ai frutti di mare (risotto with shellfish). They basically boiled the rice on a side and prepared a cheaply made sauce with tomatoes, shellfish and tiny shrimps, and put it on the boiled rice! That is not the way to make risotto! It is highway robbery at $18.50!!! Avoid the place at all costs!!!
author: Alberto B.

description:
so a good noona of mines was leaving the bay for la. classic euge style, dinner and drinks. this is a place that was on my to do list for awhile so why the hell not. the place is a LOT smaller than i expected and though the cozy feelings cool, if you have a loud party next to you, as we did, it can get pretty fucking annoying. (this coming from a drunk ass obnoxious mofo like me) that small peeve aside, the place rocks. i must go a few times more to try everything i wanted to try. i guess thats one of the downfalls of going to dinner with someone you want to talk to, you eat less. ehhh small  sacrifice for a hot date. ^.~

and damn it, can you have a better looking wait staff? the host was a hottie and our waiter, damn im straight but shit i couldnt disagree when my dinner companion was all HOLY SMACK MY TITTIES THAT GUYS GOOD LOOKING. (well not her exact words but its the way i heard it)

oh and food wise, i had the veggie ravioli, and those that know me, veggie isnt something i do. still, my veggie ravioli rocked. pretty damn freaking good.
author: Euge L.

description: Ristorante Milano we were happy with the food, but the red italian wine recommended by the waitress was not what we expected and the noise level high. Therefore, we were a bit disappointed since we read great reviews about this neighborhood restaurant. Entrees were a bit pricey and not that impressive...
author: Gigi W.

description: I took my bf here for his birthday which happens to be on the last day of the year.  Although we were 1 hour and 30 minutes late, they still had our reservation on hold.  The owner totally knew it was us because we called various times.  I didn't like that there wasn't convenient places to park.  Although, we parked 1 block down which valet was  $10 (not bad, better than parking in the parking lot for $15).  I thought it was a cute place but seemed very misleading due to the pictures.  I mainly took my lover here for pizza, but the lasagna and the tiramisu made up for it.  I had this other dish which was the linguine with small clams, (it was okay.)  This place was family owned as well as the waiter was very sweet.  She sang to my bf and we tried really hard to surprise him.. (Of course you had to hear the lighter flickering, babe.) Other than that, I enjoyed this place a lot.
author: Janeth B.

description:
had a reservation

waited about 20 mins.

got a table up near the bathroom

gnocchi was nothing special, and the service was the worst than I've ever gotten!

why does yelp love this place so much? why? there is bad parking, and  the gnocchi at whole foods tastes way better; that pretty much says how non memorable their food was
author: Nina M.

description:
What a great, low-key, delicious neighborhood Italian restaurant!  Not pretentious at all - although they have every reason to be, with food this good.  Food is just simple Italian with excellent pasta, sauces, and an impressive wine list.  And the prices are amazing for the quality.

Service was just fabulous as well.  One anecdote to prove my point...when clearing our table, a waiter accidentally sloshed a little olive oil on my sleeve.  Not only did he apologize profusely, but he also immediately filled my wine glass and brought a complimentary tiramisu to the table.  To top it off, he also discretely brought over  his card and asked to send the cleaning bill to him.  My shirt was truly unharmed by the incident (and didn't need more than just a run in the washing machine), but I was just so impressed at how professionally the whole situation was handled.  Little mistakes like this are inevitable when dining out, but the true test of good customer service is how they are resolved!
author: Leslie H.

description: Milano offers the warmth of a neighborhood Trattoria with the food quality of a four star Italian restaurant. Come once and you'll have a great experience, two or three times and you're family. It gets crowded so reservations are pretty much required. Courses can come out slowly so probably not a good a place for quick pre-show meal. Figure a very worth-it $35-$50 a person for a meal with wine, antipasta, and dessert.
author: Bill S.

description: My sister brought me here for a congratulations dinner on getting my first job after graduating. Started with the carpaccio. Yummy. My favorite was the Gnocchi. Probably the best Gnocchi I've had. We also tried a squash ravioli. I didn't really like it. Maybe because I don't like squash? Yeah that's it. Dessert was a Tiramisu. Really good and a semolina and almond cake. Wasn't really great. Service was wonderful though.
author: Juliane N.

description: good piping hot ravioli...so fresh....chicken moist and flavorful...meal after drinks and enjoying...friendly service and another bottle of wine to chug...putting an end to the night...indulgent dinner and wine $124 for two people...
author: Hen A.

description: I LOVED this place. It definitely beats any Italian restaurant I've been to in North Beach.  It has traditional Northern Italian fare.  It's always a plus and good sign if everyone working in the joint is Italian.  It makes you feel like you're really back in Italy :) My date ordered the Fusili pasta (the curly kind) with broccoli rabe and that was insanely delicious.  The perfect amount of olive oil, butter, and broccoli.  The leftovers were just as good at home a couple days later after adding some Danish butter to it!  I can't even remember what I ordered, but I believe it was veal marsala...Not that memorable, but that fusili pasta, amazing. It was a special for the evening, so if they're offering it, ORDER THAT! We finished off with the tiramisu which was better than any other tiramisu I've had in SF.
author: Jenny W.

description: Food, service, atmosphere, location--all in good taste.  It's clear the owner has made a conscious decision to keep almost all the entrees under $20 and, therefore, the diner gets a real deal here.  All the food is comfortably first rate and would go for at least twice as much at other restaurants who might boast Italian of the same quality.  But Ristorante Milano is relaxed and confident in every aspect of the dining experience, and it feels good to be there squished up a little too intimately with other diners, perhaps, but those who are also enjoying themselves.  Delectable pasta.
author: Eartha K.

description: OK so I went back last night.  For the tiramisu, duh!  It tasted just as good as I thought.  Grazie, Milano.
author: Alina C.

description: This is a very cute, small restaurant in Russian Hill. We started with some kind of veal scallopini which was sooooooo good, the beef was raw and served with delicious and perfectly dressed arugula that provided the perfect amount of bite to each mouthful. I had the risotto for my main which was not as good but still quite serviceable. It was a seafood risotto and I found it a bit watery with not enough creaminess. I would highly recommend this place for dates.
author: Cathy T.

description: I went here with my sisters and a friend for a birthday celebration and we had a good time. The Food was pretty good and the service was super! besides the place being a bit crowed (we were knocking chairs with the table behind), everything else was a-ok!
author: meL Z.

description: I've lived in Oakland for more than 10 years now and am frustrated by the lack of decent eateries.  For some reason  Oakland can't seem to get its act together as far as cuisine is concerned.  Driving by Milano,  I was curious to see if the legacy could be disproved so I decided to pop in for lunch.  It was practically empty (a bad sign) and those folks that were there didn't seem too happy.  Nevertheless,  I went in anyway.  The waiter was a nice guy but seemed to be a little on the bored side.  The owner was there as well,  keeping one eye on the customers and the other on the napkins that he was folding.  I decided to keep it nice and simple so I ordered the caprese salad and a seafood risotto.  I figured that any Italian place worth its salt couldn't possibly mess this up.  The caprese arrived and looked fairly typical.  Unfortunately the looks and the taste did not exactly coincide with each other.  The Balsamic vinegar was thick and syrupy  and,  in my opinion,  slightly bitter.  The tomatoes were hard to cut, under-ripe and too thick.  Finally,  the basil was bitter and not at all basil-tasting.  I have to add a lot of salt and pepper just to mask the bitterness.  On to the risotto... It was undercooked.  Risotto should be creamy and rich.  This one was undercooked and grainy,  not a texture that I was expecting.  It was also bland so I had to add more salt and pepper to give it flavor.  I should have asked for Parmesan cheese but it didn't occur to me at the time.  The waiter should have asked me at the beginning if I wanted some.  The seafood (shrimp,  clams,  muscles) were fairly decent but the muscles were a little on the fishy side which made me question their freshness.  I usually don't do restaurant reviews but I was pretty disappointment with this place.   I guess part of me was really hoping to discover an unhidden gem in Oakland that could dispel the bad-food reputation that this City has.  Milano is in a great location and with drastic improvements, could really knock em dead with their food and service but I don't think that the $38 I spent on lunch today (including 2 beers) was worth it.  Milano,  are you listening? Get your act together!
author: Brian Divina M.

description:
milano is great. i've been there several times. definitely some of the best italian in SF...it isn't on columbus either.
great service, good wine list. not the best decor...but if you're in it for the food, this place is amazing.
author: Eli A.

description: I've been coming to Ristorante Milano for almost 10 years now and I've never been disappointed.  I brought a date here the other night and it dawned on me that I should really write a review!  It's simple, delicious, reasonably priced italian food.  It's the kind of food you might think you can make, then you try and realize how difficult it is to make simplicity taste so good.  The fegatini is an all time favorite, as is the lasagna and tonorelli (sp?).  Keep the deliciousness coming, Aldo!
author: Albert B.

description: A great find!  This is definitely one of the places I miss most now that I no longer live in Nob Hill.  I love trying new places in SF, but this restaurant keeps me coming back.  When I do go to a restaurant more than once,  I usually just get the same entree...why mess with a good thing?  At Milano, I was adventurous to try something different each time and was blown away all 5 times. The food is most important, but service and ambiance are also key.  The wait staff always welcomes us with a smile and makes great recommendations.  I love when they recite the specials...a tremendous list where everything sounds delicious! It's really the most adorable restaurant.  It's inviting, comfortable, and not too loud - everyone is having a good time but also able to enjoy conversation without yelling. Make sure to make reservations and give yourself time to find parking!
author: Pei L.

description: ok i am torn about righting this review. on one hand i want everyone in the world to know about this place and on the other hand i want  to keep it to myself. a business associate friend told me that if i was in san francisco that i need to go by his friends place for  dinner. i said sure why not so i called  before my trip and set a date and time for dinner.  first no one knew about the place. locals cabs, people at the hotel . so i was a bit uneasy lets say. we got their about 10 minutes early and they took care of us right away. the girl that was taking care of us was great and must be related to do such a great job. my wife had the lasagna and i had the veal . it was great . we had some other items also and it was all some of the best italian food we have ever had . and we have had some great italian food. i can't give this place 5 stars because it is much more than that . to you bob that you for telling me about your friend alto's place  !!!
author: Terry L.

description: A group of us had dinner at Ristorante Milano based on someone telling us it was the best italian restaurant in San Francisco...sad to say, it was not.  The food was good but expensive, the waitress was wonderful, wine list was okay...all in all, a disapointment, and we've experienced better for the price.  We all agreed that we would not go out of our way to visit the restaurant again, but if in the neighborhood might stop in.
author: Scott C.

description: This is the resto with the 80's looking sign @ Pacific and Larkin - In fact my boyfriend calls it the 80's restaurant. We came here last valentines day and it really was a very nice dining experience. Everything we ordered was divine and the wait staff really took care of us. Would recommend this place highly if you're looking for a cozy little Italian resto in Russian Hill.
author: Sadia J.

description: Get the gnocchi. Just do it! Forget the low carb diet for the night and eat the best gnocchi outside of Italy.
author: Keith R.

description: This is my first Yelp review, and it had to be this place because it's my current favorite restaurant in SF.  Friendly service, cozy atmosphere, and the food is wonderful (there's a special place in my heart for the butternut squash ravioli).  I also love the location - just off the beaten path on a residential street.  If you're not lucky enough to live in the neighborhood, definitely leave your car at home because parking is not a possibility!
author: Anna S.

description: I enjoyed the quality of the food. The prices are a bit high, but the staff is highly knowledgeable about the food they serve. The restaurant itself is small and become cramped. Besides that, i'd give this place a try if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Wil M.

description: A friend from out of town found this place from yelp and made dinner reservation.  I went w/o too much expectation because I had never heard of this hidden place with a nothing special name for an italian restaurant.  But, oh, dear.  How I was surprised and impressed with the wine selection, home made pasta, and fresh fruit sorbet...The setting is classy and welcoming (although parking was difficult).  The staff was also very helpful who made good and honest suggestion.  I'll never think of pasta the same way.
author: Vivian H.

description: small but cozy. foodwas good by the fresh ingredients used. staff was friendly. parking sucks of course for that area.
author: Ray E.

description: for spare the air day, it was nice to take a break and enjoy the great gnocchi pomodoro! just had a craving for gnocchi and went with a friend to catch up and she just loved this place too!!! Best to take a bus to get part of the way and then take that healthy 10 minute walk up the hill. Service was warm and friendly and glad to just enjoy some yummy italian pasta! Heard its been here for years...parking is virtually non-existent on this narrow street. (Temperature from the earlier part of the day made it kind of stuffy, but once the outside temperature cooled down, became much more comfortable...Just a two day heat spell..making up for the cold and rainy May2006.)
author: miriam b.

description: Pretty good... the best part of the experience was the tiramisu - a must have if you eat here. It's very delicate, light and flavorful, and perfectly chilled. We also had the caprese salad for our starter which is pretty good, served with some cured olives making it a bit different (in a goood way). The home made fettuccine with meat sauce was pretty good. If you're thinking about going on a Saturday night, shoot for earlier as it gets pretty full and busy right away. Overall, I like it and it's worth a go.
author: Brian B.

description: A caveat: I came here for Valentine's Day and, clearly, they could not handle the volume of lovers streaming through the door.  Our first course took 45 minutes to appear, cold.  The owner was very apologetic and had our orders redone, and then they were pretty good.  The much-lauded gnocchi was indeed quite good, but, dare I say, might have wanted for a touch more chewiness, as it rather turned to mush in the mouth.  I had the saltimbocca which was underwhelming.  Perhaps my expectations were too high after reading all the reviews?  Or perhaps it's simply not a good choice for v-day.
author: Zoe V.

description: I was just there with my wife and 15 yr old son.  We had a reservation but it was on the early side and really didn't need it.  There's no need to repeat all the great comments from the previous reviewers...we really enjoyed our meal.  In fact it was the best meal we had while visiting SF (other than Mama's for breakfast that same morning!)  I highly recommend it.
author: Rob B.

description:
Disappointing:  overpriced, lacking flavor
Contrary to the many raves here, our visit was underwhelming.  The shellfish risotto was awful: chewy, and totally lacking fish flavor.  The shellfish with it were tasteless. I thought it was some leftover rice that they threw some scallops and mussels on.   I would have sent it back but a friend in our party had also ordered it and she was too shy to confront the waiter.  The fish linguini  was barely passable.
The overly theatrical Italian accent of the waiter was silly.

See also:  review by "special K."  5/1/06
author: Bob R.

description: Comfortable atmosphere, very friendly and warm service..our waiter, Rafael was serving most of the restaurant and you would never have known based upon his calm personality...and then there's the food!  Grilled calamari on white beans with a wonderful citrus flavor, chicken livers skewered with smokey bacon alongside grilled endive with a balsamic reduction was so delicious and flavorful with nice snaps of texture...oxtail alongside rigatoni in a light tomato sauce tasted rich and decadent..even the house chianti complimented all the flavors in a way that only made me wonder when I could come back for my next meal.  This place was slap-it good!  (A packed neighborhood restaurant on a Monday night is also an indication of how loyal their following must be...make a reservation!)
author: James P.

description: Was in from out of town and was looking for a restaurant to take a client.  Found Milano via Yelp and it did not disappoint.  One of the Best. Meals. Ever.  Pasta appetizer was incredible. Chicken Saltimbocco was deelish.  And the tiramisu was out of this world.  The place was packed (always a good sign). The service was great and will definitely be back the next time I'm in SF.
author: Ken L.

description:
i, too, had the problem of waiting for our table - and then having two groups of 4 seated ahead of us. we were promptly served a glass of wine. so, i was ok. just consider this might occur and plan your shoes accordingly. 

butternut squash ravioli - incredible.
lasagna - really amazing
tiramisu - yum

but, don't tell your friends. just take the out of town guests here.
author: Heidi L.

description: A lovely restaurant on a somewhat quiet street with great great ambience. Really like the fact that they have tables on the "loft" level which you get the best view of the place. Tables on this level are quite close to each other but it just makes it a more intimate environment. Service is very friendly and unpretentious. Food is delicious and the best is Tiramisu, Bar None! Great place to impress someone!
author: T L.

description: Lasagna!!!! Love it. One of my favorite neighborhood spots. Small and intimate. Service is friendly and efficient. Wine list is perfect. Not overwhelming. All pasta dishes have been very good.
author: Jim A.

description:
charming, quaint, intimate restaurant.   friendly staff & service.  my favorite italian restaurant (disclaimer -- i don't usually go out for italian, have gone to very few, so limited italian restaurant experience).  

hub & i always come here for our usual *(except on valentines day -- see below)
- upon seating, serves good foccaccia, great dipping in olive oil & balsamic vinegarette
- nice glass of sangiovese or chianti
- i get the fresh homemade gnocchi with gorgonzola & cream sauce -- rich, creamy & tasty sauce, tender dumplings
- hub gets grilled chicken breast w/endive drizzled w/balsamic vinegar and shallots -- thin chicken filet but very tasty, endive & shallots compliments  the chicken
