- sweeeet spots =P -- tiramisu -- absolutely d-lish & d-vine, so moist & creamy...........

came here for valentines this year & disappointed we could not get our usual as they had the valentine's day special menu. we started off with the mushroom bruschetta -- bread was too hard, hub got steak -- too dry, over done, i got ono fish -- didn't care for it.  this was our most disappointing experience with regards to the food.  despite the busy day, staff continued to be friendly & attentive.   

so we'll just stick to our usual...........


*****UPDATE  11/2008

came here last month & sad to say....don't love it the way i used to.   they no longer serve the gnocchi w/gorgonzola sauce......the main reason i used to love going here.   they still serve gnocchi but i believe its w/ a tomato cream sauce, which is not the same.   the charbroiled chicken is still good, that's my hub's usual.  but since they no longer serve the gnocchi the way i loved it......there's no reason for me to return.

moreover, the last time we were there....we didn't really enjoy our dining experience....our tables were just too close to each other, we were rubbing elbows with the tables next to us & we were in their conversation even though we really didn't want to be -- there was 1 particular annoying person at that table which wouldn't have bothered us if the tables weren't so close.....
author: Cindi N.

description: I liked it. server was nice and hospitable (my water was often empty though) and the food was very tasty and came out very fast. I only tried the sausage, tomato and cream sauce dish because my friend and i both got it, but it tasted good. we also had the Tiramisu which was very delicious and came in a huge piece. we didn't even finish it and I'm Asian, so I've been taught to finish everything.
author: Katherine F.

description:
a classic SF italian ristorante.  tucked off the corner from hyde street... just close enough to hear a cable car rumble by once per glass of wine.  i love how the layout is built into the side of Russian Hill with a loft area given a few lucky diners a bird's eye perch.

The waitstaff could not be more friendly... and the ample specials of the day test their recall.  i went with the gnocchi and harnessing all my will power, i was able to resist licking the bowl clean.  what manners.

the bread was average at best, but hey, did you really want to fill up on all those empty carbs.  did my mom just write that last sentence?  darn!

buon appetito!
author: Kevin F.

description:
What a great menu. What a great staff. What a great place to eat!

I was very impressed by the short yet very extravagent menu. They've got all the bases covered - and they do it well. Everything we ordered was perfect.
author: Bubba M.

description: Great service and great food! Cannot go wrong ordering anything on menu! There were 8 ppl in our party and each had a different item from the menu (pasta, lamb, chicken, salmon, grilled calimari). Had Tiramisu for dessert...fabulous! Hole in the wall atmosphere; great home-y feeling. Will definitely go back for more.
author: Cary B.

description: This is where I tired gnocchi for the first time and it was so yummy! The atmosphere was very nice, the place was not too expensive, and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I totally recommend it!
author: Sharon P.

description: Wonderful night and great food.  We were looking for authentic and had lots of choices...we chose one of the best.  Don't miss it.
author: Chris P.

description: I can't add anything more that hasn't already been reported by other reviewers other than to say I wholeheartedly agree with the other 5 star reviews.  Yes, the circa 80's sign can be a little off putting at first, but this is hands down the *best* Italian food in the city.
author: Suepattra M.

description: Teenytiny cute, and decor totally out of the 80s. Beyond that the food is seriously good traditional Italian, by that I don't mean hiding everything under a thick layer of cheese like most North Beach restaurants, it's traditional in the best sense of everything made lovingly by hand. I'm so going back for my own plate of hand-made pasta. We shared this delish creamy pancetta ziti dish that so delish, I was cleaning the plate with my bread after.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Cozy, small Italian restaurant.  Food is excellent but it's pricey.
author: o o.

description: If it were just about the food, I would give this place 4 stars. Good italian, but not mouth-dropping astonishment. BUT, the service was so outstanding, I give it 5 stars. Grabbed dinner here with expectations small enough to match the size of the establishment, but was really surprised. The carpaccio appetizer was truly yummy... very thinly sliced and just so tasty. Entree was the halibut. It was very tender and lemony light. Gnocchi in the "pink" sauce - mixture of the cream sauce and the marinara, was excellent. I'll definitely go back to Milano for a good italian meal and incredible service.
author: Anna S.

description: This place has got me craving Italian food lately.  The food here is wonderful and unique.  We had a large group and ate family style so I had the pleasure of trying the gnocchi, beet ravioli, mozarella salad, mushroom risotto, and tiramisu...all of which were amazing.  My favorite was the risotto, but I loved having them all.  Not your typical Italian food, way more special.  The atmosphere was inviting and tastful too, the people were extra warm.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Simply amazing to be honest, I came twice, and always find out that the simplest products, but cooked perfectly, are the best! and pretty cheap for that quality I have to admit.
author: Romain L.

description: The Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa was incredible.  The wine was very good.  The Lasagne was bland and the mozzarella appetizer was okay at best.  If you order the right things this place could easily become one of your favorite places in SF, but make sure you read enough reviews to know what to order.
author: Chris T.

description: The food here is excellent.  Classic, elegant Italian dishes, all cooked perfectly.  Simple and delicious.  I am kind of a freak about lighting, so of course I would change theirs.  The ambiance is nothing to speak of, but the restaurant is very clean and comfortable, if perhaps a tad too bright.  If you live in the neighborhood,  consider yourself lucky.  If you are nearby, this is the kind of place you want to visit frequently, get to know the staff, try every dish and every bottle of wine.
author: Amme P.

description: I had the gnocchi which was decent and plain, but not excellent. Considering the combination of a cramped size of the restaurant and the plainness of the food, I think the rating is adequate.
author: Nader A.

description: Sorry folks, I just don't see it/taste it.
author: T-Bone L.

description: It is very small but they have some of the best italian I've found in the city... And we adored our waitress.. she was very helpful and sweet.
author: K R.

description: My husband and I were in SF for a couple of days before going to Sonoma. This place was recommended by a fellow co-worker then by someone we met in line getting our rental car. We were stupid to think we could walk to the restaurant from Fisherman's Wharf. After walking up a few hills we made it and it was so worth it. We are from the Providence RI area where there are many wonderful Italian restaurants. Wish this one was here. As italians, we immediately we felt at home with the family owned establishment. My husband had the fig wrapped in prosciutto app. It was the first time he didn't speak while eating. I did try it and it was fabulous. Melt in your mouth. Service was perfect, even though the waitress/daughter seemed upset when our app plates had not been removed as she brought the entrees. Owner walked around asking how everything was. I love that. My husband had the Veal Saltimbocca and ended with fig gelatto for desert. I had the gnocchi with gorgonzola and ended with espresso sorbetto. OMG. Simple but wonderful. Thank you for a wonderful Anniversary dinner Milano's!
author: A D.

description: Simple, delicious, amazing! I went here for dinner on my birthday, and they gave me tiramisu with a candle in it. I highly recommend it, but make sure you have a reservation. We were there on a Thursday night at 8pm, and had to wait 10 minutes for our (reserved) table! But it was well worth it.
author: Veronica B.

description: This place is funny because the 80s awning makes it look so unappealing, however, I think that may be to my advantage bc it is such a mini place that has such fabulous food.  The prices are reasonable, and now I am new to SF but it seems to me that this menu is extensive compared to many other restaurants in the area!  I had the Chicken saltimboca..fabulous!  My finace had the butternut squash ravioli, it is probably one of the best I have ever tasted.  We will DEFINITELY go bacK!!
author: Jaime C.

description: Very enjoyable, despite the cramped quarters. Good international wine list. No wait and a great table with an 8 p.m. Saturday reservation (when does that happen?). Almost stole an elderly couple's cab on the way out.
author: Brian M.

description: My husband and a couple of close friends came here for a birthday dinner.  We had to wait about 20 minutes before anyone asked us what we'd like to drink.  I had even suggested walking out....but i'm so glad we stayed.  Our waiter was not only incredibly hot and very very nice, but the food was outstanding.  We each had a different dish, and all were magnificent.  The wine we chose was perfect.  The deserts were all homemade, and the most delicious things ever.  You have to try the peach desert if you go.  One of the best italian meals i've had in SF.
author: chrissy k.

description: I had a fantastic time here. The vibe was just what I wanted in a small Italian place. Charming, cozy, and friendly.  The food was delicious and out water was extremely charismatic and attentive. Great spot for a date.
author: Justin B.

description: My husband and I have two children and don't have many date nights, so when we do it's a big treat and I want an amazing meal/experience.  We got a babysitter and were really looking forward to this restaurant after their amazing reviews.  We had a 7:30 reservation.  We arrived early (45 mins) early and told them we were here, we decided to grab a drink next door while we waited as it seemed we couldn't get in earlier.  We went for a drink and came back promptly for our reservation.  We waited in the cramped entry way and waited, and waited.  I started to get annoyed when other couples were being seated while we are hovering over the other guests trying to enjoy their meal.  AND we had a reservation.  The most annoying part is the host would come tell us in a lovely Italian voice, "your next, don't worry, your next".  Yeah right.  By 8:15 WE WERE NOT NEXT!  I was so annoyed, we walked out and spent our time and money elsewhere.  Thanks for slightly ruining date night.  Be prepared to wait and wait, even if you have a reservation.  I don't know if the food is any good because we never got to that part.
author: Julie D.

description: Love this hidden Italian eatery.  Service is great, food is good.
author: Max C.

description: Great place, excellent homemade Italian food. Everything I've had/tried there has been melt in your mouth great! Even my VERY Italian bf loved the food..which is a big task, since he is used to his mother's amazing and very authentic Italian cooking!
author: Brenna R.

description: Excellent pasta dishes. We tried Fettucine alla Ghiotta and Puttanesca and we love them. Very tight space and somewhat slow service though.
author: Julia G.

description: this place used to be 3.5 stars in my book.  now it's 2.  we've just crossed this off the list of places in the neighborhood to eat.  the food is just mediocre--too salty and no other flavor? check.  weird combinations that sound interesting and taste poopy?  check.  it tastes like a suburban italian restaurant.  that's no good.
author: K H.

description: Very good.  EXCELENT Italian.  Very cozy spot and great for friends.  Nuff said.
author: Ryan E.

description: I drove up to the city to have dinner with my friend who was visiting from LA. I was pretty excited to have dinner at Ristorante Milano because I have heard rave reviews about the excellent food from one of my co-workers awhile back already. Ristorante Milano is a cute little neighborhood Italian restaurant where you go to have great food and wine with great company. The restaurant is located in Nob Hill where there is absolutely no parking! Be smart and park a few blocks down at the Jug Shop (corner of Polk and Pacific). They have some sort of deal made with the restaurant so that you can park there. I wanted to order the Linguine ai Frutti di mare, but since we were there pretty late, all they had left were clams. So they whipped up a linguine, clam, and white wine sauce dish for me. It was delicious. I loved how they used fresh linguine! The sauce was very light and delicate. The Pinot Grigio I ordered went perfectly with my pasta. Our waiter was also very cute. He had a very cute Italian accent. All in all, it was a very nice dinner with exceptional food in a relaxed setting.
author: Patricia L.

description: One of the city's best kept secrets. I have been going here for 10+ years. The grilled calamari, the lasagna, the bruschetta, there are just so many great meals to choose from. Oh, and if you dont try the tiramisu, you are doing yourself a great disservice!
author: Not M.

description: Had an early dinner here and was wowed by the food and the personal and personable service. We got there right when the place opend (5:30pm), took a seat by the window, and commenced a really enjoyable dinner. Our waiter was really friendly and reminded my wife and I of the waiters we met in the Amalfi Coast on our honeymoon. our appetizers were the calamari (grilled, nicely done. Not tough/chewy at all), and a Dungeness Crab salad. The homemade gnocchi with tomato sauce was great, and my veal scallopini was perfectly done. We'll be back...
author: Scott M.

description: The food is solid - not spectacular - but 3.5 stars good.  The salads are nothing to write about, but the pastas are delicious.  Very little atmosphere, but a great place to go if you're in the neighborhood and craving some solid pasta.  Parking is a nightmare.  The service is good.  Nothing special, but a good solid Italian place.
author: Christina S.

description: great lil spot i ordered the mixed grill and tomatoes linguine...both very tasty...been here many more times now and the pasta i think is hand pulled.  It is very small true....but it is quaint- and true you can hear the stories of the disgustingly pompous guy next to your table talking about his Ferrari and his house and his money....
author: Rob C.

description:
Now, whenever you hear the phrase "feels like you're at home", this place is an commendable example of this.  Just like at home, there are some snafu's as well.  It's like you're going over Uncle Guido's house:  its loud, its fun, its crowded, but it tastes good.  Not a perfect evening per se, but a very tasty and memorable one.  

Just like going to my cousin house, we call him 'Mario Crumb-Buns', you get a warm welcome from the owner...Aldo.  He's very pleasant and makes sure you feel like you walked into his personal living room.  We had reservations at 8pm and being that it's a tiny place, it's almost impossible to time the tables perfectly, so we had to wait about 20 minutes, but we didn't mind.  *Note, there is barely enough room in the entrance way to wait, so either bundle up with warm clothes and wait outside or fear the urge to hate tight spaces. Oh and the bathroom?....I felt just like Gulliver, shipwrecked and washed ashore finding myself inside a beach side bathroom on the island of Lilliput.  If you were 2 feet tall, you'd think the bathroom was a bit cramped.  So think how anyone of "normal" size feels.  So if you seem like you should be a contestant on the "Biggest Loser", you better relieve yourself before. Even if you don't eat here, stop by for a pee and experience this masterpiece of toilet dimension.  Truly interesting.  

So the Food and service:  We had sweet sausage with lentils and a salad with barrata(sp?) cheese.  It was good, not great.  The bread they give you table side is focaccia, but it's dry and seems stale.  Our main courses were very good.  Pork Tenderloins and my gf had the Lamb Chops.  Each was seasoned and cooked very well.  The service was great.  Fun and well informed wait staff that made us feel well taken care of.  The prices are VERY reasonable as well.  Most entres were under $15 and I still left food on the plate.  I talked with other Russian Hill frequenters while waiting for our table and they come to this place every two weeks.  Heard great things about the Lasagna, chicken, and fettuccini a la ghiotta.  

I will go again... but with completely empty bladder.  Ouch!
author: Vince C.

description:
This is the perfect Italian restaurant, small, intimate and unpretentious. The Tonnarelli alla Capricciosa is the housemade pasta in light cream sauce with porcini mushrooms and Italian sausage. I felt like the dog 'Snuffles', who when given a bisciut, would float up into the air making happy, contented sounds, then slowly drift back down. The earthy woody flavor of the Porcini mushrooms was so intense in this sauce. The pasta was cooked perfectly and had a nice chewy texture. Lasagne paled in comparison, but the layers of pasta were so light and airy. Mozzarella con peperoni is presented on soft pillows of grilled Polenta. We also shared a Radicchio salad that was dressed in a light citrus dressing. Being full did not stop us from ordering desserts. The Tiramisu is very good, but the prize here is one of the dessert specials, the Ricotta pie that has a hint of lemon. Waiters here are hotties. Grazie Milano!
We happened to have parking karma, but if you don't, pay $10 and park at the Jug shop and save yourself some headaches.
author: Arlene C.

description: Deep!  Went on a nite when the main chef was off. The food was still spectacular. Swordfish so fresh, tasty, tender, it was akin to sea bass in texture. Scaloppine di Vitello, perfecto. Fettucine al sugo di carne alla Milanese, the kids loved its simplicity and we loved the balance of meat, sauce, and pasta. Like the masters they are, everything was effortless, simple dining. A bit is kindness, special requests accomodated (created a shaved ice dessert for kids because the menu didn't fit kids taste) and we simply enjoyed the meal.
author: Mike F.

description: Frequented by many locals this trattoria features great service and excellent food.  Great date place.  Enough said!!
author: Keith S.

description: I can't believe I'm writing a review of this place...I'm being selfish because I ran across Milano not long after I moved to S.F. and it's one of the places that I take friends when they visit to show off how good of a restaurant city we live in. This is a true S.F. gem. It's tiny, and the sign outisde looks like the "Blade Runner"  movie poster, but damn it's good. Simple dishes made fresh at excellent prices and you won't find a more authentic place in the city. A great place to go with the parents or on an a chill date. Seek it out and you won't be let down by what you find.
author: Mike P.

description: This is the perfect neighborhood spot.  The food is delicious and moderately priced (The Fettucine alla Ghiotta is awesome!).  The wait staff is so friendly and actually remembers you.  I would definitely recommend this for a first date - easy, casual, great place without seeming like you're trying to hard :)
author: Sarah S.

description: Friendly staff.  Fantastic pastas.  Gnochi, tonnarelli and fettucine alla ghiotta are my faves.
author: Scott W.

description: This is our favorite Italian restaurant in SF!  It's authentic and the pasta dishes are homemade.  You can park on the parking lot for less than 10 on Polk and Pacific.  It's cozy, but not too romantic.  Some may say it's overpriced, but the pasta is worth it.  Other dishes are so-so.
author: Maggie C.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant. I've been here several times and it's always an excellent experience. The food is fabulous and service is wonderful. A little pricey, but definitely worth it. The restaurant is a little small, but that just adds to the atmosphere. No complaints at all - highly recommended.
author: Elzabeth G.

description:
okay, so this is a pretty outdated review but oh well, life's a bitch! 

so i ate here last year with one of my very good friends, who insisted that this is where we should be eating. we did and i was quite happy!

we started off with the mushroom crostini, which was alright but i don't think i would get again because it wasn't really my cup o tea. then i had just the regular ole' angel hair pasta, which was delicious! for desert we shared some sort of coffee flavoured shaved ice like thing. it was way too coffee for me, i almost died! 

the atmosphere and wait staff was really excellent and i can't wait to come back with my boyfriend, though i might just settle for a house salad and the angel hair pasta. keep it simple. keep it real!
author: Tara A.

description: Very good italian food for a great price! I love this spot.
author: Wais M.

description: Been here three times, most recently last weekend.  Consistently amazing.  They use fresh ingredients and just keep things simple.  They're also really, really friendly.  The owner stopped by our table three times just to make sure everything was going well.  This place feels like a neighborhood joint, but they deliver excellent quality at fairly reasonable prices.  I'm salivating thinking about it.
author: Graham M.

description: Super amazing food and phenomenal service. Loved the lasagna, appetizers and this juicy, tender chicken prepared in such a unique but pleasant way. Worth checking out
author: Felipe M.

description: Great place, great food, great service!!!  My only complaint, like someone else stated earlier, is the crowded space.  We were seated by the window and could hear everyone's conversation around us.  I think 1 or 2 tables should be removed.  Besides that, our waitress Susana, was awesome,  incredibly friendly and helpful.   Everything that she recommended was right on!  The homemade pastas are high quality.    Lasagna was wonderful and rich, the frutti de mare linguini was delish.   To top it all off:  The Tiramisu.  My husband absolutely detests this dessert.   We order just 1, since it was for me only.  He ate half of it.  Enough said!
author: Claudia H.

description:
Last night was the 12th time I ate at Milano, and for someone who treks through town to find the next new favorite restaurant, that's no small feat.  I am finally breaking down and writing a review because after few years being spoiled rotten with the epicurean scene in San Francisco I am still in love.

I love Ristorante Milano because of its straightforward in-your-face SIMPLE GOODNESS. Nothing is strange or "exotic". Every dish my companions and I ate were elegantly and solidly executed. They don't try anything overly complicated to bedazzle you, or go out of their way to sensationalize an unusual ingredient. They just do FOOD well. 

The gnocchi in house-made tomato cream sauce is so rich in flavor that makes you wonder how light and ethereal it is at the same time. The fettucine alla Ghiotta, tonnarelli alla Capricciosa, are all the familiar Italian flavors combined to become explosive than each ingredient alone.  Fegatini alla Griglia, skewers of chicken liver and smoked bacon on a bed of grilled radicchio is perfect (I suspect they brush the radicchio with bacon fat before grilling because how else would radicchio taste so good!?).  Scottata Milano, thin slices of beef barely cooked, sweet and tender paired with crisp and zesty arugula. 

If you decide to go, watch out for their specials, there will always be a few off-the-regular-and-specials-menu items.  I have had some great grilled petrole sole with arugula pesto sauce, roasted rabbit on creamy polenta, and risotta gamberi made with shrimp stock, safron and orange zest, off the menu. 

I read through other less-than-ethusiastic reviews. And I can only say: do not expect tortured food ingredients, or exotic pan-Mediterranean or Italian infused modern Californian cuisine that has pervaded San Francisco (Beretta, Incanto, SPQR, great restaurants that everybody who haven't tried should try). It's just solid good food!
author: t l.

description: I can't believe I didn't discover this place before as it's right around the corner from my house. The food is good, but even better is the ambiance. Felt like I was back in Italy for a meal. The mushroom and ricotta bruschetta were great.
author: Melissa G.

description: Delicious.  Very delicious.  If you enjoy veal I definitely recommend it here.  It is a small spot but not difficult to find.  The size of the restaurant it a little lacking and trying to wait outside when it is cold is not fun.  The waitress was a little sassy, but it made the evening even more enjoyable.  Dinner here with 6+ is definitely a problem without a reservation.
author: Chris S.

description: 01/29/2008: Upon entering the restaurant, you feel like you are being invited to a friend's house...homey, cozy, non-pretentious...one of those places where you know that you will come back even if the food wasn't spectacular...but what a parade of amazing dishes from start to finish! From the perfectly dressed salads, gnochhis to die for, sardines that melt in your mouth to the out of this world Ricotta Tart...My 2 friends from Japan were almost speechless...how about a branch in Tokyo Mr. Blasi? PS: Did I mention the incredible service?
author: Alex E.

description: A memorable dining experience. The pastas and fish are equal to what I've enjoyed in Italy.The intimate room is watched over by an attentive staff. Mr. Aldo's wine selection an outstanding Barolo was excellent . I will return soon to try  other dishes.
author: stephen s.

description: I went here with my dad and it was exactly what we wanted.  A long, lingering dinner with a great bottle of wine.  I ordered the butternut squash raviolis and they were good, although very rich.  Good if you have a lot of time and just want to sit and talk a while.
author: Leslie R.

description: Had a wonderful dinner here last night.  Ordered almost completely from the specials menu (other than salad).  The grilled calamari were the best I've ever tasted, and I'm not a huge calamari fan.  Insalata mista, while just mixed greens had a wonderfully light yet tasty dressing.  Had the lasagna special and it was arguably the best I've ever eaten.  Also a bottle of Sicilian white wine which was a very pleasant surprise. it's a very small place, but great food and friendly atmosphere
author: Vicki G.

description: My new favorite Italian spot...the gnocci and lasagna are so fresh and delicious. The service was fantastic. A hidden gem!!!
author: A D.

description: I love this place, ever since we came with friends a couple of years back. It just feels very authentic. The owner roams the room making sure everyone enjoys themselves, the food is delicious and inventive (our summer beet salad was superb!), and the bustling, energetic atmosphere makes you feel like you've been transported to Italy. Parking is a bit tough,  so give yourself an extra 15-20 minutes to find a spot. Enjoy!
author: Brook S.

description: I love this place!  One of the best old school Italian restaurants you'll find in the city.  The value you get here is better than most restaurants in the city.  The other night I ordered the ravioli del giorno that was made with a light tomato sauce that was perfect!  Not too heavy or overly done with basil.  I hope they're competing in the BIG tomato sauce competition at Sts Peter and Pauls Church in November called the Boss of the Sauce!
author: Rob D.

description:
Well, maybe two and a half.  Parking is really bad as noted by others, but that's not the restaurant's responsibility, and parking is discounted to $7 at one of two lots just a block away, a steal in that neighborhood.
Food:  OK but not stellar at these prices.  A "shaved fennel and romaine" salad ($8.95) was basically just chopped romaine (can easily be much more creative at home) bo-o-oring.  Among other entrees one in our party of six ordered a pasta dish with a very over-reduced cream sauce that made it look and taste like glue.  Another was my lamb chops, although perfectly cooked and tender (if a little cold), 2 small ones served on a large plate garnished with a couple of tiny cauliflower florettes, two cubes of roasted potatoes and one polenta triangle - at $22, it just didn't cut it; needless to say I left the restaurant still hungry, even though I did share an appetizer beforehand.  Another in the party ordered pork medallions with soft polenta, tasty and appealing but under-salted.  Forgot to mention the foccacia and olive oil (served only after we'd finished ordering), the extra-virgin OO was just delicious - high quality.  
Limited but nice wine list, reasonably priced.
Service:  My partner and I were about 15 minutes late for our 7 o'clock Saturday reservation (parking) but the 4 others were seated already, and even though the table where the 2 of us were to be seated had not yet been cleared and re-set (to be pushed a couple inches over to join the others after I managed to squeeze through to sit on the banquette) no more than mere minutes passed before our server was asking if we were ready to order - we weren't - and this happened several times until we finally gave in to the pressure.  And this type of rushing continued throughout the meal until our entree plates were snatched one by one the instant we had taken our last bite.  One person ordered dessert and others had coffee, and no sooner were those served that the check was promptly dropped on the table.  Not bad service, actually attentive considering that they were busy, but efficiently rushed.  The system is obviously in place to maximize seating and turnover in the small restaurant, as evidenced by the army of servers and bussers milling about - never seen so much staff in such a small restaurant before.
So, I hate to ruin the love-fest of the other reviewers, but in my opinion there are plenty of high-quality Italian restaurants in the Bay Area, not counting this one.  Wouldn't go back.
And another thing:  The NOISE LEVEL.  Couldn't hear most of what my friends were saying and had to shout to make myself heard; unbearibly loud.
BTW, the fleur de sel guy really needs to get a life!!!
author: MM L.

description: Great atmosphere and the best Gnocci I've had anywhere.  Make a reservation so that you don't have to wait.  The staff is friendly and it makes a great date spot or nice dinner with friends.
author: Joyanne R.

description:
This place is SO mediocre!  In my party of four we were ALL consistently let down by our meals -- and we picked all the recommendations of our server (lasagna, risotto, ravioli, and another mushroom pasta dish).

My butternut squash was flavorless (which I didn't know was possible with butternut squash) and sat in a pool of oil (it was supposed to taste like sage, but there was one tiny sage leaf swimming in the oil).

Even their homemade focaccia was dried out and lacked a satisfying texture.

Their service is good, but man, was it hard to say "Good" and smile politely when the server asked how we liked our meal.
author: Marta L.

description: You can't expect to eat better italian cooking in Italy! It was so delicious, I went ther 3 or 4 times in a year with friends and family. Everybody was unanimous, they never never ate a such good italian plate of their all entire life. Go and  don't forget to try their antipasti with an italian wine!
author: xavier b.

description: Excellent food.  I had one of the daily specials: a vegetarian lasagna. It was light and absolutely delicious. My friend had the gnocchi which he thought was superb as well.  Prices were also very reasonable. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: drew w.

description:
A very romantic restaurant. We were there for our engagement night and my fiancee loved the gnocchi. Melts in your mouth. Great service; thanks goes out to our waiter (can't remember his name) for making it such a memorable meal. Their dessert special for that evening was a poached pear with a small serving of pear sorbet. Unliked anything i've ever tasted! 

Would have given it 5 stars except for the fact that we were left standing for about 15 minutes before a maitre'd even acknowledged us. 

I'd go back again. 

X's and O's to my fiancee Christine. Looking forward to our next spectacular gastronomic experience.
author: Sinclair C.

description:
Went here on a Friday night and had made reservations for 8. The host said he thought they were at 8:30 so he was able to seat us after 15 mins - not too bad. We were able to sit in the back. The restaurant was incredibly warm. Be prepared for that - no sweaters. 

The waitress was friendly, authentic Italian, but took forever to come over and take our order. We ordered the Antipasto Misto. It was ok, had an olive and tomato salad, roasted red peppers, marinated mushrooms, and frittata, which was probably the best part. We both ordered the Insalata Mista which came out when we still had our appetizer, so we were a little cramped for table space.

They have a "fan club" for their gnocchi and I always debate whether I should get the gnocchi or not when I go out. I've never had great, fabulous gnocchi at a restaurant - always too mushy for me as gnocchi is typically potato-based and should be somewhat firm. It's tough to make - it's easy to overcook. So it was ok, not to die for, although the aurora sauce (cream and red sauce mixed to make pink, ie aurora) was fantastically rich and full of flavor. It was gorgonzola-based so very creamy and great! The tiramisu was delicious and almost as good as Mom's. Would definitely go back to explore other options on the menu.
author: Renee C.

description:
Simply the best, real deal, homemade, Italian food in town.  The fegatini -- grilled chicken liver appetizer is incredible.  Gnocchi are light little puffs, the best I've ever had.  Homemade pasta is delectable.  The ravioli are wonderful, and if you're there on the weekend, save me some lasagna.  You'll never go back to those big fat slabs of chewy noodles.  And you won't find better triamisu anywhere.  I've been going to Milano for over 20 years and both the food and the service are consistently excellent.
Aldo is the perfect host.  The service is knowledgeable, friendly and efficient.  
YOU CAN PARK in the lot a block and a half away for a few dollars -- a short walk after dinner is good for you!
author: E F.

description:
It took me about 24 hours upon returning from my honeymoon in Italy to get on yelp and search for "Best Pasta" in SF.  After some thorough reading, I settled on Ristorante Milano as they were known for homemade pasta and their menu contained my 2 pre-requisites for an Italian meal:  fetticini bolognese and linguine di mare.

Don't be fooled by Ristorante Milano's somewhat touristy banner, inside it's all comfy, cozy, family italian.  The owner-host, Aldo, will introduce himself, and we even scored the window seat table - all contributing to what I'd say was a 4-5 on the ambiance scale.

When it came time to order, I decided on the bruschetta special (which is just your standard issue bruscetta), and the linguine di mare.  My husband went for the fetticini with sausage and cream sauce (momentarily forgetting italian translation.)

Before our appetizers were served, we were given a large warm foccacia bread basket with olive oil to dip -  immediately my food review started strong.  Unfortunately, though, the bruscetta was slightly lacking, just standard tomatoes on over-toasted bread, which had gotten soggy.  Needed some salt, more olive oil, fresher bread.

Luckily, the linguine TOTALLY redeemed the bruscetta's short-comings.  It was perfectly imperfect, so hand made it even varied in thickness.  The sauce was perfect and the clams and muscles divine.  I only wish they had perhaps offered scallops or crabs as possible shellfish for the pasta.

My hubby loved his fetticini, and also raved about the home-made pasta.  We both agreed that in our 2 weeks in Italy we only went to 2 restaurants that made their pasta so well!

Would give this place a 5 star if it weren't for the bruscetta, but will definitely be back for the fetticini bolognese and a different appetizer, so don't be surprised if this review soon changes to a 5!
author: Casey M.

description: Amazing tonarelli!  I had to say that first... Place is great atmosphere with real Italians working there.  Feels like you could be in Italy.  My favorite Italian in the city.
author: p v.

description: We were visiting SF on vacation and came to yelp for help.  This place is as great as people say.  We're big on what you get for your money, and Ristorante Milano was a great value.  The neighborhood feel was fun and didn't feel touristy.  Our meals were excellent - zucchini and cauliflower soup was unique and tasty.  Their bruschetta was some of the best we've ever had (we get bruschetta every time we eat italian), the risotta was delightful and the portions were incredibly generous.  And yes, the gnocci is as good as everyone says it is!
author: Emily S.

description: Decent food but save yourself the time and walk a couple blocks to Nob Hill Cafe and thank me later.
author: Jake B.

description:
This place is terrible!  Don't eat here!  Please!

Ok, not really... This is my favorite neighborhood spot.  The service is great.  The owner is friendly and accomodating.  The food is delicious.

On the downside... Parking is impossible.  The space is rather small.

Now you understand my opening thoughts.  If everyone knew how good this place really was, it would be that much harder to have dinner there.  I'm sure you can understand....
author: John G.

description: Made our reservation through open table and it worked well. The table was ready and waiting for our party of three ladies. The gentleman who seated us really took are of our needs getting our wine to start as we read the menu, and called a cab for us at the end of our dinner. The pasta and Gnochi where excellent. The deserts where light and rich at the same time, very nice. It was the perfect neighborhood experience. It is tiny and space is at a premium but well done at the same time with linen tablecloths and excellent service. I would recommend this for travelers looking to get a local treat, also a romanitc dinner for two.
author: Meggie G.

description: Very pleasant, small, neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Food was well prepared and tasty.  Service was excellent.
author: Bruce L.

description: Wow! Great neighborhood gem! I've walked past this restaurant so many times but never went in because it always seems too busy. Thanks to OpenTable I got a reservation easily. Great service from beginning to end. Definitely fit for foodies! Can't wait to come back and try something else on the menu!
author: V V.

description: We found this place at the last minute after searching on Opentable and finding a late Friday night reservation - we felt we had discovered a great find.  All courses were excellent, the NoCal wine selection was solid, and we enjoyed the very Italian hospitality.  We look forward to going back soon.
author: Larry M.

description: Went back last week with a few cousins and tried the Linguine ai Frutti di mare. It was an excellent choice! All I have to say is Ristorante Milano is a perfect restaurant to dine if you're looking for good homemade  Italian food in San Francisco.
author: JL V.

description:
I came here with high hopes. I ordered the Gnocchi, and I was highly
disappointed.  They were the consistency of pieces of play dough cut up in small pieces. They were not soft, fluffy  and pillowy as they should be.  Perhaps it was a bad batch.
I am a Northern Italian and know exactly what Gnocchi should taste like. These were much too heavy and cut up a little too small. It was
obvious that the cook made the tubes too narrow and then, to top it
off, cut them sloppily where there were pieces of two Gnocchi still 
together. The Gnocchi were over-drenched in a fairly good tomato cream sauce, but the Gnocchi themselves were bland. I had a terrible case of indigestion within 15 minutes of leaving the place and it lasted for several hours. I felt like I had a huge clump of indigestible flour/potato matter stuck in my stomach! The Gnocchi were far  too heavy  and hard to digest. Based on these Gnocchi, I am giving this restaurant one star.  Also, the place has tight seating - so if you don't like others hearing all of your dinner conversations, this is not the place for you.The owner needs to go to "Bright Smile" - never saw such yellow, repulsive teeth!!
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: I've heard so much about Ristorante Milano and I'm happy to report that I finally had the opportunity to dine here this past weekend! After I landed in SFO, my fiance drove me up to his favorite little Italian spot on Pacific Avenue. When we first drove by there were still people waiting outside to eat around 9:30pm. When we got to the restaurant around 10pm it seemed like the line had cleared and people were finishing up with their dinners. We were able to get a table right away and immediately munching on their foccasia bread with olive oil. We started with the Insalata Mista and Crostini ai Funghi (bruschetta with sauted mushrooms and gorgonzola cheese) It ain't your typical bruchetta! It was really delicious. The sauted mushrooms and gorgonzola! Brilliant! I opted for lasagna (my usual) and it was really really good. Probably one of the best lasagnas ever! The meat sauce was so good! My fiance got Gnocchi con Salsa Aurora (his usual) and it was also really good. He says that Ristorante Milano has the best gnocchi in the country. It's definitely a hyperbole but we certainly have had our share of gnocchi and lasagna all over the place (including Italy) and I would say it's pretty high up there. Ristorante Milano is definitely a great neighborhood restaurant and wonderful Italian spot away from the touristy Little Italy area.
author: Julianne C.

description: thought this was a hidden gem? i guess not anymore after the 100+ reviews! our friends graciously took us here for dinner, one of their fav local places. the homemade pastas are amazing, consistency and chewiness is perfetto especially the TONNARELLI ALLA CAPRICCIOSA, pasta in light cream sauce w/ porcini mushrooms and italian sausage. the SCALOPPINE DI VITELLO, veal scaloppine w/ capers and lemon, that i ordered just didn't do it for me (prepared differently daily). stick w/ the pastas!
author: Jane Y.

description: Per Nish's recommendation, I checked out Ristorante Milano Saturday night.  Aldo, the owner, is an actively involved in your evening as he confirms the reservations and is there to welcome you.  I highly recommend the pasta dishes.   The meals are perfect size, everything we ordered was well prepared.  Attentive service.  The only downside is that the restaurant (like a lot of places in sf) is loud.  I would highly recommend this for a small group (2 or 4).
author: kimberly t.

description: The food is solid, the service is superb if you are served by that attentive Italian spoken young guy.  The atmosphere is warm.  I found the chicken liver is on the greasy side, although it is quite aromatic.  The mozzarella on palanto is very tasty.  We ordered two pasta, both good but not memorable.  I will definitely go back if I am in the neighborhood.
author: Josephine J.

description: great italian and wine, quaint area, and joyful service
author: Cass M.

description: Perfection!  We walked in without a reservation at 7:30 on a thursday night and were seated right away at a nice table in the back.  In fact, only two of the three of us were there and they allowed us to sit there for 15 minutes waiting and they brought us yummy bread in the meantime.  Finally when our friend arrived the waiter graciously explained an endless list of all wonderful sounding appetizers and entrees.  We ordered the beet salad and prosciutto and fig appetizers and a bottle of wine and were off.  Both appetizers were excellent and my butternut squash ravioli was delicious.  All pastas are made on-site daily.  We had such a nice leisurely dinner with just the right amount of attention from our server, it might be one of my new favorite places in the city.  Our bill for the three of us which included two apps, bottle of wine, additional glasses of wine (we are winos), and three entrees came out to be about 40 dollars each which is pretty great for what we got.
author: Lindsay P.

description: The food is absolutely delicious. I made reservations for four on a saturday night of which I definitely recommend. The gentleman who was greeting all the customers was very attentive to our needs and made sure that we were enjoying our stay at the restaurant. The waiter was friendly yet not too attentive. It was getting annoying after a while. I had  their special of which was polenta topped with seafood in a red sauce, which was absolutely delicious and the appetizer was a ball of mozzarella with assorted tomatoes in olive oil. It was extraordinary. My girlfriends ordered fettuccine with seafood, which one of them indicated that it fresh and was the best fettuccine she'd ever had. I would definitely go back, but I would go somewhere else for their desserts, I was not too impressed of their Profiteroles or their tiramisu. I have had better. But, definitely order their specials, of which I am glad that I did.
author: Bella I.

description: No, I am not Italian but I have been to Italy once or twice and I know what "real" Italian food tastes like and yes, Ristorante Milano is pretty damn close to the real thing.  I  have even taken a "real" Italian, yes, from Italy, and they were even impressed by this restaurant.  The food is very, very good....much better than anything in North Beach.  The place is small and you can hear others conversations but if you go to Italy the tables are even closer!!  Service is just like you would get in Italy....a little slower than your typical fast paced, speedy job anywhere else in the City.  Sit back, enjoy your wine, and slow down to enjoy the company of your other dinner guests and savor the experience.  Life if precious....
author: K J.

description: Ristorante Milano is one of those restaurants where as soon as you walk in, whether it's your first time dining or you're a seasoned regular, an immediate sense of familiarity washes over you, as if you walked into your favorite Italian aunt's kitchen. The staff treats you like a returning friend, the restaurant itself is cozy. . .and a description that many have used in their own reviews. . .charming. The food is a simple affair bursting with comforting and rustic flavors. Reservations are highly advisable . . .even though I sauntered in and was seated promptly without a reservation, that's only because I walked in at 6pm on a Sunday evening.  An hour later, the entire restaurant was filled, and I'm sure, a party of 2 waiting for their 7pm reservation, which table  we were occupying. This is an unassuming restaurant, one that you either need to know is located on Pacific or heard about through someone else. But after you dine here, you won't easily forget it.
author: Alice P.

description: i absolutely love this place!  excellent food (try the butternut squash ravioli), excellent service, and overall, just a fun, romantic little spot.
author: Amy K.

description: Went there last night from a recommendation of a friend.  Had 7:45 reservations when we got there they were packed and running  behind because of all the traffic that night into the city.  We were sitting outside and the owner came out apologized for the wait and went to get us a complimentary sparkling red wine which was delicious.  Once seated we ordered a nice bottle of a montepulciano  recommended by our waiter which was very good.  We started with the burrata, arugula, fennel salad which was a little bland but with a little salt it was really good.  The Burrata was smooth and delicious.  Then we had the grilled calamari with white cannellini beans which was also a little bland but with a touch of salt was also good.  The calamari was nicely grilled.  We finished with the house made linguine, capers, kalamata olives and anchovies, which was delicious.  I guess we like our food a little salty.  I would definitely go back, happy with the service and the food. Thanks for the great evening...
author: Steven K.

description: No negatives.  I just don't want everyone going there.  Okay, parking sucks, but where doesn't that happen in SF.  The best gnochhi in the City. Not tradition stomach bombers (potato), but ricotta gnochhi.  Light and tasty.  Has a great feel to the place.
author: AJ L.

description: went here while i was starting to get sick so i only had a few bites of the antipasti and one of my raviolis.  but it was a good bite.  not, however a stellar bite.  i gave four instead of three just because the place is so intimate and the atmosphere so cozy.  would be a nice place for a date, but even nicer for a long dinner with close friends.
author: Markus B.

description: Truely yummy italian cuisine... I came here with someone special and it was quite the eventful evening... as we were waiting to be seated, we found that there was a couple who were oddly together.. let's just say a young eastern european escort with a much older mature asian man.  It wasn't just that is was the odd couple, but she walked in with spandex coochie cutters with fishnet hoes, low cut slim fitting top and it was quite the scene when the ENTIRE restaurant was gawking at the couple walking by to be seated.  Back to the food, we sat down (happened to be right next to this "odd" couple) and ordered a nice bottle of sangria and our two delicious dishes.  Ristorante Milano first started us with fresh baked bread which seemed like focaccia bread but much softer and oh so yummy dipped in olive oil.  Our order was this delectable pasta dish which I can't remember the name, but it was apparent the noodles were homemade and it was perfect.  It was simmered in a cream sauce and maybe some mushrooms with small bits of meat mixed into the light cream sauce. The cream sauce was Not heavy and it was just so savory to the tongue.  I would definitly order that dish again.  The other dish was a veal dish which was just as savory and had a little side of mushrooms and greens.  Very tastey, but not sure I would order that particular dish again.  Over all, it was excellent.  Now back to the "odd" couple... it was funny, when the man walked up from the table... as soon as he left the "escort" started to CHOW down on her food... yes, I'm sure it could have been because she was very hungry, god only knows she sure works for it, but at the same respect... a part of me believes she knew how tastey her dish was.
author: Jenn C.

description: ive never been a fan of what i call old school italian.  i guess my palate is too california new age.  old school italian was always too heavy and too monotonous. but then i tried ristorante milano, and i have to admit, their homemade pastas won me over.  i even liked my dinner companion's fish of the day!  fish in an old school italian restaurant has always been a recipe for dissapointment in my experience, but it was prepared just right.  the tiramisu was straight as an arrow and did not disappoint.  if you're like me and frown when friends suggest going to eat italian, give ristorante milano a try.  you will be pleasantly surprised!  and yes..... i plan on going back.
author: Curtis Y.

description: I thought my very reserved parents (who don't get out much) might be overwhelmed by the "cozy" seating arrangements, having to wait for a table and the boisterous atmosphere -- I was wrong.  They had a great time and loved the food -- they practically licked their plates clean.  My parents had the Linguine ai Frutti di Mare and the Tonnarelli alla Capriccio.  They both received heaping portions and raved about how tasty their meals were.  I don't think my parents spoke the entire meal, they were too busy eating.  My husband ordered the Lasagna (with a white cream sauce) and I ordered the ravioli.  They were good, but we both kept eyeing my parents' plates.  For dessert, we ordered the Tiramisu and the Pan di Mandorle, which were both delicious.  All in all, had a very enjoyable experience.  We only had to wait 10 minutes for our table, the waitstaff was extremely attentive and accomodating and the food was great!!  This is definitely a keeper.
author: Karen K.

description:
i still dont get how yelp rates the prices. this place is more like 3 $ signs.

but worth it. neighborhood feel. friendly. homemade pasta. we felt like we had gone to Italy. a nice little escape in the neighborhood. will definitely go back.
author: Yelper S.

description: Hmm... maybe I ordered the wrong thing.  We had an 8:30 reservation for 2, we were seated over 20 minutes late.  The waiter lacked personality and the hostess made no attempt to make up for the late seating with a drink or appetizer.  How is a restaurant Italian without a Cesar salad on the menu?  Almost 40 minutes after placing our order, our food came.  We shared, what looked to be an amazing Dungeness crab salad with a Meyer lemon vinaigrette --- there were two pieces of shell in the salad and the dressing overpowered the crab's taste.  For entres, my friend had the fettuccine with tomato sauce and olives.  She said the noodles were a bit starchy and just OK.  I had the risotto, and was reminded why I prefer to make it at home.  Overly starchy --- they must have not sealed the Arborio rice with oil properly, and the mushroom taste became so bland and repetitive with no other interesting flavors to cut it.  Once finished, we waited another 20 minutes for the check... I won't be going back.
author: Jared F.

description: Went there last night for dinner.  The place is nice and cozy and the food was good, very authentic Italian.  Without drinks, meal for 2 for dinner was about $45, pretty ok for SF Authentic Italian joint.  It's a good place if you want real (non americanized) Italian food.  Enjoy!!
author: Girlie G.

description: Their gnocchi was amaazing. But that's about all I have to say. We were in a private dining room secluded from everyone else so maybe that's why I'm not too into it. I actually thought the waiter was really impatient and he was not helpful at all in suggesting menu selections.
author: Judy L.

description: While the atmosphere is cozy and the wine is flowing, Milano was not all that it was cracked up to be... maybe it was because our waiter kept reminding us that it was his first night, maybe it's because he actually poured himself (and proceeded to shoot) a glass of our wine, or maybe it's because the food took FOREVER to make it to our back table, but something about Milano's wasn't right.  Maybe I'll need to give it another chance...
author: Anjali K.

description: This is a little jewel of a restaurant in San Francisco.  We have been there many times and always try to go when we are up from San Jose, CA.  It is small with only a dozen tables or so but the food is amazing, the servers are fun and friendly and attentive and the owner fawns over you.  The prices are reasonable also.  I think parking is impossible there (we took a cab in).  Cable car goes right by too.  Make reservations.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Joe B.

description: Absolutely amazing.  The food was perfect, as was the service.  And the tiramisu was probably the best that i have ever had.  The thing that I really love about it is that it's a nice, upscale resturant, but with a casual dress code.  So, while you can't go in your workout clothes, you don't have to break out the best suit
author: Ian B.

description: We'd heard this place was intimate with fabulous food. What I didn't know was that by intimate, they meant you were intimate with all your neighbours! The tables are crammed in this place, I felt like I was eating with the people next to us...BUT then the food came and I quickly forgot all of that. It was the best Italian food I've ever had. Amazing. Highly recommended.
author: Danielle S.

description: This is such a cute place!  It is tiny and charming---maybe a dozen or so tables.  The food was great-- their pastas are housemade and everyone in my party of six enjoyed their dishes.  I had the risotto which was perfectly cooked (not mushy).  The mushroom bruschetta and carpacchio were delicious, too.  Service was friendly.  This is the perfect spot if you're looking for a one-of-a-kind restaurant.
author: courtney o.

description: The food here is very good. Everything is very fresh and tasty. I dont mind to wait long time for the table. It's worth it!!!
author: Grace C.

description: The food is good, but service is poor.  I ate here a few times, and each time, the food is pretty good, but the service is slow and unimpressive.  You will get seated at least 30 minutes after your reservation, and you will wait at least that long for your food.  I would say that there are much better places to spend too much for poor service.
author: Mike C.

description: I gave this place a try last night and was expecting an amazing culinary treat based on the reviews.  It didn't quite live up to expectations (falling a bit short of incredible), but it was definitely some good Italian food and the staff there is really friendly, too.   We asked for the waiter's advice on wine.  He not only recommended a few, he let us taste them before we selected a bottle.  It was a great overall experience.
author: Lauren F.

description: An nice authentic Italian restaurant in the Russian Hill neighborhood.  The food is solid and the wait staff is friendly/effecient.  Not for those seeking fancy fare.  A relaxed atmosphere.  Forget about parking nearby.
author: Dan L.

description: Very small or intimate, depending on your preference, Italian restaurant tucked away in Nob Hill.  The linguini alfredo is very good.  The service is good too with the waitstaff being Italian or faking it very well.  If you can get a table by the window, it makes a huge difference otherwise you feel like you're sitting on top of one another in there.  They have parking at the Jug Shoppe on Pacific and Polk for those with cars.
author: Eric G.

description: I'm not sure why this place is rated so highly. The prices are astronomical and the portions are miniscule. Don't be fooled by the two dollar signs, this place can run you $25+ just for a single dish after tax and tip. The Ravioli del Giorno came with 7 pieces of regular sized bland ravioli... I was expecting a bit more for $16. The $18 Risotto was not much better in terms of taste. The only saving grace was the Fettucine alla Ghiotta and Grigliata Mista which tasted quite good. However I will paraphrase the other reviewer who said the prices are highway robbery. I don't mind paying a lot for good food, but would it kill them to make their portions bigger so customers can feel like they are getting something in return? I don't think it would hurt their already huge profit margins much. The dining area is also ridiculously small and crammed full of tables until there is barely any room to walk around. Just take one look at their so called 'bathroom' (am I on an airplane?) and you will understand. They need to pony up and rent a larger restaurant for the prices they are charging. After we passed on desert, our waitress mysteriously stopped coming around to our table and we had to wait 20+ minutes to get our check.
author: M. W.

description: I'm pissed and rightfully so....here's what happened. I went to Ristorante Milano with a good friend to catch up over yummy wine and food at one of my favorite spots.  I had been here many times and was never let down by the food though the service lacks in promptness. My friend and I enjoyed our appetizer, two entrees, and bottle of wine UNTIL the owner asked us for our table. We had paid the bill literally a minute beforehand when he turned to four people waiting for our 2 person table and said (in a voice we could hear)...."I don't know what's going on, they paid so long ago." My friend and I were finishing up a half glass of wine each after we paid the bill....then the owner came up to the table (mind you, this is less than 5 minutes after paying the bill) and asked us to leave. Unbelievable. It was incredibly rude-----so rude that I will NEVER eat there again. He obviously doesn't know the value of "word of mouth" and customer satisfaction--shame on him for being greedy and looking to make the immediate dollar. Little does he know that mistake will cost him a lot more than 10 minutes lost on a table....
author: Lauren H.

description: great food, great friendly atmosphere (and REAL Italians working there), but service was a bit slow. food was excellent and wine was good as well.
author: marcie d.
